225/**
226 * Regions store data for a certain region of a table. It stores all columns for each row. A given
227 * table consists of one or more Regions.
228 * <p>
229 * An Region is defined by its table and its key extent.
230 * <p>
231 * Locking at the Region level serves only one purpose: preventing the region from being closed (and
232 * consequently split) while other operations are ongoing. Each row level operation obtains both a
233 * row lock and a region read lock for the duration of the operation. While a scanner is being
234 * constructed, getScanner holds a read lock. If the scanner is successfully constructed, it holds a
235 * read lock until it is closed. A close takes out a write lock and consequently will block for
236 * ongoing operations and will block new operations from starting while the close is in progress.
237 */
238@SuppressWarnings("deprecation")
239@InterfaceAudience.Private
240public class HRegion implements HeapSize, PropagatingConfigurationObserver, Region {
241  private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(HRegion.class);

396  // The internal wait duration to acquire a lock before read/update
397  // from the region. It is not per row. The purpose of this wait time
398  // is to avoid waiting a long time while the region is busy, so that
399  // we can release the IPC handler soon enough to improve the
400  // availability of the region server. It can be adjusted by
401  // tuning configuration "hbase.busy.wait.duration".

439  // Context: During replay we want to ensure that we do not lose any data. So, we
440  // have to be conservative in how we replay wals. For each store, we calculate
441  // the maxSeqId up to which the store was flushed. And, skip the edits which
442  // are equal to or lower than maxSeqId for each store.

464  /**
465   * @return The smallest mvcc readPoint across all the scanners in this region. Writes older than
466   *         this readPoint, are included in every read operation.
467   */
468  public long getSmallestReadPoint() {
469    // We need to ensure that while we are calculating the smallestReadPoint
470    // no new RegionScanners can grab a readPoint that we are unaware of.
471    smallestReadPointCalcLock.lock(ReadPointCalculationLock.LockType.CALCULATION_LOCK);
472    try {
473      long minimumReadPoint = mvcc.getReadPoint();
474      for (Long readPoint : this.scannerReadPoints.values()) {
475        minimumReadPoint = Math.min(minimumReadPoint, readPoint);
476      }
477      return minimumReadPoint;
478    } finally {
479      smallestReadPointCalcLock.unlock(ReadPointCalculationLock.LockType.CALCULATION_LOCK);
480    }
481  }
482
483  /*
484   * Data structure of write state flags used coordinating flushes, compactions and closes.
485   */
486  static class WriteState {
487    // Set while a memstore flush is happening.
488    volatile boolean flushing = false;
489    // Set when a flush has been requested.
490    volatile boolean flushRequested = false;
491    // Number of compactions running.
492    AtomicInteger compacting = new AtomicInteger(0);
493    // Gets set in close. If set, cannot compact or flush again.
494    volatile boolean writesEnabled = true;
495    // Set if region is read-only
496    volatile boolean readOnly = false;
497    // whether the reads are enabled. This is different than readOnly, because readOnly is
498    // static in the lifetime of the region, while readsEnabled is dynamic
499    volatile boolean readsEnabled = true;
500
501    /**
502     * Set flags that make this region read-only.
503     * @param onOff flip value for region r/o setting
504     */
505    synchronized void setReadOnly(final boolean onOff) {
506      this.writesEnabled = !onOff;
507      this.readOnly = onOff;
508    }
509
510    boolean isReadOnly() {
511      return this.readOnly;
512    }
513
514    boolean isFlushRequested() {
515      return this.flushRequested;
516    }
517
518    void setReadsEnabled(boolean readsEnabled) {
519      this.readsEnabled = readsEnabled;
520    }
521
522    static final long HEAP_SIZE = ClassSize.align(ClassSize.OBJECT + 5 * Bytes.SIZEOF_BOOLEAN);
523  }

525  /**
526   * Objects from this class are created when flushing to describe all the different states that
527   * that method ends up in. The Result enum describes those states. The sequence id should only be
528   * specified if the flush was successful, and the failure message should only be specified if it
529   * didn't flush.
530   */
531  public static class FlushResultImpl implements FlushResult {
532    final Result result;
533    final String failureReason;
534    final long flushSequenceId;
535    final boolean wroteFlushWalMarker;
536
537    /**
538     * Convenience constructor to use when the flush is successful, the failure message is set to
539     * null.
540     * @param result          Expecting FLUSHED_NO_COMPACTION_NEEDED or FLUSHED_COMPACTION_NEEDED.
541     * @param flushSequenceId Generated sequence id that comes right after the edits in the
542     *                        memstores.
543     */
544    FlushResultImpl(Result result, long flushSequenceId) {
545      this(result, flushSequenceId, null, false);
546      assert result == Result.FLUSHED_NO_COMPACTION_NEEDED
547        || result == Result.FLUSHED_COMPACTION_NEEDED;
548    }
549
550    /**
551     * Convenience constructor to use when we cannot flush.
552     * @param result        Expecting CANNOT_FLUSH_MEMSTORE_EMPTY or CANNOT_FLUSH.
553     * @param failureReason Reason why we couldn't flush.
554     */
555    FlushResultImpl(Result result, String failureReason, boolean wroteFlushMarker) {
556      this(result, -1, failureReason, wroteFlushMarker);
557      assert result == Result.CANNOT_FLUSH_MEMSTORE_EMPTY || result == Result.CANNOT_FLUSH;
558    }
559
560    /**
561     * Constructor with all the parameters.
562     * @param result          Any of the Result.
563     * @param flushSequenceId Generated sequence id if the memstores were flushed else -1.
564     * @param failureReason   Reason why we couldn't flush, or null.
565     */
566    FlushResultImpl(Result result, long flushSequenceId, String failureReason,
567      boolean wroteFlushMarker) {
568      this.result = result;
569      this.flushSequenceId = flushSequenceId;
570      this.failureReason = failureReason;
571      this.wroteFlushWalMarker = wroteFlushMarker;
572    }
573
574    /**
575     * Convenience method, the equivalent of checking if result is FLUSHED_NO_COMPACTION_NEEDED or
576     * FLUSHED_NO_COMPACTION_NEEDED.
577     * @return true if the memstores were flushed, else false.
578     */
579    @Override
580    public boolean isFlushSucceeded() {
581      return result == Result.FLUSHED_NO_COMPACTION_NEEDED
582        || result == Result.FLUSHED_COMPACTION_NEEDED;
583    }
584
585    /**
586     * Convenience method, the equivalent of checking if result is FLUSHED_COMPACTION_NEEDED.
587     * @return True if the flush requested a compaction, else false (doesn't even mean it flushed).
588     */
589    @Override
590    public boolean isCompactionNeeded() {
591      return result == Result.FLUSHED_COMPACTION_NEEDED;
592    }
593
594    @Override
595    public String toString() {
596      return new StringBuilder().append("flush result:").append(result).append(", ")
597        .append("failureReason:").append(failureReason).append(",").append("flush seq id")
598        .append(flushSequenceId).toString();
599    }
600
601    @Override
602    public Result getResult() {
603      return result;
604    }
605  }
606
607  /** A result object from prepare flush cache stage */
608  protected static class PrepareFlushResult {
609    final FlushResultImpl result; // indicating a failure result from prepare
610    final TreeMap<byte[], StoreFlushContext> storeFlushCtxs;
611    final TreeMap<byte[], List<Path>> committedFiles;
612    final TreeMap<byte[], MemStoreSize> storeFlushableSize;
613    final long startTime;
614    final long flushOpSeqId;
615    final long flushedSeqId;
616    final MemStoreSizing totalFlushableSize;
617
618    /** Constructs an early exit case */
619    PrepareFlushResult(FlushResultImpl result, long flushSeqId) {
620      this(result, null, null, null, Math.max(0, flushSeqId), 0, 0, MemStoreSizing.DUD);
621    }
622
623    /** Constructs a successful prepare flush result */
624    PrepareFlushResult(TreeMap<byte[], StoreFlushContext> storeFlushCtxs,
625      TreeMap<byte[], List<Path>> committedFiles, TreeMap<byte[], MemStoreSize> storeFlushableSize,
626      long startTime, long flushSeqId, long flushedSeqId, MemStoreSizing totalFlushableSize) {
627      this(null, storeFlushCtxs, committedFiles, storeFlushableSize, startTime, flushSeqId,
628        flushedSeqId, totalFlushableSize);
629    }
630
631    private PrepareFlushResult(FlushResultImpl result,
632      TreeMap<byte[], StoreFlushContext> storeFlushCtxs, TreeMap<byte[], List<Path>> committedFiles,
633      TreeMap<byte[], MemStoreSize> storeFlushableSize, long startTime, long flushSeqId,
634      long flushedSeqId, MemStoreSizing totalFlushableSize) {
635      this.result = result;
636      this.storeFlushCtxs = storeFlushCtxs;
637      this.committedFiles = committedFiles;
638      this.storeFlushableSize = storeFlushableSize;
639      this.startTime = startTime;
640      this.flushOpSeqId = flushSeqId;
641      this.flushedSeqId = flushedSeqId;
642      this.totalFlushableSize = totalFlushableSize;
643    }
644
645    public FlushResult getResult() {
646      return this.result;
647    }
648  }

652   */
653  static class ObservedExceptionsInBatch {
654    private boolean wrongRegion = false;
655    private boolean failedSanityCheck = false;
656    private boolean wrongFamily = false;
657
658    /** Returns If a {@link WrongRegionException} has been observed. */
659    boolean hasSeenWrongRegion() {
660      return wrongRegion;
661    }
662
663    /**
664     * Records that a {@link WrongRegionException} has been observed.
665     */
666    void sawWrongRegion() {
667      wrongRegion = true;
668    }
669
670    /** Returns If a {@link FailedSanityCheckException} has been observed. */
671    boolean hasSeenFailedSanityCheck() {
672      return failedSanityCheck;
673    }
674
675    /**
676     * Records that a {@link FailedSanityCheckException} has been observed.
677     */
678    void sawFailedSanityCheck() {
679      failedSanityCheck = true;
680    }
681
682    /** Returns If a {@link NoSuchColumnFamilyException} has been observed. */
683    boolean hasSeenNoSuchFamily() {
684      return wrongFamily;
685    }
686
687    /**
688     * Records that a {@link NoSuchColumnFamilyException} has been observed.
689     */
690    void sawNoSuchFamily() {
691      wrongFamily = true;
692    }
693  }

695  final WriteState writestate = new WriteState();

697  long memstoreFlushSize;
698  final long timestampSlop;
699
700  // Last flush time for each Store. Useful when we are flushing for each column
701  private final ConcurrentMap<HStore, Long> lastStoreFlushTimeMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
702
703  protected RegionServerServices rsServices;
704  private RegionServerAccounting rsAccounting;
705  private long flushCheckInterval;
706  // flushPerChanges is to prevent too many changes in memstore
707  private long flushPerChanges;
708  private long blockingMemStoreSize;
709  // Used to guard closes
710  final ReentrantReadWriteLock lock;
711  // Used to track interruptible holders of the region lock. Currently that is only RPC handler
712  // threads. Boolean value in map determines if lock holder can be interrupted, normally true,
713  // but may be false when thread is transiting a critical section.
714  final ConcurrentHashMap<Thread, Boolean> regionLockHolders;
715
716  // Stop updates lock
717  private final ReentrantReadWriteLock updatesLock = new ReentrantReadWriteLock();
718
719  private final MultiVersionConcurrencyControl mvcc;
720
721  // Coprocessor host
722  private volatile RegionCoprocessorHost coprocessorHost;
723
724  private TableDescriptor htableDescriptor = null;
725  private RegionSplitPolicy splitPolicy;
726  private RegionSplitRestriction splitRestriction;
727  private FlushPolicy flushPolicy;
728
729  private final MetricsRegion metricsRegion;
730  private final MetricsRegionWrapperImpl metricsRegionWrapper;
731  private final Durability regionDurability;
732  private final boolean regionStatsEnabled;
733  // Stores the replication scope of the various column families of the table
734  // that has non-default scope
735  private final NavigableMap<byte[], Integer> replicationScope =
736    new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
737
738  private final StoreHotnessProtector storeHotnessProtector;
739
740  protected Optional<RegionReplicationSink> regionReplicationSink = Optional.empty();
741
742  /**
743   * HRegion constructor. This constructor should only be used for testing and extensions. Instances
744   * of HRegion should be instantiated with the {@link HRegion#createHRegion} or
745   * {@link HRegion#openHRegion} method.
746   * @param tableDir   qualified path of directory where region should be located, usually the table
747   *                   directory.
748   * @param wal        The WAL is the outbound log for any updates to the HRegion The wal file is a
749   *                   logfile from the previous execution that's custom-computed for this HRegion.
750   *                   The HRegionServer computes and sorts the appropriate wal info for this
751   *                   HRegion. If there is a previous wal file (implying that the HRegion has been
752   *                   written-to before), then read it from the supplied path.
753   * @param fs         is the filesystem.
754   * @param confParam  is global configuration settings.
755   * @param regionInfo - RegionInfo that describes the region is new), then read them from the
756   *                   supplied path.
757   * @param htd        the table descriptor
758   * @param rsServices reference to {@link RegionServerServices} or null
759   * @deprecated Use other constructors.
760   */
761  @Deprecated
762  public HRegion(final Path tableDir, final WAL wal, final FileSystem fs,
763    final Configuration confParam, final RegionInfo regionInfo, final TableDescriptor htd,
764    final RegionServerServices rsServices) {
765    this(new HRegionFileSystem(confParam, fs, tableDir, regionInfo), wal, confParam, htd,
766      rsServices);
767  }
768
769  /**
770   * HRegion constructor. This constructor should only be used for testing and extensions. Instances
771   * of HRegion should be instantiated with the {@link HRegion#createHRegion} or
772   * {@link HRegion#openHRegion} method.
773   * @param fs         is the filesystem.
774   * @param wal        The WAL is the outbound log for any updates to the HRegion The wal file is a
775   *                   logfile from the previous execution that's custom-computed for this HRegion.
776   *                   The HRegionServer computes and sorts the appropriate wal info for this
777   *                   HRegion. If there is a previous wal file (implying that the HRegion has been
778   *                   written-to before), then read it from the supplied path.
779   * @param confParam  is global configuration settings.
780   * @param htd        the table descriptor
781   * @param rsServices reference to {@link RegionServerServices} or null
782   */
783  public HRegion(final HRegionFileSystem fs, final WAL wal, final Configuration confParam,
784    final TableDescriptor htd, final RegionServerServices rsServices) {
785    if (htd == null) {
786      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Need table descriptor");
787    }
788
789    if (confParam instanceof CompoundConfiguration) {
790      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Need original base configuration");
791    }
792
793    this.wal = wal;
794    this.fs = fs;
795    this.mvcc = new MultiVersionConcurrencyControl(getRegionInfo().getShortNameToLog());
796
797    // 'conf' renamed to 'confParam' b/c we use this.conf in the constructor
798    this.baseConf = confParam;
799    this.conf = new CompoundConfiguration().add(confParam).addBytesMap(htd.getValues());
800    this.cellComparator = htd.isMetaTable()
801      || conf.getBoolean(USE_META_CELL_COMPARATOR, DEFAULT_USE_META_CELL_COMPARATOR)
802        ? MetaCellComparator.META_COMPARATOR
803        : CellComparatorImpl.COMPARATOR;
804    this.lock = new ReentrantReadWriteLock(
805      conf.getBoolean(FAIR_REENTRANT_CLOSE_LOCK, DEFAULT_FAIR_REENTRANT_CLOSE_LOCK));
806    this.regionLockHolders = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
807    this.flushCheckInterval =
808      conf.getInt(MEMSTORE_PERIODIC_FLUSH_INTERVAL, DEFAULT_CACHE_FLUSH_INTERVAL);
809    this.flushPerChanges = conf.getLong(MEMSTORE_FLUSH_PER_CHANGES, DEFAULT_FLUSH_PER_CHANGES);
810    if (this.flushPerChanges > MAX_FLUSH_PER_CHANGES) {
811      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
812        MEMSTORE_FLUSH_PER_CHANGES + " can not exceed " + MAX_FLUSH_PER_CHANGES);
813    }
814    int tmpRowLockDuration =
815      conf.getInt("hbase.rowlock.wait.duration", DEFAULT_ROWLOCK_WAIT_DURATION);
816    if (tmpRowLockDuration <= 0) {
817      LOG.info("Found hbase.rowlock.wait.duration set to {}. values <= 0 will cause all row "
818        + "locking to fail. Treating it as 1ms to avoid region failure.", tmpRowLockDuration);
819      tmpRowLockDuration = 1;
820    }
821    this.rowLockWaitDuration = tmpRowLockDuration;
822
823    this.smallestReadPointCalcLock = new ReadPointCalculationLock(conf);
824
825    this.isLoadingCfsOnDemandDefault = conf.getBoolean(LOAD_CFS_ON_DEMAND_CONFIG_KEY, true);
826    this.htableDescriptor = htd;
827    Set<byte[]> families = this.htableDescriptor.getColumnFamilyNames();
828    for (byte[] family : families) {
829      if (!replicationScope.containsKey(family)) {
830        int scope = htd.getColumnFamily(family).getScope();
831        // Only store those families that has NON-DEFAULT scope
832        if (scope != REPLICATION_SCOPE_LOCAL) {
833          // Do a copy before storing it here.
834          replicationScope.put(Bytes.copy(family), scope);
835        }
836      }
837    }
838
839    this.rsServices = rsServices;
840    if (this.rsServices != null) {
841      this.blockCache = rsServices.getBlockCache().orElse(null);
842      this.mobFileCache = rsServices.getMobFileCache().orElse(null);
843    }
844    this.regionServicesForStores = new RegionServicesForStores(this, rsServices);
845
846    setHTableSpecificConf();
847    this.scannerReadPoints = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
848
849    this.busyWaitDuration = conf.getLong("hbase.busy.wait.duration", DEFAULT_BUSY_WAIT_DURATION);
850    this.maxBusyWaitMultiplier = conf.getInt("hbase.busy.wait.multiplier.max", 2);
851    if (busyWaitDuration * maxBusyWaitMultiplier <= 0L) {
852      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid hbase.busy.wait.duration (" + busyWaitDuration
853        + ") or hbase.busy.wait.multiplier.max (" + maxBusyWaitMultiplier
854        + "). Their product should be positive");
855    }
856    this.maxBusyWaitDuration =
857      conf.getLong("hbase.ipc.client.call.purge.timeout", 2 * HConstants.DEFAULT_HBASE_RPC_TIMEOUT);
858
859    /*
860     * timestamp.slop provides a server-side constraint on the timestamp. This assumes that you base
861     * your TS around EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime(). In this case, throw an error to the user
862     * if the user-specified TS is newer than now + slop. LATEST_TIMESTAMP == don't use this
863     * functionality
864     */
865    this.timestampSlop =
866      conf.getLong("hbase.hregion.keyvalue.timestamp.slop.millisecs", HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP);
867
868    this.storeHotnessProtector = new StoreHotnessProtector(this, conf);
869
870    boolean forceSync = conf.getBoolean(WAL_HSYNC_CONF_KEY, DEFAULT_WAL_HSYNC);
871    /**
872     * This is the global default value for durability. All tables/mutations not defining a
873     * durability or using USE_DEFAULT will default to this value.
874     */
875    Durability defaultDurability = forceSync ? Durability.FSYNC_WAL : Durability.SYNC_WAL;
876    this.regionDurability = this.htableDescriptor.getDurability() == Durability.USE_DEFAULT
877      ? defaultDurability
878      : this.htableDescriptor.getDurability();
879
880    decorateRegionConfiguration(conf);
881    if (rsServices != null) {
882      this.rsAccounting = this.rsServices.getRegionServerAccounting();
883      // don't initialize coprocessors if not running within a regionserver
884      // TODO: revisit if coprocessors should load in other cases
885      this.coprocessorHost = new RegionCoprocessorHost(this, rsServices, conf);
886      this.metricsRegionWrapper = new MetricsRegionWrapperImpl(this);
887      this.metricsRegion = new MetricsRegion(this.metricsRegionWrapper, conf);
888    } else {
889      this.metricsRegionWrapper = null;
890      this.metricsRegion = null;
891    }
892    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
893      // Write out region name, its encoded name and storeHotnessProtector as string.
894      LOG.debug("Instantiated " + this + "; " + storeHotnessProtector.toString());
895    }
896
897    configurationManager = null;
898
899    // disable stats tracking system tables, but check the config for everything else
900    this.regionStatsEnabled = htd.getTableName().getNamespaceAsString()
901      .equals(NamespaceDescriptor.SYSTEM_NAMESPACE_NAME_STR)
902        ? false
903        : conf.getBoolean(HConstants.ENABLE_CLIENT_BACKPRESSURE,
904          HConstants.DEFAULT_ENABLE_CLIENT_BACKPRESSURE);
905
906    this.maxCellSize = conf.getLong(HBASE_MAX_CELL_SIZE_KEY, DEFAULT_MAX_CELL_SIZE);
907    this.miniBatchSize =
908      conf.getInt(HBASE_REGIONSERVER_MINIBATCH_SIZE, DEFAULT_HBASE_REGIONSERVER_MINIBATCH_SIZE);
909
910    // recover the metrics of read and write requests count if they were retained
911    if (rsServices != null && rsServices.getRegionServerAccounting() != null) {
912      Pair<Long, Long> retainedRWRequestsCnt = rsServices.getRegionServerAccounting()
913        .getRetainedRegionRWRequestsCnt().get(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
914      if (retainedRWRequestsCnt != null) {
915        this.addReadRequestsCount(retainedRWRequestsCnt.getFirst());
916        this.addWriteRequestsCount(retainedRWRequestsCnt.getSecond());
917        // remove them since won't use again
918        rsServices.getRegionServerAccounting().getRetainedRegionRWRequestsCnt()
919          .remove(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
920      }
921    }
922
923    minBlockSizeBytes = Arrays.stream(this.htableDescriptor.getColumnFamilies())
924      .mapToInt(ColumnFamilyDescriptor::getBlocksize).min().orElse(HConstants.DEFAULT_BLOCKSIZE);
925  }
926
927  private void setHTableSpecificConf() {
928    if (this.htableDescriptor == null) {
929      return;
930    }
931    long flushSize = this.htableDescriptor.getMemStoreFlushSize();
932
933    if (flushSize <= 0) {
934      flushSize = conf.getLong(HConstants.HREGION_MEMSTORE_FLUSH_SIZE,
935        TableDescriptorBuilder.DEFAULT_MEMSTORE_FLUSH_SIZE);
936    }
937    this.memstoreFlushSize = flushSize;
938    long mult = conf.getLong(HConstants.HREGION_MEMSTORE_BLOCK_MULTIPLIER,
939      HConstants.DEFAULT_HREGION_MEMSTORE_BLOCK_MULTIPLIER);
940    this.blockingMemStoreSize = this.memstoreFlushSize * mult;
941  }
942
943  /**
944   * Initialize this region. Used only by tests and SplitTransaction to reopen the region. You
945   * should use createHRegion() or openHRegion()
946   * @return What the next sequence (edit) id should be.
947   * @throws IOException e
948   * @deprecated use HRegion.createHRegion() or HRegion.openHRegion()
949   */
950  @Deprecated
951  public long initialize() throws IOException {
952    return initialize(null);
953  }
954
955  /**
956   * Initialize this region.
957   * @param reporter Tickle every so often if initialize is taking a while.
958   * @return What the next sequence (edit) id should be.
959   */
960  long initialize(final CancelableProgressable reporter) throws IOException {
961
962    // Refuse to open the region if there is no column family in the table
963    if (htableDescriptor.getColumnFamilyCount() == 0) {
964      throw new DoNotRetryIOException("Table " + htableDescriptor.getTableName().getNameAsString()
965        + " should have at least one column family.");
966    }
967
968    MonitoredTask status =
969      TaskMonitor.get().createStatus("Initializing region " + this, false, true);
970    long nextSeqId = -1;
971    try {
972      nextSeqId = initializeRegionInternals(reporter, status);
973      return nextSeqId;
974    } catch (IOException e) {
975      LOG.warn("Failed initialize of region= {}, starting to roll back memstore",
976        getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString(), e);
977      // global memstore size will be decreased when dropping memstore
978      try {
979        // drop the memory used by memstore if open region fails
980        dropMemStoreContents();
981      } catch (IOException ioE) {
982        if (conf.getBoolean(MemStoreLAB.USEMSLAB_KEY, MemStoreLAB.USEMSLAB_DEFAULT)) {
983          LOG.warn(
984            "Failed drop memstore of region= {}, "
985              + "some chunks may not released forever since MSLAB is enabled",
986            getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString());
987        }
988
989      }
990      if (metricsTableRequests != null) {
991        metricsTableRequests.removeRegistry();
992      }
993      throw e;
994    } finally {
995      // nextSeqid will be -1 if the initialization fails.
996      // At least it will be 0 otherwise.
997      if (nextSeqId == -1) {
998        status.abort("Exception during region " + getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString()
999          + " initialization.");
1000      }
1001      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1002        LOG.debug("Region open journal for {}:\n{}", this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName(),
1003          status.prettyPrintJournal());
1004      }
1005      status.cleanup();
1006    }
1007  }
1008
1009  private long initializeRegionInternals(final CancelableProgressable reporter,
1010    final MonitoredTask status) throws IOException {
1011    if (coprocessorHost != null) {
1012      status.setStatus("Running coprocessor pre-open hook");
1013      coprocessorHost.preOpen();
1014    }
1015
1016    String policyName = this.conf.get(REGION_STORAGE_POLICY_KEY, DEFAULT_REGION_STORAGE_POLICY);
1017    this.fs.setStoragePolicy(policyName.trim());
1018
1019    // Write HRI to a file in case we need to recover hbase:meta
1020    // Only the primary replica should write .regioninfo
1021    if (this.getRegionInfo().getReplicaId() == RegionInfo.DEFAULT_REPLICA_ID) {
1022      status.setStatus("Writing region info on filesystem");
1023      fs.checkRegionInfoOnFilesystem();
1024    }
1025
1026    // Initialize all the HStores
1027    status.setStatus("Initializing all the Stores");
1028    long maxSeqId = initializeStores(reporter, status);
1029    this.mvcc.advanceTo(maxSeqId);
1030    if (!isRestoredRegion && ServerRegionReplicaUtil.shouldReplayRecoveredEdits(this)) {
1031      Collection<HStore> stores = this.stores.values();
1032      try {
1033        // update the stores that we are replaying
1034        LOG.debug("replaying wal for " + this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
1035        stores.forEach(HStore::startReplayingFromWAL);
1036        // Recover any edits if available.
1037        maxSeqId =
1038          Math.max(maxSeqId, replayRecoveredEditsIfAny(maxSeqIdInStores, reporter, status));
1039        // Recover any hfiles if available
1040        maxSeqId = Math.max(maxSeqId, loadRecoveredHFilesIfAny(stores));
1041        // Make sure mvcc is up to max.
1042        this.mvcc.advanceTo(maxSeqId);
1043      } finally {
1044        LOG.debug("stopping wal replay for " + this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
1045        // update the stores that we are done replaying
1046        stores.forEach(HStore::stopReplayingFromWAL);
1047      }
1048    }
1049    this.lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId = maxSeqId;
1050
1051    this.writestate.setReadOnly(ServerRegionReplicaUtil.isReadOnly(this));
1052    this.writestate.flushRequested = false;
1053    this.writestate.compacting.set(0);
1054
1055    if (this.writestate.writesEnabled) {
1056      LOG.debug("Cleaning up temporary data for " + this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
1057      // Remove temporary data left over from old regions
1058      status.setStatus("Cleaning up temporary data from old regions");
1059      fs.cleanupTempDir();
1060    }
1061
1062    // Initialize split policy
1063    this.splitPolicy = RegionSplitPolicy.create(this, conf);
1064
1065    // Initialize split restriction
1066    splitRestriction = RegionSplitRestriction.create(getTableDescriptor(), conf);
1067
1068    // Initialize flush policy
1069    this.flushPolicy = FlushPolicyFactory.create(this, conf);
1070
1071    long lastFlushTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1072    for (HStore store : stores.values()) {
1073      this.lastStoreFlushTimeMap.put(store, lastFlushTime);
1074    }
1075
1076    // Use maximum of log sequenceid or that which was found in stores
1077    // (particularly if no recovered edits, seqid will be -1).
1078    long nextSeqId = maxSeqId + 1;
1079    if (!isRestoredRegion) {
1080      // always get openSeqNum from the default replica, even if we are secondary replicas
1081      long maxSeqIdFromFile = WALSplitUtil.getMaxRegionSequenceId(conf,
1082        RegionReplicaUtil.getRegionInfoForDefaultReplica(getRegionInfo()), this::getFilesystem,
1083        this::getWalFileSystem);
1084      nextSeqId = Math.max(maxSeqId, maxSeqIdFromFile) + 1;
1085      // The openSeqNum will always be increase even for read only region, as we rely on it to
1086      // determine whether a region has been successfully reopened, so here we always need to update
1087      // the max sequence id file.
1088      if (RegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(getRegionInfo())) {
1089        LOG.debug("writing seq id for {}", this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
1090        WALSplitUtil.writeRegionSequenceIdFile(getWalFileSystem(), getWALRegionDir(),
1091          nextSeqId - 1);
1092        // This means we have replayed all the recovered edits and also written out the max sequence
1093        // id file, let's delete the wrong directories introduced in HBASE-20734, see HBASE-22617
1094        // for more details.
1095        Path wrongRegionWALDir = CommonFSUtils.getWrongWALRegionDir(conf,
1096          getRegionInfo().getTable(), getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
1097        FileSystem walFs = getWalFileSystem();
1098        if (walFs.exists(wrongRegionWALDir)) {
1099          if (!walFs.delete(wrongRegionWALDir, true)) {
1100            LOG.debug("Failed to clean up wrong region WAL directory {}", wrongRegionWALDir);
1101          }
1102        }
1103      } else {
1104        lastReplayedSequenceId = nextSeqId - 1;
1105        replayLock = new ReentrantLock();
1106      }
1107      initializeRegionReplicationSink(reporter, status);
1108    }
1109
1110    LOG.info("Opened {}; next sequenceid={}; {}, {}", this.getRegionInfo().getShortNameToLog(),
1111      nextSeqId, this.splitPolicy, this.flushPolicy);
1112
1113    // A region can be reopened if failed a split; reset flags
1114    this.closing.set(false);
1115    this.closed.set(false);
1116
1117    if (coprocessorHost != null) {
1118      LOG.debug("Running coprocessor post-open hooks for " + this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
1119      status.setStatus("Running coprocessor post-open hooks");
1120      coprocessorHost.postOpen();
1121    }
1122
1123    metricsTableRequests = new MetricsTableRequests(htableDescriptor.getTableName(), conf);
1124
1125    status.markComplete("Region opened successfully");
1126    return nextSeqId;
1127  }
1128
1129  private void initializeRegionReplicationSink(CancelableProgressable reporter,
1130    MonitoredTask status) {
1131    RegionServerServices rss = getRegionServerServices();
1132    TableDescriptor td = getTableDescriptor();
1133    int regionReplication = td.getRegionReplication();
1134    RegionInfo regionInfo = getRegionInfo();
1135    if (
1136      regionReplication <= 1 || !RegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(regionInfo)
1137        || !ServerRegionReplicaUtil.isRegionReplicaReplicationEnabled(conf, regionInfo.getTable())
1138        || rss == null
1139    ) {
1140      regionReplicationSink = Optional.empty();
1141      return;
1142    }
1143    status.setStatus("Initializaing region replication sink");
1144    regionReplicationSink = Optional.of(new RegionReplicationSink(conf, regionInfo, td,
1145      rss.getRegionReplicationBufferManager(), () -> rss.getFlushRequester().requestFlush(this,
1146        new ArrayList<>(td.getColumnFamilyNames()), FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY),
1147      rss.getAsyncClusterConnection()));
1148  }
1149
1150  /**
1151   * Open all Stores.
1152   * @return Highest sequenceId found out in a Store.
1153   */
1154  private long initializeStores(CancelableProgressable reporter, MonitoredTask status)
1155    throws IOException {
1156    return initializeStores(reporter, status, false);
1157  }
1158
1159  private long initializeStores(CancelableProgressable reporter, MonitoredTask status,
1160    boolean warmup) throws IOException {
1161    // Load in all the HStores.
1162    long maxSeqId = -1;
1163    // initialized to -1 so that we pick up MemstoreTS from column families
1164    long maxMemstoreTS = -1;
1165
1166    if (htableDescriptor.getColumnFamilyCount() != 0) {
1167      // initialize the thread pool for opening stores in parallel.
1168      ThreadPoolExecutor storeOpenerThreadPool =
1169        getStoreOpenAndCloseThreadPool("StoreOpener-" + this.getRegionInfo().getShortNameToLog());
1170      CompletionService<HStore> completionService =
1171        new ExecutorCompletionService<>(storeOpenerThreadPool);
1172
1173      // initialize each store in parallel
1174      for (final ColumnFamilyDescriptor family : htableDescriptor.getColumnFamilies()) {
1175        status.setStatus("Instantiating store for column family " + family);
1176        completionService.submit(new Callable<HStore>() {
1177          @Override
1178          public HStore call() throws IOException {
1179            return instantiateHStore(family, warmup);
1180          }
1181        });
1182      }
1183      boolean allStoresOpened = false;
1184      boolean hasSloppyStores = false;
1185      try {
1186        for (int i = 0; i < htableDescriptor.getColumnFamilyCount(); i++) {
1187          Future<HStore> future = completionService.take();
1188          HStore store = future.get();
1189          this.stores.put(store.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName(), store);
1190          if (store.isSloppyMemStore()) {
1191            hasSloppyStores = true;
1192          }
1193
1194          long storeMaxSequenceId = store.getMaxSequenceId().orElse(0L);
1195          maxSeqIdInStores.put(Bytes.toBytes(store.getColumnFamilyName()), storeMaxSequenceId);
1196          if (maxSeqId == -1 || storeMaxSequenceId > maxSeqId) {
1197            maxSeqId = storeMaxSequenceId;
1198          }
1199          long maxStoreMemstoreTS = store.getMaxMemStoreTS().orElse(0L);
1200          if (maxStoreMemstoreTS > maxMemstoreTS) {
1201            maxMemstoreTS = maxStoreMemstoreTS;
1202          }
1203        }
1204        allStoresOpened = true;
1205        if (hasSloppyStores) {
1206          htableDescriptor = TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(htableDescriptor)
1207            .setFlushPolicyClassName(FlushNonSloppyStoresFirstPolicy.class.getName()).build();
1208          LOG.info("Setting FlushNonSloppyStoresFirstPolicy for the region=" + this);
1209        }
1210      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1211        throw throwOnInterrupt(e);
1212      } catch (ExecutionException e) {
1213        throw new IOException(e.getCause());
1214      } finally {
1215        storeOpenerThreadPool.shutdownNow();
1216        if (!allStoresOpened) {
1217          // something went wrong, close all opened stores
1218          LOG.error("Could not initialize all stores for the region=" + this);
1219          for (HStore store : this.stores.values()) {
1220            try {
1221              store.close();
1222            } catch (IOException e) {
1223              LOG.warn("close store {} failed in region {}", store.toString(), this, e);
1224            }
1225          }
1226        }
1227      }
1228    }
1229    return Math.max(maxSeqId, maxMemstoreTS + 1);
1230  }
1231
1232  private void initializeWarmup(final CancelableProgressable reporter) throws IOException {
1233    MonitoredTask status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus("Initializing region " + this);
1234    // Initialize all the HStores
1235    status.setStatus("Warmup all stores of " + this.getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString());
1236    try {
1237      initializeStores(reporter, status, true);
1238    } finally {
1239      status.markComplete("Warmed up " + this.getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString());
1240    }
1241  }
1242
1243  /** Returns Map of StoreFiles by column family */
1244  private NavigableMap<byte[], List<Path>> getStoreFiles() {
1245    NavigableMap<byte[], List<Path>> allStoreFiles = new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
1246    for (HStore store : stores.values()) {
1247      Collection<HStoreFile> storeFiles = store.getStorefiles();
1248      if (storeFiles == null) {
1249        continue;
1250      }
1251      List<Path> storeFileNames = new ArrayList<>();
1252      for (HStoreFile storeFile : storeFiles) {
1253        storeFileNames.add(storeFile.getPath());
1254      }
1255      allStoreFiles.put(store.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName(), storeFileNames);
1256    }
1257    return allStoreFiles;
1258  }
1259
1260  protected void writeRegionOpenMarker(WAL wal, long openSeqId) throws IOException {
1261    Map<byte[], List<Path>> storeFiles = getStoreFiles();
1262    RegionEventDescriptor regionOpenDesc =
1263      ProtobufUtil.toRegionEventDescriptor(RegionEventDescriptor.EventType.REGION_OPEN,
1264        getRegionInfo(), openSeqId, getRegionServerServices().getServerName(), storeFiles);
1265    WALUtil.writeRegionEventMarker(wal, getReplicationScope(), getRegionInfo(), regionOpenDesc,
1266      mvcc, regionReplicationSink.orElse(null));
1267  }
1268
1269  private void writeRegionCloseMarker(WAL wal) throws IOException {
1270    Map<byte[], List<Path>> storeFiles = getStoreFiles();
1271    RegionEventDescriptor regionEventDesc = ProtobufUtil.toRegionEventDescriptor(
1272      RegionEventDescriptor.EventType.REGION_CLOSE, getRegionInfo(), mvcc.getReadPoint(),
1273      getRegionServerServices().getServerName(), storeFiles);
1274    // we do not care region close event at secondary replica side so just pass a null
1275    // RegionReplicationSink
1276    WALUtil.writeRegionEventMarker(wal, getReplicationScope(), getRegionInfo(), regionEventDesc,
1277      mvcc, null);
1278
1279    // Store SeqId in WAL FileSystem when a region closes
1280    // checking region folder exists is due to many tests which delete the table folder while a
1281    // table is still online
1282    if (getWalFileSystem().exists(getWALRegionDir())) {
1283      WALSplitUtil.writeRegionSequenceIdFile(getWalFileSystem(), getWALRegionDir(),
1284        mvcc.getReadPoint());
1285    }
1286  }

1288  /** Returns True if this region has references. */
1289  public boolean hasReferences() {
1290    return stores.values().stream().anyMatch(HStore::hasReferences);
1291  }

1293  public void blockUpdates() {
1294    this.updatesLock.writeLock().lock();
1295  }
1296
1297  public void unblockUpdates() {
1298    this.updatesLock.writeLock().unlock();
1299  }
1300
1301  public HDFSBlocksDistribution getHDFSBlocksDistribution() {
1302    HDFSBlocksDistribution hdfsBlocksDistribution = new HDFSBlocksDistribution();
1303    stores.values().stream().filter(s -> s.getStorefiles() != null)
1304      .flatMap(s -> s.getStorefiles().stream()).map(HStoreFile::getHDFSBlockDistribution)
1305      .forEachOrdered(hdfsBlocksDistribution::add);
1306    return hdfsBlocksDistribution;
1307  }
1308
1309  /**
1310   * This is a helper function to compute HDFS block distribution on demand
1311   * @param conf            configuration
1312   * @param tableDescriptor TableDescriptor of the table
1313   * @param regionInfo      encoded name of the region
1314   * @return The HDFS blocks distribution for the given region.
1315   */
1316  public static HDFSBlocksDistribution computeHDFSBlocksDistribution(Configuration conf,
1317    TableDescriptor tableDescriptor, RegionInfo regionInfo) throws IOException {
1318    Path tablePath =
1319      CommonFSUtils.getTableDir(CommonFSUtils.getRootDir(conf), tableDescriptor.getTableName());
1320    return computeHDFSBlocksDistribution(conf, tableDescriptor, regionInfo, tablePath);
1321  }
1322
1323  /**
1324   * This is a helper function to compute HDFS block distribution on demand
1325   * @param conf            configuration
1326   * @param tableDescriptor TableDescriptor of the table
1327   * @param regionInfo      encoded name of the region
1328   * @param tablePath       the table directory
1329   * @return The HDFS blocks distribution for the given region.
1330   */
1331  public static HDFSBlocksDistribution computeHDFSBlocksDistribution(Configuration conf,
1332    TableDescriptor tableDescriptor, RegionInfo regionInfo, Path tablePath) throws IOException {
1333    HDFSBlocksDistribution hdfsBlocksDistribution = new HDFSBlocksDistribution();
1334    FileSystem fs = tablePath.getFileSystem(conf);
1335
1336    HRegionFileSystem regionFs = new HRegionFileSystem(conf, fs, tablePath, regionInfo);
1337    for (ColumnFamilyDescriptor family : tableDescriptor.getColumnFamilies()) {
1338      List<LocatedFileStatus> locatedFileStatusList =
1339        HRegionFileSystem.getStoreFilesLocatedStatus(regionFs, family.getNameAsString(), true);
1340      if (locatedFileStatusList == null) {
1341        continue;
1342      }
1343
1344      for (LocatedFileStatus status : locatedFileStatusList) {
1345        Path p = status.getPath();
1346        if (StoreFileInfo.isReference(p) || HFileLink.isHFileLink(p)) {
1347          // Only construct StoreFileInfo object if its not a hfile, save obj
1348          // creation
1349          StoreFileInfo storeFileInfo = new StoreFileInfo(conf, fs, status);
1350          hdfsBlocksDistribution.add(storeFileInfo.computeHDFSBlocksDistribution(fs));
1351        } else if (StoreFileInfo.isHFile(p)) {
1352          // If its a HFile, then lets just add to the block distribution
1353          // lets not create more objects here, not even another HDFSBlocksDistribution
1354          FSUtils.addToHDFSBlocksDistribution(hdfsBlocksDistribution, status.getBlockLocations());
1355        } else {
1356          throw new IOException("path=" + p + " doesn't look like a valid StoreFile");
1357        }
1358      }
1359    }
1360    return hdfsBlocksDistribution;
1361  }
1362
1363  /**
1364   * Increase the size of mem store in this region and the size of global mem store
1365   */
1366  private void incMemStoreSize(MemStoreSize mss) {
1367    incMemStoreSize(mss.getDataSize(), mss.getHeapSize(), mss.getOffHeapSize(),
1368      mss.getCellsCount());
1369  }
1370
1371  void incMemStoreSize(long dataSizeDelta, long heapSizeDelta, long offHeapSizeDelta,
1372    int cellsCountDelta) {
1373    if (this.rsAccounting != null) {
1374      rsAccounting.incGlobalMemStoreSize(dataSizeDelta, heapSizeDelta, offHeapSizeDelta);
1375    }
1376    long dataSize = this.memStoreSizing.incMemStoreSize(dataSizeDelta, heapSizeDelta,
1377      offHeapSizeDelta, cellsCountDelta);
1378    checkNegativeMemStoreDataSize(dataSize, dataSizeDelta);
1379  }
1380
1381  void decrMemStoreSize(MemStoreSize mss) {
1382    decrMemStoreSize(mss.getDataSize(), mss.getHeapSize(), mss.getOffHeapSize(),
1383      mss.getCellsCount());
1384  }
1385
1386  private void decrMemStoreSize(long dataSizeDelta, long heapSizeDelta, long offHeapSizeDelta,
1387    int cellsCountDelta) {
1388    if (this.rsAccounting != null) {
1389      rsAccounting.decGlobalMemStoreSize(dataSizeDelta, heapSizeDelta, offHeapSizeDelta);
1390    }
1391    long dataSize = this.memStoreSizing.decMemStoreSize(dataSizeDelta, heapSizeDelta,
1392      offHeapSizeDelta, cellsCountDelta);
1393    checkNegativeMemStoreDataSize(dataSize, -dataSizeDelta);
1394  }
1395
1396  private void checkNegativeMemStoreDataSize(long memStoreDataSize, long delta) {
1397    // This is extremely bad if we make memStoreSizing negative. Log as much info on the offending
1398    // caller as possible. (memStoreSizing might be a negative value already -- freeing memory)
1399    if (memStoreDataSize < 0) {
1400      LOG.error("Asked to modify this region's (" + this.toString()
1401        + ") memStoreSizing to a negative value which is incorrect. Current memStoreSizing="
1402        + (memStoreDataSize - delta) + ", delta=" + delta, new Exception());
1403    }
1404  }

1515  @Override
1516  public boolean isMergeable() {
1517    if (!isAvailable()) {
1518      LOG.debug("Region " + this + " is not mergeable because it is closing or closed");
1519      return false;
1520    }
1521    if (hasReferences()) {
1522      LOG.debug("Region " + this + " is not mergeable because it has references");
1523      return false;
1524    }
1525
1526    return true;
1527  }

1544  /** Returns readpoint considering given IsolationLevel. Pass {@code null} for default */
1545  public long getReadPoint(IsolationLevel isolationLevel) {
1546    if (isolationLevel != null && isolationLevel == IsolationLevel.READ_UNCOMMITTED) {
1547      // This scan can read even uncommitted transactions
1548      return Long.MAX_VALUE;
1549    }
1550    return mvcc.getReadPoint();
1551  }

1557  /**
1558   * Close down this HRegion. Flush the cache, shut down each HStore, don't service any more calls.
1559   * <p>
1560   * This method could take some time to execute, so don't call it from a time-sensitive thread.
1561   * @return Vector of all the storage files that the HRegion's component HStores make use of. It's
1562   *         a list of all StoreFile objects. Returns empty vector if already closed and null if
1563   *         judged that it should not close.
1564   * @throws IOException              e
1565   * @throws DroppedSnapshotException Thrown when replay of wal is required because a Snapshot was
1566   *                                  not properly persisted. The region is put in closing mode, and
1567   *                                  the caller MUST abort after this.
1568   */
1569  public Map<byte[], List<HStoreFile>> close() throws IOException {
1570    return close(false);
1571  }
1572
1573  private final Object closeLock = new Object();
1574
1575  /** Conf key for fair locking policy */
1576  public static final String FAIR_REENTRANT_CLOSE_LOCK =
1577    "hbase.regionserver.fair.region.close.lock";
1578  public static final boolean DEFAULT_FAIR_REENTRANT_CLOSE_LOCK = true;
1579  /** Conf key for the periodic flush interval */
1580  public static final String MEMSTORE_PERIODIC_FLUSH_INTERVAL =
1581    "hbase.regionserver.optionalcacheflushinterval";
1582  /** Default interval for the memstore flush */
1583  public static final int DEFAULT_CACHE_FLUSH_INTERVAL = 3600000;
1584  /** Default interval for System tables memstore flush */
1585  public static final int SYSTEM_CACHE_FLUSH_INTERVAL = 300000; // 5 minutes
1586
1587  /** Conf key to force a flush if there are already enough changes for one region in memstore */
1588  public static final String MEMSTORE_FLUSH_PER_CHANGES = "hbase.regionserver.flush.per.changes";
1589  public static final long DEFAULT_FLUSH_PER_CHANGES = 30000000; // 30 millions
1590  /**
1591   * The following MAX_FLUSH_PER_CHANGES is large enough because each KeyValue has 20+ bytes
1592   * overhead. Therefore, even 1G empty KVs occupy at least 20GB memstore size for a single region
1593   */
1594  public static final long MAX_FLUSH_PER_CHANGES = 1000000000; // 1G
1595
1596  public static final String CLOSE_WAIT_ABORT = "hbase.regionserver.close.wait.abort";
1597  public static final boolean DEFAULT_CLOSE_WAIT_ABORT = true;
1598  public static final String CLOSE_WAIT_TIME = "hbase.regionserver.close.wait.time.ms";
1599  public static final long DEFAULT_CLOSE_WAIT_TIME = 60000; // 1 minute
1600  public static final String CLOSE_WAIT_INTERVAL = "hbase.regionserver.close.wait.interval.ms";
1601  public static final long DEFAULT_CLOSE_WAIT_INTERVAL = 10000; // 10 seconds
1602
1603  public Map<byte[], List<HStoreFile>> close(boolean abort) throws IOException {
1604    return close(abort, false);
1605  }
1606
1607  /**
1608   * Close this HRegion.
1609   * @param abort        true if server is aborting (only during testing)
1610   * @param ignoreStatus true if ignore the status (won't be showed on task list)
1611   * @return Vector of all the storage files that the HRegion's component HStores make use of. It's
1612   *         a list of StoreFile objects. Can be null if we are not to close at this time, or we are
1613   *         already closed.
1614   * @throws IOException              e
1615   * @throws DroppedSnapshotException Thrown when replay of wal is required because a Snapshot was
1616   *                                  not properly persisted. The region is put in closing mode, and
1617   *                                  the caller MUST abort after this.
1618   */
1619  public Map<byte[], List<HStoreFile>> close(boolean abort, boolean ignoreStatus)
1620    throws IOException {
1621    return close(abort, ignoreStatus, false);
1622  }
1623
1624  /**
1625   * Close down this HRegion. Flush the cache unless abort parameter is true, Shut down each HStore,
1626   * don't service any more calls. This method could take some time to execute, so don't call it
1627   * from a time-sensitive thread.
1628   * @param abort          true if server is aborting (only during testing)
1629   * @param ignoreStatus   true if ignore the status (wont be showed on task list)
1630   * @param isGracefulStop true if region is being closed during graceful stop and the blocks in the
1631   *                       BucketCache should not be evicted.
1632   * @return Vector of all the storage files that the HRegion's component HStores make use of. It's
1633   *         a list of StoreFile objects. Can be null if we are not to close at this time or we are
1634   *         already closed.
1635   * @throws IOException              e
1636   * @throws DroppedSnapshotException Thrown when replay of wal is required because a Snapshot was
1637   *                                  not properly persisted. The region is put in closing mode, and
1638   *                                  the caller MUST abort after this.
1639   */
1640  public Map<byte[], List<HStoreFile>> close(boolean abort, boolean ignoreStatus,
1641    boolean isGracefulStop) throws IOException {
1642    // Only allow one thread to close at a time. Serialize them so dual
1643    // threads attempting to close will run up against each other.
1644    MonitoredTask status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus(
1645      "Closing region " + this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + (abort ? " due to abort" : ""),
1646      ignoreStatus, true);
1647    status.setStatus("Waiting for close lock");
1648    try {
1649      synchronized (closeLock) {
1650        if (isGracefulStop && rsServices != null) {
1651          rsServices.getBlockCache().ifPresent(blockCache -> {
1652            if (blockCache instanceof CombinedBlockCache) {
1653              BlockCache l2 = ((CombinedBlockCache) blockCache).getSecondLevelCache();
1654              if (l2 instanceof BucketCache) {
1655                if (((BucketCache) l2).isCachePersistenceEnabled()) {
1656                  LOG.info(
1657                    "Closing region {} during a graceful stop, and cache persistence is on, "
1658                      + "so setting evict on close to false. ",
1659                    this.getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString());
1660                  this.getStores().forEach(s -> s.getCacheConfig().setEvictOnClose(false));
1661                }
1662              }
1663            }
1664          });
1665        }
1666        return doClose(abort, status);
1667      }
1668    } finally {
1669      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1670        LOG.debug("Region close journal for {}:\n{}", this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName(),
1671          status.prettyPrintJournal());
1672      }
1673      status.cleanup();
1674    }
1675  }
1676
1677  /**
1678   * Exposed for some very specific unit tests.
1679   */
1680  public void setClosing(boolean closing) {
1681    this.closing.set(closing);
1682  }
1683
1684  /**
1685   * The {@link HRegion#doClose} will block forever if someone tries proving the dead lock via the
1686   * unit test. Instead of blocking, the {@link HRegion#doClose} will throw exception if you set the
1687   * timeout.
1688   * @param timeoutForWriteLock the second time to wait for the write lock in
1689   *                            {@link HRegion#doClose}
1690   */
1691  public void setTimeoutForWriteLock(long timeoutForWriteLock) {
1692    assert timeoutForWriteLock >= 0;
1693    this.timeoutForWriteLock = timeoutForWriteLock;
1694  }
1695
1696  @edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressWarnings(value = "UL_UNRELEASED_LOCK_EXCEPTION_PATH",
1697      justification = "I think FindBugs is confused")
1698  private Map<byte[], List<HStoreFile>> doClose(boolean abort, MonitoredTask status)
1699    throws IOException {
1700    if (isClosed()) {
1701      LOG.warn("Region " + this + " already closed");
1702      return null;
1703    }
1704
1705    if (coprocessorHost != null) {
1706      status.setStatus("Running coprocessor pre-close hooks");
1707      this.coprocessorHost.preClose(abort);
1708    }
1709    status.setStatus("Disabling compacts and flushes for region");
1710    boolean canFlush = true;
1711    synchronized (writestate) {
1712      // Disable compacting and flushing by background threads for this
1713      // region.
1714      canFlush = !writestate.readOnly;
1715      writestate.writesEnabled = false;
1716      LOG.debug("Closing {}, disabling compactions & flushes",
1717        this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
1718      waitForFlushesAndCompactions();
1719    }
1720    // If we were not just flushing, is it worth doing a preflush...one
1721    // that will clear out of the bulk of the memstore before we put up
1722    // the close flag?
1723    if (!abort && worthPreFlushing() && canFlush) {
1724      status.setStatus("Pre-flushing region before close");
1725      LOG.info("Running close preflush of {}", this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
1726      try {
1727        internalFlushcache(status);
1728      } catch (IOException ioe) {
1729        // Failed to flush the region. Keep going.
1730        status.setStatus("Failed pre-flush " + this + "; " + ioe.getMessage());
1731      }
1732    }
1733    if (regionReplicationSink.isPresent()) {
1734      // stop replicating to secondary replicas
1735      // the open event marker can make secondary replicas refresh store files and catch up
1736      // everything, so here we just give up replicating later edits, to speed up the reopen process
1737      RegionReplicationSink sink = regionReplicationSink.get();
1738      sink.stop();
1739      try {
1740        regionReplicationSink.get().waitUntilStopped();
1741      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1742        throw throwOnInterrupt(e);
1743      }
1744    }
1745    // Set the closing flag
1746    // From this point new arrivals at the region lock will get NSRE.
1747
1748    this.closing.set(true);
1749    LOG.info("Closing region {}", this);
1750
1751    // Acquire the close lock
1752
1753    // The configuration parameter CLOSE_WAIT_ABORT is overloaded to enable both
1754    // the new regionserver abort condition and interrupts for running requests.
1755    // If CLOSE_WAIT_ABORT is not enabled there is no change from earlier behavior,
1756    // we will not attempt to interrupt threads servicing requests nor crash out
1757    // the regionserver if something remains stubborn.
1758
1759    final boolean canAbort = conf.getBoolean(CLOSE_WAIT_ABORT, DEFAULT_CLOSE_WAIT_ABORT);
1760    boolean useTimedWait = false;
1761    if (timeoutForWriteLock != null && timeoutForWriteLock != Long.MAX_VALUE) {
1762      // convert legacy use of timeoutForWriteLock in seconds to new use in millis
1763      timeoutForWriteLock = TimeUnit.SECONDS.toMillis(timeoutForWriteLock);
1764      useTimedWait = true;
1765    } else if (canAbort) {
1766      timeoutForWriteLock = conf.getLong(CLOSE_WAIT_TIME, DEFAULT_CLOSE_WAIT_TIME);
1767      useTimedWait = true;
1768    }
1769    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1770      LOG.debug((useTimedWait ? "Time limited wait" : "Waiting without time limit")
1771        + " for close lock on " + this);
1772    }
1773    final long closeWaitInterval = conf.getLong(CLOSE_WAIT_INTERVAL, DEFAULT_CLOSE_WAIT_INTERVAL);
1774    long elapsedWaitTime = 0;
1775    if (useTimedWait) {
1776      // Sanity check configuration
1777      long remainingWaitTime = timeoutForWriteLock;
1778      if (remainingWaitTime < closeWaitInterval) {
1779        LOG.warn("Time limit for close wait of " + timeoutForWriteLock
1780          + " ms is less than the configured lock acquisition wait interval " + closeWaitInterval
1781          + " ms, using wait interval as time limit");
1782        remainingWaitTime = closeWaitInterval;
1783      }
1784      boolean acquired = false;
1785      do {
1786        long start = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1787        try {
1788          acquired = lock.writeLock().tryLock(Math.min(remainingWaitTime, closeWaitInterval),
1789            TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
1790        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1791          // Interrupted waiting for close lock. More likely the server is shutting down, not
1792          // normal operation, so aborting upon interrupt while waiting on this lock would not
1793          // provide much value. Throw an IOE (as IIOE) like we would in the case where we
1794          // fail to acquire the lock.
1795          String msg = "Interrupted while waiting for close lock on " + this;
1796          LOG.warn(msg, e);
1797          throw (InterruptedIOException) new InterruptedIOException(msg).initCause(e);
1798        }
1799        long elapsed = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() - start;
1800        elapsedWaitTime += elapsed;
1801        remainingWaitTime -= elapsed;
1802        if (canAbort && !acquired && remainingWaitTime > 0) {
1803          // Before we loop to wait again, interrupt all region operations that might
1804          // still be in progress, to encourage them to break out of waiting states or
1805          // inner loops, throw an exception to clients, and release the read lock via
1806          // endRegionOperation.
1807          if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1808            LOG.debug("Interrupting region operations after waiting for close lock for "
1809              + elapsedWaitTime + " ms on " + this + ", " + remainingWaitTime + " ms remaining");
1810          }
1811          interruptRegionOperations();
1812        }
1813      } while (!acquired && remainingWaitTime > 0);
1814
1815      // If we fail to acquire the lock, trigger an abort if we can; otherwise throw an IOE
1816      // to let the caller know we could not proceed with the close.
1817      if (!acquired) {
1818        String msg =
1819          "Failed to acquire close lock on " + this + " after waiting " + elapsedWaitTime + " ms";
1820        LOG.error(msg);
1821        if (canAbort) {
1822          // If we failed to acquire the write lock, abort the server
1823          rsServices.abort(msg, null);
1824        }
1825        throw new IOException(msg);
1826      }
1827
1828    } else {
1829
1830      long start = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1831      lock.writeLock().lock();
1832      elapsedWaitTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() - start;
1833
1834    }
1835
1836    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1837      LOG.debug("Acquired close lock on " + this + " after waiting " + elapsedWaitTime + " ms");
1838    }
1839
1840    status.setStatus("Disabling writes for close");
1841    try {
1842      if (this.isClosed()) {
1843        status.abort("Already got closed by another process");
1844        // SplitTransaction handles the null
1845        return null;
1846      }
1847      LOG.debug("Updates disabled for region " + this);
1848      // Don't flush the cache if we are aborting
1849      if (!abort && canFlush) {
1850        int failedfFlushCount = 0;
1851        int flushCount = 0;
1852        long tmp = 0;
1853        long remainingSize = this.memStoreSizing.getDataSize();
1854        while (remainingSize > 0) {
1855          try {
1856            internalFlushcache(status);
1857            if (flushCount > 0) {
1858              LOG.info("Running extra flush, " + flushCount + " (carrying snapshot?) " + this);
1859            }
1860            flushCount++;
1861            tmp = this.memStoreSizing.getDataSize();
1862            if (tmp >= remainingSize) {
1863              failedfFlushCount++;
1864            }
1865            remainingSize = tmp;
1866            if (failedfFlushCount > 5) {
1867              // If we failed 5 times and are unable to clear memory, abort
1868              // so we do not lose data
1869              throw new DroppedSnapshotException("Failed clearing memory after " + flushCount
1870                + " attempts on region: " + Bytes.toStringBinary(getRegionInfo().getRegionName()));
1871            }
1872          } catch (IOException ioe) {
1873            status.setStatus("Failed flush " + this + ", putting online again");
1874            synchronized (writestate) {
1875              writestate.writesEnabled = true;
1876            }
1877            // Have to throw to upper layers. I can't abort server from here.
1878            throw ioe;
1879          }
1880        }
1881      }
1882
1883      Map<byte[], List<HStoreFile>> result = new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
1884      if (!stores.isEmpty()) {
1885        // initialize the thread pool for closing stores in parallel.
1886        ThreadPoolExecutor storeCloserThreadPool =
1887          getStoreOpenAndCloseThreadPool("StoreCloser-" + getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString());
1888        CompletionService<Pair<byte[], Collection<HStoreFile>>> completionService =
1889          new ExecutorCompletionService<>(storeCloserThreadPool);
1890
1891        // close each store in parallel
1892        for (HStore store : stores.values()) {
1893          MemStoreSize mss = store.getFlushableSize();
1894          if (!(abort || mss.getDataSize() == 0 || writestate.readOnly)) {
1895            if (getRegionServerServices() != null) {
1896              getRegionServerServices().abort("Assertion failed while closing store "
1897                + getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString() + " " + store
1898                + ". flushableSize expected=0, actual={" + mss + "}. Current memStoreSize="
1899                + this.memStoreSizing.getMemStoreSize() + ". Maybe a coprocessor "
1900                + "operation failed and left the memstore in a partially updated state.", null);
1901            }
1902          }
1903          completionService.submit(new Callable<Pair<byte[], Collection<HStoreFile>>>() {
1904            @Override
1905            public Pair<byte[], Collection<HStoreFile>> call() throws IOException {
1906              return new Pair<>(store.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName(), store.close());
1907            }
1908          });
1909        }
1910        try {
1911          for (int i = 0; i < stores.size(); i++) {
1912            Future<Pair<byte[], Collection<HStoreFile>>> future = completionService.take();
1913            Pair<byte[], Collection<HStoreFile>> storeFiles = future.get();
1914            List<HStoreFile> familyFiles = result.get(storeFiles.getFirst());
1915            if (familyFiles == null) {
1916              familyFiles = new ArrayList<>();
1917              result.put(storeFiles.getFirst(), familyFiles);
1918            }
1919            familyFiles.addAll(storeFiles.getSecond());
1920          }
1921        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1922          throw throwOnInterrupt(e);
1923        } catch (ExecutionException e) {
1924          Throwable cause = e.getCause();
1925          if (cause instanceof IOException) {
1926            throw (IOException) cause;
1927          }
1928          throw new IOException(cause);
1929        } finally {
1930          storeCloserThreadPool.shutdownNow();
1931        }
1932      }
1933
1934      status.setStatus("Writing region close event to WAL");
1935      // Always write close marker to wal even for read only table. This is not a big problem as we
1936      // do not write any data into the region; it is just a meta edit in the WAL file.
1937      if (
1938        !abort && wal != null && getRegionServerServices() != null
1939          && RegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(getRegionInfo())
1940      ) {
1941        writeRegionCloseMarker(wal);
1942      }
1943      this.closed.set(true);
1944
1945      // Decrease refCount of table latency metric registry.
1946      // Do this after closed#set to make sure only -1.
1947      if (metricsTableRequests != null) {
1948        metricsTableRequests.removeRegistry();
1949      }
1950
1951      if (!canFlush) {
1952        decrMemStoreSize(this.memStoreSizing.getMemStoreSize());
1953      } else if (this.memStoreSizing.getDataSize() != 0) {
1954        LOG.error("Memstore data size is {} in region {}", this.memStoreSizing.getDataSize(), this);
1955      }
1956      if (coprocessorHost != null) {
1957        status.setStatus("Running coprocessor post-close hooks");
1958        this.coprocessorHost.postClose(abort);
1959      }
1960      if (this.metricsRegion != null) {
1961        this.metricsRegion.close();
1962      }
1963      if (this.metricsRegionWrapper != null) {
1964        Closeables.close(this.metricsRegionWrapper, true);
1965      }
1966      status.markComplete("Closed");
1967      LOG.info("Closed {}", this);
1968      return result;
1969    } finally {
1970      lock.writeLock().unlock();
1971    }
1972  }
1973
1974  /** Wait for all current flushes and compactions of the region to complete */
1975  // TODO HBASE-18906. Check the usage (if any) in Phoenix and expose this or give alternate way for
1976  // Phoenix needs.
1977  public void waitForFlushesAndCompactions() {
1978    synchronized (writestate) {
1979      if (this.writestate.readOnly) {
1980        // we should not wait for replayed flushed if we are read only (for example in case the
1981        // region is a secondary replica).
1982        return;
1983      }
1984      boolean interrupted = false;
1985      try {
1986        while (writestate.compacting.get() > 0 || writestate.flushing) {
1987          LOG.debug("waiting for " + writestate.compacting + " compactions"
1988            + (writestate.flushing ? " & cache flush" : "") + " to complete for region " + this);
1989          try {
1990            writestate.wait();
1991          } catch (InterruptedException iex) {
1992            // essentially ignore and propagate the interrupt back up
1993            LOG.warn("Interrupted while waiting in region {}", this);
1994            interrupted = true;
1995            break;
1996          }
1997        }
1998      } finally {
1999        if (interrupted) {
2000          Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
2001        }
2002      }
2003    }
2004  }
2005
2006  /**
2007   * Wait for all current flushes of the region to complete
2008   */
2009  public void waitForFlushes() {
2010    waitForFlushes(0);// Unbound wait
2011  }
2012
2013  @Override
2014  public boolean waitForFlushes(long timeout) {
2015    synchronized (writestate) {
2016      if (this.writestate.readOnly) {
2017        // we should not wait for replayed flushed if we are read only (for example in case the
2018        // region is a secondary replica).
2019        return true;
2020      }
2021      if (!writestate.flushing) return true;
2022      long start = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
2023      long duration = 0;
2024      boolean interrupted = false;
2025      LOG.debug("waiting for cache flush to complete for region " + this);
2026      try {
2027        while (writestate.flushing) {
2028          if (timeout > 0 && duration >= timeout) break;
2029          try {
2030            long toWait = timeout == 0 ? 0 : (timeout - duration);
2031            writestate.wait(toWait);
2032          } catch (InterruptedException iex) {
2033            // essentially ignore and propagate the interrupt back up
2034            LOG.warn("Interrupted while waiting in region {}", this);
2035            interrupted = true;
2036            break;
2037          } finally {
2038            duration = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() - start;
2039          }
2040        }
2041      } finally {
2042        if (interrupted) {
2043          Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
2044        }
2045      }
2046      LOG.debug("Waited {} ms for region {} flush to complete", duration, this);
2047      return !(writestate.flushing);
2048    }
2049  }

2061  private ThreadPoolExecutor getStoreOpenAndCloseThreadPool(final String threadNamePrefix) {
2062    int numStores = Math.max(1, this.htableDescriptor.getColumnFamilyCount());
2063    int maxThreads = Math.min(numStores, conf.getInt(HConstants.HSTORE_OPEN_AND_CLOSE_THREADS_MAX,
2064      HConstants.DEFAULT_HSTORE_OPEN_AND_CLOSE_THREADS_MAX));
2065    return getOpenAndCloseThreadPool(maxThreads, threadNamePrefix);
2066  }
2067
2068  ThreadPoolExecutor getStoreFileOpenAndCloseThreadPool(final String threadNamePrefix) {
2069    int numStores = Math.max(1, this.htableDescriptor.getColumnFamilyCount());
2070    int maxThreads = Math.max(1, conf.getInt(HConstants.HSTORE_OPEN_AND_CLOSE_THREADS_MAX,
2071      HConstants.DEFAULT_HSTORE_OPEN_AND_CLOSE_THREADS_MAX) / numStores);
2072    return getOpenAndCloseThreadPool(maxThreads, threadNamePrefix);
2073  }
2074
2075  private static ThreadPoolExecutor getOpenAndCloseThreadPool(int maxThreads,
2076    final String threadNamePrefix) {
2077    return Threads.getBoundedCachedThreadPool(maxThreads, 30L, TimeUnit.SECONDS,
2078      new ThreadFactory() {
2079        private int count = 1;
2080
2081        @Override
2082        public Thread newThread(Runnable r) {
2083          return new Thread(r, threadNamePrefix + "-" + count++);
2084        }
2085      });
2086  }

2088  /** Returns True if its worth doing a flush before we put up the close flag. */
2089  private boolean worthPreFlushing() {
2090    return this.memStoreSizing.getDataSize()
2091        > this.conf.getLong("hbase.hregion.preclose.flush.size", 1024 * 1024 * 5);
2092  }

2190
2191  @Override
2192  public long getOldestHfileTs(boolean majorCompactionOnly) throws IOException {
2193    long result = Long.MAX_VALUE;
2194    for (HStore store : stores.values()) {
2195      Collection<HStoreFile> storeFiles = store.getStorefiles();
2196      if (storeFiles == null) {
2197        continue;
2198      }
2199      for (HStoreFile file : storeFiles) {
2200        StoreFileReader sfReader = file.getReader();
2201        if (sfReader == null) {
2202          continue;
2203        }
2204        HFile.Reader reader = sfReader.getHFileReader();
2205        if (reader == null) {
2206          continue;
2207        }
2208        if (majorCompactionOnly) {
2209          byte[] val = reader.getHFileInfo().get(MAJOR_COMPACTION_KEY);
2210          if (val == null || !Bytes.toBoolean(val)) {
2211            continue;
2212          }
2213        }
2214        result = Math.min(result, reader.getFileContext().getFileCreateTime());
2215      }
2216    }
2217    return result == Long.MAX_VALUE ? 0 : result;
2218  }
2219
2220  RegionLoad.Builder setCompleteSequenceId(RegionLoad.Builder regionLoadBldr) {
2221    long lastFlushOpSeqIdLocal = this.lastFlushOpSeqId;
2222    byte[] encodedRegionName = this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes();
2223    regionLoadBldr.clearStoreCompleteSequenceId();
2224    for (byte[] familyName : this.stores.keySet()) {
2225      long earliest = this.wal.getEarliestMemStoreSeqNum(encodedRegionName, familyName);
2226      // Subtract - 1 to go earlier than the current oldest, unflushed edit in memstore; this will
2227      // give us a sequence id that is for sure flushed. We want edit replay to start after this
2228      // sequence id in this region. If NO_SEQNUM, use the regions maximum flush id.
2229      long csid = (earliest == HConstants.NO_SEQNUM) ? lastFlushOpSeqIdLocal : earliest - 1;
2230      regionLoadBldr.addStoreCompleteSequenceId(StoreSequenceId.newBuilder()
2231        .setFamilyName(UnsafeByteOperations.unsafeWrap(familyName)).setSequenceId(csid).build());
2232    }
2233    return regionLoadBldr.setCompleteSequenceId(getMaxFlushedSeqId());
2234  }
