2236  //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2237  // HRegion maintenance.
2238  //
2239  // These methods are meant to be called periodically by the HRegionServer for
2240  // upkeep.
2241  //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2242  /**
2243   * Do preparation for pending compaction.
2244   */
2245  protected void doRegionCompactionPrep() throws IOException {
2246  }
2247
2248  /**
2249   * Synchronously compact all stores in the region.
2250   * <p>
2251   * This operation could block for a long time, so don't call it from a time-sensitive thread.
2252   * <p>
2253   * Note that no locks are taken to prevent possible conflicts between compaction and splitting
2254   * activities. The regionserver does not normally compact and split in parallel. However by
2255   * calling this method you may introduce unexpected and unhandled concurrency. Don't do this
2256   * unless you know what you are doing.
2257   * @param majorCompaction True to force a major compaction regardless of thresholds
2258   */
2259  public void compact(boolean majorCompaction) throws IOException {
2260    if (majorCompaction) {
2261      stores.values().forEach(HStore::triggerMajorCompaction);
2262    }
2263    for (HStore s : stores.values()) {
2264      Optional<CompactionContext> compaction = s.requestCompaction();
2265      if (compaction.isPresent()) {
2266        ThroughputController controller = null;
2267        if (rsServices != null) {
2268          controller = CompactionThroughputControllerFactory.create(rsServices, conf);
2269        }
2270        if (controller == null) {
2271          controller = NoLimitThroughputController.INSTANCE;
2272        }
2273        compact(compaction.get(), s, controller, null);
2274      }
2275    }
2276  }
2277
2278  /**
2279   * This is a helper function that compact all the stores synchronously.
2280   * <p>
2281   * It is used by utilities and testing
2282   */
2283  public void compactStores() throws IOException {
2284    for (HStore s : stores.values()) {
2285      Optional<CompactionContext> compaction = s.requestCompaction();
2286      if (compaction.isPresent()) {
2287        compact(compaction.get(), s, NoLimitThroughputController.INSTANCE, null);
2288      }
2289    }
2290  }
2291
2292  /**
2293   * This is a helper function that compact the given store.
2294   * <p>
2295   * It is used by utilities and testing
2296   */
2297  void compactStore(byte[] family, ThroughputController throughputController) throws IOException {
2298    HStore s = getStore(family);
2299    Optional<CompactionContext> compaction = s.requestCompaction();
2300    if (compaction.isPresent()) {
2301      compact(compaction.get(), s, throughputController, null);
2302    }
2303  }
2304
2305  /**
2306   * Called by compaction thread and after region is opened to compact the HStores if necessary.
2307   * <p>
2308   * This operation could block for a long time, so don't call it from a time-sensitive thread. Note
2309   * that no locking is necessary at this level because compaction only conflicts with a region
2310   * split, and that cannot happen because the region server does them sequentially and not in
2311   * parallel.
2312   * @param compaction Compaction details, obtained by requestCompaction()
2313   * @return whether the compaction completed
2314   */
2315  public boolean compact(CompactionContext compaction, HStore store,
2316    ThroughputController throughputController) throws IOException {
2317    return compact(compaction, store, throughputController, null);
2318  }
2319
2320  private boolean shouldForbidMajorCompaction() {
2321    if (rsServices != null && rsServices.getReplicationSourceService() != null) {
2322      return rsServices.getReplicationSourceService().getSyncReplicationPeerInfoProvider()
2323        .checkState(getRegionInfo().getTable(), ForbidMajorCompactionChecker.get());
2324    }
2325    return false;
2326  }
2327
2328  /**
2329   * We are trying to remove / relax the region read lock for compaction. Let's see what are the
2330   * potential race conditions among the operations (user scan, region split, region close and
2331   * region bulk load). user scan ---> region read lock region split --> region close first -->
2332   * region write lock region close --> region write lock region bulk load --> region write lock
2333   * read lock is compatible with read lock. ---> no problem with user scan/read region bulk load
2334   * does not cause problem for compaction (no consistency problem, store lock will help the store
2335   * file accounting). They can run almost concurrently at the region level. The only remaining race
2336   * condition is between the region close and compaction. So we will evaluate, below, how region
2337   * close intervenes with compaction if compaction does not acquire region read lock. Here are the
2338   * steps for compaction: 1. obtain list of StoreFile's 2. create StoreFileScanner's based on list
2339   * from #1 3. perform compaction and save resulting files under tmp dir 4. swap in compacted files
2340   * #1 is guarded by store lock. This patch does not change this --> no worse or better For #2, we
2341   * obtain smallest read point (for region) across all the Scanners (for both default compactor and
2342   * stripe compactor). The read points are for user scans. Region keeps the read points for all
2343   * currently open user scanners. Compaction needs to know the smallest read point so that during
2344   * re-write of the hfiles, it can remove the mvcc points for the cells if their mvccs are older
2345   * than the smallest since they are not needed anymore. This will not conflict with compaction.
2346   * For #3, it can be performed in parallel to other operations. For #4 bulk load and compaction
2347   * don't conflict with each other on the region level (for multi-family atomicy). Region close and
2348   * compaction are guarded pretty well by the 'writestate'. In HRegion#doClose(), we have :
2349   * synchronized (writestate) { // Disable compacting and flushing by background threads for this
2350   * // region. canFlush = !writestate.readOnly; writestate.writesEnabled = false;
2351   * LOG.debug("Closing " + this + ": disabling compactions & flushes");
2352   * waitForFlushesAndCompactions(); } waitForFlushesAndCompactions() would wait for
2353   * writestate.compacting to come down to 0. and in HRegion.compact() try { synchronized
2354   * (writestate) { if (writestate.writesEnabled) { wasStateSet = true; ++writestate.compacting; }
2355   * else { String msg = "NOT compacting region " + this + ". Writes disabled."; LOG.info(msg);
2356   * status.abort(msg); return false; } } Also in compactor.performCompaction(): check periodically
2357   * to see if a system stop is requested if (closeChecker != null &&
2358   * closeChecker.isTimeLimit(store, now)) { progress.cancel(); return false; } if (closeChecker !=
2359   * null && closeChecker.isSizeLimit(store, len)) { progress.cancel(); return false; }
2360   */
2361  public boolean compact(CompactionContext compaction, HStore store,
2362    ThroughputController throughputController, User user) throws IOException {
2363    assert compaction != null && compaction.hasSelection();
2364    assert !compaction.getRequest().getFiles().isEmpty();
2365    if (this.closing.get() || this.closed.get()) {
2366      LOG.debug("Skipping compaction on " + this + " because closing/closed");
2367      store.cancelRequestedCompaction(compaction);
2368      return false;
2369    }
2370
2371    if (compaction.getRequest().isAllFiles() && shouldForbidMajorCompaction()) {
2372      LOG.warn("Skipping major compaction on " + this
2373        + " because this cluster is transiting sync replication state"
2374        + " from STANDBY to DOWNGRADE_ACTIVE");
2375      store.cancelRequestedCompaction(compaction);
2376      return false;
2377    }
2378
2379    MonitoredTask status = null;
2380    boolean requestNeedsCancellation = true;
2381    try {
2382      byte[] cf = Bytes.toBytes(store.getColumnFamilyName());
2383      if (stores.get(cf) != store) {
2384        LOG.warn("Store " + store.getColumnFamilyName() + " on region " + this
2385          + " has been re-instantiated, cancel this compaction request. "
2386          + " It may be caused by the roll back of split transaction");
2387        return false;
2388      }
2389
2390      status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus("Compacting " + store + " in " + this);
2391      if (this.closed.get()) {
2392        String msg = "Skipping compaction on " + this + " because closed";
2393        LOG.debug(msg);
2394        status.abort(msg);
2395        return false;
2396      }
2397      boolean wasStateSet = false;
2398      try {
2399        synchronized (writestate) {
2400          if (writestate.writesEnabled) {
2401            wasStateSet = true;
2402            writestate.compacting.incrementAndGet();
2403          } else {
2404            String msg = "NOT compacting region " + this + ". Writes disabled.";
2405            LOG.info(msg);
2406            status.abort(msg);
2407            return false;
2408          }
2409        }
2410        LOG.info("Starting compaction of {} in {}{}", store, this,
2411          (compaction.getRequest().isOffPeak() ? " as an off-peak compaction" : ""));
2412        doRegionCompactionPrep();
2413        try {
2414          status.setStatus("Compacting store " + store);
2415          // We no longer need to cancel the request on the way out of this
2416          // method because Store#compact will clean up unconditionally
2417          requestNeedsCancellation = false;
2418          store.compact(compaction, throughputController, user);
2419        } catch (InterruptedIOException iioe) {
2420          String msg = "region " + this + " compaction interrupted";
2421          LOG.info(msg, iioe);
2422          status.abort(msg);
2423          return false;
2424        }
2425      } finally {
2426        if (wasStateSet) {
2427          synchronized (writestate) {
2428            writestate.compacting.decrementAndGet();
2429            if (writestate.compacting.get() <= 0) {
2430              writestate.notifyAll();
2431            }
2432          }
2433        }
2434      }
2435      status.markComplete("Compaction complete");
2436      return true;
2437    } finally {
2438      if (requestNeedsCancellation) store.cancelRequestedCompaction(compaction);
2439      if (status != null) {
2440        LOG.debug("Compaction status journal for {}:\n{}", this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName(),
2441          status.prettyPrintJournal());
2442        status.cleanup();
2443      }
2444    }
2445  }
2446
2447  /**
2448   * Flush the cache.
2449   * <p>
2450   * When this method is called the cache will be flushed unless:
2451   * <ol>
2452   * <li>the cache is empty</li>
2453   * <li>the region is closed.</li>
2454   * <li>a flush is already in progress</li>
2455   * <li>writes are disabled</li>
2456   * </ol>
2457   * <p>
2458   * This method may block for some time, so it should not be called from a time-sensitive thread.
2459   * @param flushAllStores whether we want to force a flush of all stores
2460   * @return FlushResult indicating whether the flush was successful or not and if the region needs
2461   *         compacting
2462   * @throws IOException general io exceptions because a snapshot was not properly persisted.
2463   */
2464  // TODO HBASE-18905. We might have to expose a requestFlush API for CPs
2465  public FlushResult flush(boolean flushAllStores) throws IOException {
2466    return flushcache(flushAllStores, false, FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
2467  }
2468
2469  public interface FlushResult {
2470    enum Result {
2471      FLUSHED_NO_COMPACTION_NEEDED,
2472      FLUSHED_COMPACTION_NEEDED,
2473      // Special case where a flush didn't run because there's nothing in the memstores. Used when
2474      // bulk loading to know when we can still load even if a flush didn't happen.
2475      CANNOT_FLUSH_MEMSTORE_EMPTY,
2476      CANNOT_FLUSH
2477    }
2478
2479    /** Returns the detailed result code */
2480    Result getResult();
2481
2482    /** Returns true if the memstores were flushed, else false */
2483    boolean isFlushSucceeded();
2484
2485    /** Returns True if the flush requested a compaction, else false */
2486    boolean isCompactionNeeded();
2487  }
2488
2489  public FlushResultImpl flushcache(boolean flushAllStores, boolean writeFlushRequestWalMarker,
2490    FlushLifeCycleTracker tracker) throws IOException {
2491    List<byte[]> families = null;
2492    if (flushAllStores) {
2493      families = new ArrayList<>();
2494      families.addAll(this.getTableDescriptor().getColumnFamilyNames());
2495    }
2496    return this.flushcache(families, writeFlushRequestWalMarker, tracker);
2497  }
2498
2499  /**
2500   * Flush the cache. When this method is called the cache will be flushed unless:
2501   * <ol>
2502   * <li>the cache is empty</li>
2503   * <li>the region is closed.</li>
2504   * <li>a flush is already in progress</li>
2505   * <li>writes are disabled</li>
2506   * </ol>
2507   * <p>
2508   * This method may block for some time, so it should not be called from a time-sensitive thread.
2509   * @param families                   stores of region to flush.
2510   * @param writeFlushRequestWalMarker whether to write the flush request marker to WAL
2511   * @param tracker                    used to track the life cycle of this flush
2512   * @return whether the flush is success and whether the region needs compacting
2513   * @throws IOException              general io exceptions
2514   * @throws DroppedSnapshotException Thrown when replay of wal is required because a Snapshot was
2515   *                                  not properly persisted. The region is put in closing mode, and
2516   *                                  the caller MUST abort after this.
2517   */
2518  public FlushResultImpl flushcache(List<byte[]> families, boolean writeFlushRequestWalMarker,
2519    FlushLifeCycleTracker tracker) throws IOException {
2520    // fail-fast instead of waiting on the lock
2521    if (this.closing.get()) {
2522      String msg = "Skipping flush on " + this + " because closing";
2523      LOG.debug(msg);
2524      return new FlushResultImpl(FlushResult.Result.CANNOT_FLUSH, msg, false);
2525    }
2526    MonitoredTask status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus("Flushing " + this);
2527    status.setStatus("Acquiring readlock on region");
2528    // block waiting for the lock for flushing cache
2529    lock.readLock().lock();
2530    boolean flushed = true;
2531    try {
2532      if (this.closed.get()) {
2533        String msg = "Skipping flush on " + this + " because closed";
2534        LOG.debug(msg);
2535        status.abort(msg);
2536        flushed = false;
2537        return new FlushResultImpl(FlushResult.Result.CANNOT_FLUSH, msg, false);
2538      }
2539      if (coprocessorHost != null) {
2540        status.setStatus("Running coprocessor pre-flush hooks");
2541        coprocessorHost.preFlush(tracker);
2542      }
2543      // TODO: this should be managed within memstore with the snapshot, updated only after flush
2544      // successful
2545      if (numMutationsWithoutWAL.sum() > 0) {
2546        numMutationsWithoutWAL.reset();
2547        dataInMemoryWithoutWAL.reset();
2548      }
2549      synchronized (writestate) {
2550        if (!writestate.flushing && writestate.writesEnabled) {
2551          this.writestate.flushing = true;
2552        } else {
2553          String msg = "NOT flushing " + this + " as "
2554            + (writestate.flushing ? "already flushing" : "writes are not enabled");
2555          LOG.debug(msg);
2556          status.abort(msg);
2557          flushed = false;
2558          return new FlushResultImpl(FlushResult.Result.CANNOT_FLUSH, msg, false);
2559        }
2560      }
2561
2562      try {
2563        // The reason that we do not always use flushPolicy is, when the flush is
2564        // caused by logRoller, we should select stores which must be flushed
2565        // rather than could be flushed.
2566        Collection<HStore> specificStoresToFlush = null;
2567        if (families != null) {
2568          specificStoresToFlush = getSpecificStores(families);
2569        } else {
2570          specificStoresToFlush = flushPolicy.selectStoresToFlush();
2571        }
2572        FlushResultImpl fs =
2573          internalFlushcache(specificStoresToFlush, status, writeFlushRequestWalMarker, tracker);
2574
2575        if (coprocessorHost != null) {
2576          status.setStatus("Running post-flush coprocessor hooks");
2577          coprocessorHost.postFlush(tracker);
2578        }
2579
2580        if (fs.isFlushSucceeded()) {
2581          flushesQueued.reset();
2582        }
2583
2584        status.markComplete("Flush successful " + fs.toString());
2585        return fs;
2586      } finally {
2587        synchronized (writestate) {
2588          writestate.flushing = false;
2589          this.writestate.flushRequested = false;
2590          writestate.notifyAll();
2591        }
2592      }
2593    } finally {
2594      lock.readLock().unlock();
2595      if (flushed) {
2596        // Don't log this journal stuff if no flush -- confusing.
2597        LOG.debug("Flush status journal for {}:\n{}", this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName(),
2598          status.prettyPrintJournal());
2599      }
2600      status.cleanup();
2601    }
2602  }
2603
2604  /**
2605   * get stores which matches the specified families
2606   * @return the stores need to be flushed.
2607   */
2608  private Collection<HStore> getSpecificStores(List<byte[]> families) {
2609    Collection<HStore> specificStoresToFlush = new ArrayList<>();
2610    for (byte[] family : families) {
2611      specificStoresToFlush.add(stores.get(family));
2612    }
2613    return specificStoresToFlush;
2614  }
2615
2616  /**
2617   * Should the store be flushed because it is old enough.
2618   * <p>
2619   * Every FlushPolicy should call this to determine whether a store is old enough to flush (except
2620   * that you always flush all stores). Otherwise the method will always returns true which will
2621   * make a lot of flush requests.
2622   */
2623  boolean shouldFlushStore(HStore store) {
2624    long earliest = this.wal.getEarliestMemStoreSeqNum(getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes(),
2625      store.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName()) - 1;
2626    if (earliest > 0 && earliest + flushPerChanges < mvcc.getReadPoint()) {
2627      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
2628        LOG.debug("Flush column family " + store.getColumnFamilyName() + " of "
2629          + getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " because unflushed sequenceid=" + earliest
2630          + " is > " + this.flushPerChanges + " from current=" + mvcc.getReadPoint());
2631      }
2632      return true;
2633    }
2634    if (this.flushCheckInterval <= 0) {
2635      return false;
2636    }
2637    long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
2638    if (store.timeOfOldestEdit() < now - this.flushCheckInterval) {
2639      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
2640        LOG.debug("Flush column family: " + store.getColumnFamilyName() + " of "
2641          + getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " because time of oldest edit="
2642          + store.timeOfOldestEdit() + " is > " + this.flushCheckInterval + " from now =" + now);
2643      }
2644      return true;
2645    }
2646    return false;
2647  }
2648
2649  /**
2650   * Should the memstore be flushed now
2651   */
2652  boolean shouldFlush(final StringBuilder whyFlush) {
2653    whyFlush.setLength(0);
2654    // This is a rough measure.
2655    if (
2656      this.maxFlushedSeqId > 0
2657        && (this.maxFlushedSeqId + this.flushPerChanges < this.mvcc.getReadPoint())
2658    ) {
2659      whyFlush.append("more than max edits, " + this.flushPerChanges + ", since last flush");
2660      return true;
2661    }
2662    long modifiedFlushCheckInterval = flushCheckInterval;
2663    if (
2664      getRegionInfo().getTable().isSystemTable()
2665        && getRegionInfo().getReplicaId() == RegionInfo.DEFAULT_REPLICA_ID
2666    ) {
2667      modifiedFlushCheckInterval = SYSTEM_CACHE_FLUSH_INTERVAL;
2668    }
2669    if (modifiedFlushCheckInterval <= 0) { // disabled
2670      return false;
2671    }
2672    long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
2673    // if we flushed in the recent past, we don't need to do again now
2674    if ((now - getEarliestFlushTimeForAllStores() < modifiedFlushCheckInterval)) {
2675      return false;
2676    }
2677    // since we didn't flush in the recent past, flush now if certain conditions
2678    // are met. Return true on first such memstore hit.
2679    for (HStore s : stores.values()) {
2680      if (s.timeOfOldestEdit() < now - modifiedFlushCheckInterval) {
2681        // we have an old enough edit in the memstore, flush
2682        whyFlush.append(s.toString() + " has an old edit so flush to free WALs");
2683        return true;
2684      }
2685    }
2686    return false;
2687  }
2688

2690   * Flushing all stores.
2691   * @see #internalFlushcache(Collection, MonitoredTask, boolean, FlushLifeCycleTracker)
2692   */
2693  private FlushResult internalFlushcache(MonitoredTask status) throws IOException {
2694    return internalFlushcache(stores.values(), status, false, FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
2695  }

2697  /**
2698   * Flushing given stores.
2699   * @see #internalFlushcache(WAL, long, Collection, MonitoredTask, boolean, FlushLifeCycleTracker)
2700   */
2701  private FlushResultImpl internalFlushcache(Collection<HStore> storesToFlush, MonitoredTask status,
2702    boolean writeFlushWalMarker, FlushLifeCycleTracker tracker) throws IOException {
2703    return internalFlushcache(this.wal, HConstants.NO_SEQNUM, storesToFlush, status,
2704      writeFlushWalMarker, tracker);
2705  }
2706
2707  /**
2708   * Flush the memstore. Flushing the memstore is a little tricky. We have a lot of updates in the
2709   * memstore, all of which have also been written to the wal. We need to write those updates in the
2710   * memstore out to disk, while being able to process reads/writes as much as possible during the
2711   * flush operation.
2712   * <p>
2713   * This method may block for some time. Every time you call it, we up the regions sequence id even
2714   * if we don't flush; i.e. the returned region id will be at least one larger than the last edit
2715   * applied to this region. The returned id does not refer to an actual edit. The returned id can
2716   * be used for say installing a bulk loaded file just ahead of the last hfile that was the result
2717   * of this flush, etc.
2718   * @param wal           Null if we're NOT to go via wal.
2719   * @param myseqid       The seqid to use if <code>wal</code> is null writing out flush file.
2720   * @param storesToFlush The list of stores to flush.
2721   * @return object describing the flush's state
2722   * @throws IOException              general io exceptions
2723   * @throws DroppedSnapshotException Thrown when replay of WAL is required.
2724   */
2725  protected FlushResultImpl internalFlushcache(WAL wal, long myseqid,
2726    Collection<HStore> storesToFlush, MonitoredTask status, boolean writeFlushWalMarker,
2727    FlushLifeCycleTracker tracker) throws IOException {
2728    PrepareFlushResult result =
2729      internalPrepareFlushCache(wal, myseqid, storesToFlush, status, writeFlushWalMarker, tracker);
2730    if (result.result == null) {
2731      return internalFlushCacheAndCommit(wal, status, result, storesToFlush);
2732    } else {
2733      return result.result; // early exit due to failure from prepare stage
2734    }
2735  }
2736
2737  @edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressWarnings(value = "DLS_DEAD_LOCAL_STORE",
2738      justification = "FindBugs seems confused about trxId")
2739  protected PrepareFlushResult internalPrepareFlushCache(WAL wal, long myseqid,
2740    Collection<HStore> storesToFlush, MonitoredTask status, boolean writeFlushWalMarker,
2741    FlushLifeCycleTracker tracker) throws IOException {
2742    if (this.rsServices != null && this.rsServices.isAborted()) {
2743      // Don't flush when server aborting, it's unsafe
2744      throw new IOException("Aborting flush because server is aborted...");
2745    }
2746    final long startTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
2747    // If nothing to flush, return, but return with a valid unused sequenceId.
2748    // Its needed by bulk upload IIRC. It flushes until no edits in memory so it can insert a
2749    // bulk loaded file between memory and existing hfiles. It wants a good seqeunceId that belongs
2750    // to no other that it can use to associate with the bulk load. Hence this little dance below
2751    // to go get one.
2752    if (this.memStoreSizing.getDataSize() <= 0) {
2753      // Take an update lock so no edits can come into memory just yet.
2754      this.updatesLock.writeLock().lock();
2755      WriteEntry writeEntry = null;
2756      try {
2757        if (this.memStoreSizing.getDataSize() <= 0) {
2758          // Presume that if there are still no edits in the memstore, then there are no edits for
2759          // this region out in the WAL subsystem so no need to do any trickery clearing out
2760          // edits in the WAL sub-system. Up the sequence number so the resulting flush id is for
2761          // sure just beyond the last appended region edit and not associated with any edit
2762          // (useful as marker when bulk loading, etc.).
2763          if (wal != null) {
2764            writeEntry = mvcc.begin();
2765            long flushOpSeqId = writeEntry.getWriteNumber();
2766            FlushResultImpl flushResult = new FlushResultImpl(
2767              FlushResult.Result.CANNOT_FLUSH_MEMSTORE_EMPTY, flushOpSeqId, "Nothing to flush",
2768              writeCanNotFlushMarkerToWAL(writeEntry, wal, writeFlushWalMarker));
2769            mvcc.completeAndWait(writeEntry);
2770            // Set to null so we don't complete it again down in finally block.
2771            writeEntry = null;
2772            return new PrepareFlushResult(flushResult, myseqid);
2773          } else {
2774            return new PrepareFlushResult(new FlushResultImpl(
2775              FlushResult.Result.CANNOT_FLUSH_MEMSTORE_EMPTY, "Nothing to flush", false), myseqid);
2776          }
2777        }
2778      } finally {
2779        if (writeEntry != null) {
2780          // If writeEntry is non-null, this operation failed; the mvcc transaction failed...
2781          // but complete it anyways so it doesn't block the mvcc queue.
2782          mvcc.complete(writeEntry);
2783        }
2784        this.updatesLock.writeLock().unlock();
2785      }
2786    }
2787    logFatLineOnFlush(storesToFlush, myseqid);
2788    // Stop updates while we snapshot the memstore of all of these regions' stores. We only have
2789    // to do this for a moment. It is quick. We also set the memstore size to zero here before we
2790    // allow updates again so its value will represent the size of the updates received
2791    // during flush
2792
2793    // We have to take an update lock during snapshot, or else a write could end up in both snapshot
2794    // and memstore (makes it difficult to do atomic rows then)
2795    status.setStatus("Obtaining lock to block concurrent updates");
2796    // block waiting for the lock for internal flush
2797    this.updatesLock.writeLock().lock();
2798    status.setStatus("Preparing flush snapshotting stores in " + getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
2799    MemStoreSizing totalSizeOfFlushableStores = new NonThreadSafeMemStoreSizing();
2800
2801    Map<byte[], Long> flushedFamilyNamesToSeq = new HashMap<>();
2802    for (HStore store : storesToFlush) {
2803      flushedFamilyNamesToSeq.put(store.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName(),
2804        store.preFlushSeqIDEstimation());
2805    }
2806
2807    TreeMap<byte[], StoreFlushContext> storeFlushCtxs = new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
2808    TreeMap<byte[], List<Path>> committedFiles = new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
2809    TreeMap<byte[], MemStoreSize> storeFlushableSize = new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
2810    // The sequence id of this flush operation which is used to log FlushMarker and pass to
2811    // createFlushContext to use as the store file's sequence id. It can be in advance of edits
2812    // still in the memstore, edits that are in other column families yet to be flushed.
2813    long flushOpSeqId = HConstants.NO_SEQNUM;
2814    // The max flushed sequence id after this flush operation completes. All edits in memstore
2815    // will be in advance of this sequence id.
2816    long flushedSeqId = HConstants.NO_SEQNUM;
2817    byte[] encodedRegionName = getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes();
2818    try {
2819      if (wal != null) {
2820        Long earliestUnflushedSequenceIdForTheRegion =
2821          wal.startCacheFlush(encodedRegionName, flushedFamilyNamesToSeq);
2822        if (earliestUnflushedSequenceIdForTheRegion == null) {
2823          // This should never happen. This is how startCacheFlush signals flush cannot proceed.
2824          String msg = this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " flush aborted; WAL closing.";
2825          status.setStatus(msg);
2826          return new PrepareFlushResult(
2827            new FlushResultImpl(FlushResult.Result.CANNOT_FLUSH, msg, false), myseqid);
2828        }
2829        flushOpSeqId = getNextSequenceId(wal);
2830        // Back up 1, minus 1 from oldest sequence id in memstore to get last 'flushed' edit
2831        flushedSeqId = earliestUnflushedSequenceIdForTheRegion.longValue() == HConstants.NO_SEQNUM
2832          ? flushOpSeqId
2833          : earliestUnflushedSequenceIdForTheRegion.longValue() - 1;
2834      } else {
2835        // use the provided sequence Id as WAL is not being used for this flush.
2836        flushedSeqId = flushOpSeqId = myseqid;
2837      }
2838
2839      for (HStore s : storesToFlush) {
2840        storeFlushCtxs.put(s.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName(),
2841          s.createFlushContext(flushOpSeqId, tracker));
2842        // for writing stores to WAL
2843        committedFiles.put(s.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName(), null);
2844      }
2845
2846      // write the snapshot start to WAL
2847      if (wal != null && !writestate.readOnly) {
2848        FlushDescriptor desc = ProtobufUtil.toFlushDescriptor(FlushAction.START_FLUSH,
2849          getRegionInfo(), flushOpSeqId, committedFiles);
2850        // No sync. Sync is below where no updates lock and we do FlushAction.COMMIT_FLUSH
2851        WALUtil.writeFlushMarker(wal, this.getReplicationScope(), getRegionInfo(), desc, false,
2852          mvcc, regionReplicationSink.orElse(null));
2853      }
2854
2855      // Prepare flush (take a snapshot)
2856      storeFlushCtxs.forEach((name, flush) -> {
2857        MemStoreSize snapshotSize = flush.prepare();
2858        totalSizeOfFlushableStores.incMemStoreSize(snapshotSize);
2859        storeFlushableSize.put(name, snapshotSize);
2860      });
2861    } catch (IOException ex) {
2862      doAbortFlushToWAL(wal, flushOpSeqId, committedFiles);
2863      throw ex;
2864    } finally {
2865      this.updatesLock.writeLock().unlock();
2866    }
2867    String s = "Finished memstore snapshotting " + this + ", syncing WAL and waiting on mvcc, "
2868      + "flushsize=" + totalSizeOfFlushableStores;
2869    status.setStatus(s);
2870    doSyncOfUnflushedWALChanges(wal, getRegionInfo());
2871    return new PrepareFlushResult(storeFlushCtxs, committedFiles, storeFlushableSize, startTime,
2872      flushOpSeqId, flushedSeqId, totalSizeOfFlushableStores);
2873  }
2874
2875  /**
2876   * Utility method broken out of internalPrepareFlushCache so that method is smaller.
2877   */
2878  private void logFatLineOnFlush(Collection<HStore> storesToFlush, long sequenceId) {
2879    if (!LOG.isInfoEnabled()) {
2880      return;
2881    }
2882    // Log a fat line detailing what is being flushed.
2883    StringBuilder perCfExtras = null;
2884    if (!isAllFamilies(storesToFlush)) {
2885      perCfExtras = new StringBuilder();
2886      for (HStore store : storesToFlush) {
2887        MemStoreSize mss = store.getFlushableSize();
2888        perCfExtras.append("; ").append(store.getColumnFamilyName());
2889        perCfExtras.append("={dataSize=").append(StringUtils.byteDesc(mss.getDataSize()));
2890        perCfExtras.append(", heapSize=").append(StringUtils.byteDesc(mss.getHeapSize()));
2891        perCfExtras.append(", offHeapSize=").append(StringUtils.byteDesc(mss.getOffHeapSize()));
2892        perCfExtras.append("}");
2893      }
2894    }
2895    MemStoreSize mss = this.memStoreSizing.getMemStoreSize();
2896    LOG.info("Flushing " + this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " " + storesToFlush.size() + "/"
2897      + stores.size() + " column families," + " dataSize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(mss.getDataSize())
2898      + " heapSize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(mss.getHeapSize())
2899      + ((perCfExtras != null && perCfExtras.length() > 0) ? perCfExtras.toString() : "")
2900      + ((wal != null) ? "" : "; WAL is null, using passed sequenceid=" + sequenceId));
2901  }
2902
2903  private void doAbortFlushToWAL(final WAL wal, final long flushOpSeqId,
2904    final Map<byte[], List<Path>> committedFiles) {
2905    if (wal == null) return;
2906    try {
2907      FlushDescriptor desc = ProtobufUtil.toFlushDescriptor(FlushAction.ABORT_FLUSH,
2908        getRegionInfo(), flushOpSeqId, committedFiles);
2909      WALUtil.writeFlushMarker(wal, this.getReplicationScope(), getRegionInfo(), desc, false, mvcc,
2910        null);
2911    } catch (Throwable t) {
2912      LOG.warn("Received unexpected exception trying to write ABORT_FLUSH marker to WAL: {} in "
2913        + " region {}", StringUtils.stringifyException(t), this);
2914      // ignore this since we will be aborting the RS with DSE.
2915    }
2916    // we have called wal.startCacheFlush(), now we have to abort it
2917    wal.abortCacheFlush(this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes());
2918  }
2919
2920  /**
2921   * Sync unflushed WAL changes. See HBASE-8208 for details
2922   */
2923  private static void doSyncOfUnflushedWALChanges(final WAL wal, final RegionInfo hri)
2924    throws IOException {
2925    if (wal == null) {
2926      return;
2927    }
2928    try {
2929      wal.sync(); // ensure that flush marker is sync'ed
2930    } catch (IOException ioe) {
2931      wal.abortCacheFlush(hri.getEncodedNameAsBytes());
2932      throw ioe;
2933    }
2934  }
2935
2936  /** Returns True if passed Set is all families in the region. */
2937  private boolean isAllFamilies(Collection<HStore> families) {
2938    return families == null || this.stores.size() == families.size();
2939  }

2941  /**
2942   * This method is only used when we flush but the memstore is empty,if writeFlushWalMarker is
2943   * true,we write the {@link FlushAction#CANNOT_FLUSH} flush marker to WAL when the memstore is
2944   * empty. Ignores exceptions from WAL. Returns whether the write succeeded.
2945   * @return whether WAL write was successful
2946   */
2947  private boolean writeCanNotFlushMarkerToWAL(WriteEntry flushOpSeqIdMVCCEntry, WAL wal,
2948    boolean writeFlushWalMarker) {
2949    FlushDescriptor desc = ProtobufUtil.toFlushDescriptor(FlushAction.CANNOT_FLUSH, getRegionInfo(),
2950      -1, new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR));
2951    RegionReplicationSink sink = regionReplicationSink.orElse(null);
2952
2953    if (sink != null && !writeFlushWalMarker) {
2954      /**
2955       * Here for replication to secondary region replica could use {@link FlushAction#CANNOT_FLUSH}
2956       * to recover when writeFlushWalMarker is false, we create {@link WALEdit} for
2957       * {@link FlushDescriptor} and attach the {@link RegionReplicationSink#add} to the
2958       * flushOpSeqIdMVCCEntry,see HBASE-26960 for more details.
2959       */
2960      this.attachRegionReplicationToFlushOpSeqIdMVCCEntry(flushOpSeqIdMVCCEntry, desc, sink);
2961      return false;
2962    }
2963
2964    if (writeFlushWalMarker && wal != null && !writestate.readOnly) {
2965      try {
2966        WALUtil.writeFlushMarker(wal, this.getReplicationScope(), getRegionInfo(), desc, true, mvcc,
2967          sink);
2968        return true;
2969      } catch (IOException e) {
2970        LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
2971          + "Received exception while trying to write the flush request to wal", e);
2972      }
2973    }
2974    return false;
2975  }
2976
2977  /**
2978   * Create {@link WALEdit} for {@link FlushDescriptor} and attach {@link RegionReplicationSink#add}
2979   * to the flushOpSeqIdMVCCEntry.
2980   */
2981  private void attachRegionReplicationToFlushOpSeqIdMVCCEntry(WriteEntry flushOpSeqIdMVCCEntry,
2982    FlushDescriptor desc, RegionReplicationSink sink) {
2983    assert !flushOpSeqIdMVCCEntry.getCompletionAction().isPresent();
2984    WALEdit flushMarkerWALEdit = WALEdit.createFlushWALEdit(getRegionInfo(), desc);
2985    WALKeyImpl walKey =
2986      WALUtil.createWALKey(getRegionInfo(), mvcc, this.getReplicationScope(), null);
2987    walKey.setWriteEntry(flushOpSeqIdMVCCEntry);
2988    /**
2989     * Here the {@link ServerCall} is null for {@link RegionReplicationSink#add} because the
2990     * flushMarkerWALEdit is created by ourselves, not from rpc.
2991     */
2992    flushOpSeqIdMVCCEntry.attachCompletionAction(() -> sink.add(walKey, flushMarkerWALEdit, null));
2993  }
2994
2995  @edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressWarnings(value = "NN_NAKED_NOTIFY",
2996      justification = "Intentional; notify is about completed flush")
2997  FlushResultImpl internalFlushCacheAndCommit(WAL wal, MonitoredTask status,
2998    PrepareFlushResult prepareResult, Collection<HStore> storesToFlush) throws IOException {
2999    // prepare flush context is carried via PrepareFlushResult
3000    TreeMap<byte[], StoreFlushContext> storeFlushCtxs = prepareResult.storeFlushCtxs;
3001    TreeMap<byte[], List<Path>> committedFiles = prepareResult.committedFiles;
3002    long startTime = prepareResult.startTime;
3003    long flushOpSeqId = prepareResult.flushOpSeqId;
3004    long flushedSeqId = prepareResult.flushedSeqId;
3005
3006    String s = "Flushing stores of " + this;
3007    status.setStatus(s);
3008    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) LOG.trace(s);
3009
3010    // Any failure from here on out will be catastrophic requiring server
3011    // restart so wal content can be replayed and put back into the memstore.
3012    // Otherwise, the snapshot content while backed up in the wal, it will not
3013    // be part of the current running servers state.
3014    boolean compactionRequested = false;
3015    long flushedOutputFileSize = 0;
3016    try {
3017      // A. Flush memstore to all the HStores.
3018      // Keep running vector of all store files that includes both old and the
3019      // just-made new flush store file. The new flushed file is still in the
3020      // tmp directory.
3021
3022      for (StoreFlushContext flush : storeFlushCtxs.values()) {
3023        flush.flushCache(status);
3024      }
3025
3026      // Switch snapshot (in memstore) -> new hfile (thus causing
3027      // all the store scanners to reset/reseek).
3028      for (Map.Entry<byte[], StoreFlushContext> flushEntry : storeFlushCtxs.entrySet()) {
3029        StoreFlushContext sfc = flushEntry.getValue();
3030        boolean needsCompaction = sfc.commit(status);
3031        if (needsCompaction) {
3032          compactionRequested = true;
3033        }
3034        byte[] storeName = flushEntry.getKey();
3035        List<Path> storeCommittedFiles = sfc.getCommittedFiles();
3036        committedFiles.put(storeName, storeCommittedFiles);
3037        // Flush committed no files, indicating flush is empty or flush was canceled
3038        if (storeCommittedFiles == null || storeCommittedFiles.isEmpty()) {
3039          MemStoreSize storeFlushableSize = prepareResult.storeFlushableSize.get(storeName);
3040          prepareResult.totalFlushableSize.decMemStoreSize(storeFlushableSize);
3041        }
3042        flushedOutputFileSize += sfc.getOutputFileSize();
3043      }
3044      storeFlushCtxs.clear();
3045
3046      // Set down the memstore size by amount of flush.
3047      MemStoreSize mss = prepareResult.totalFlushableSize.getMemStoreSize();
3048      this.decrMemStoreSize(mss);
3049
3050      // Increase the size of this Region for the purposes of quota. Noop if quotas are disabled.
3051      // During startup, quota manager may not be initialized yet.
3052      if (rsServices != null) {
3053        RegionServerSpaceQuotaManager quotaManager = rsServices.getRegionServerSpaceQuotaManager();
3054        if (quotaManager != null) {
3055          quotaManager.getRegionSizeStore().incrementRegionSize(this.getRegionInfo(),
3056            flushedOutputFileSize);
3057        }
3058      }
3059
3060      if (wal != null) {
3061        // write flush marker to WAL. If fail, we should throw DroppedSnapshotException
3062        FlushDescriptor desc = ProtobufUtil.toFlushDescriptor(FlushAction.COMMIT_FLUSH,
3063          getRegionInfo(), flushOpSeqId, committedFiles);
3064        WALUtil.writeFlushMarker(wal, this.getReplicationScope(), getRegionInfo(), desc, true, mvcc,
3065          regionReplicationSink.orElse(null));
3066      }
3067    } catch (Throwable t) {
3068      // An exception here means that the snapshot was not persisted.
3069      // The wal needs to be replayed so its content is restored to memstore.
3070      // Currently, only a server restart will do this.
3071      // We used to only catch IOEs but its possible that we'd get other
3072      // exceptions -- e.g. HBASE-659 was about an NPE -- so now we catch
3073      // all and sundry.
3074      if (wal != null) {
3075        try {
3076          FlushDescriptor desc = ProtobufUtil.toFlushDescriptor(FlushAction.ABORT_FLUSH,
3077            getRegionInfo(), flushOpSeqId, committedFiles);
3078          WALUtil.writeFlushMarker(wal, this.replicationScope, getRegionInfo(), desc, false, mvcc,
3079            null);
3080        } catch (Throwable ex) {
3081          LOG.warn(
3082            getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "failed writing ABORT_FLUSH marker to WAL",
3083            ex);
3084          // ignore this since we will be aborting the RS with DSE.
3085        }
3086        wal.abortCacheFlush(this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes());
3087      }
3088      DroppedSnapshotException dse = new DroppedSnapshotException(
3089        "region: " + Bytes.toStringBinary(getRegionInfo().getRegionName()), t);
3090      status.abort("Flush failed: " + StringUtils.stringifyException(t));
3091
3092      // Callers for flushcache() should catch DroppedSnapshotException and abort the region server.
3093      // However, since we may have the region read lock, we cannot call close(true) here since
3094      // we cannot promote to a write lock. Instead we are setting closing so that all other region
3095      // operations except for close will be rejected.
3096      this.closing.set(true);
3097
3098      if (rsServices != null) {
3099        // This is a safeguard against the case where the caller fails to explicitly handle aborting
3100        rsServices.abort("Replay of WAL required. Forcing server shutdown", dse);
3101      }
3102
3103      throw dse;
3104    }
3105
3106    // If we get to here, the HStores have been written.
3107    if (wal != null) {
3108      wal.completeCacheFlush(this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes(), flushedSeqId);
3109    }
3110
3111    // Record latest flush time
3112    for (HStore store : storesToFlush) {
3113      this.lastStoreFlushTimeMap.put(store, startTime);
3114    }
3115
3116    this.maxFlushedSeqId = flushedSeqId;
3117    this.lastFlushOpSeqId = flushOpSeqId;
3118
3119    // C. Finally notify anyone waiting on memstore to clear:
3120    // e.g. checkResources().
3121    synchronized (this) {
3122      notifyAll(); // FindBugs NN_NAKED_NOTIFY
3123    }
3124
3125    long time = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() - startTime;
3126    MemStoreSize mss = prepareResult.totalFlushableSize.getMemStoreSize();
3127    long memstoresize = this.memStoreSizing.getMemStoreSize().getDataSize();
3128    String msg = "Finished flush of" + " dataSize ~" + StringUtils.byteDesc(mss.getDataSize()) + "/"
3129      + mss.getDataSize() + ", heapSize ~" + StringUtils.byteDesc(mss.getHeapSize()) + "/"
3130      + mss.getHeapSize() + ", currentSize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(memstoresize) + "/"
3131      + memstoresize + " for " + this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " in " + time
3132      + "ms, sequenceid=" + flushOpSeqId + ", compaction requested=" + compactionRequested
3133      + ((wal == null) ? "; wal=null" : "");
3134    LOG.info(msg);
3135    status.setStatus(msg);
3136
3137    if (rsServices != null && rsServices.getMetrics() != null) {
3138      rsServices.getMetrics().updateFlush(getTableDescriptor().getTableName().getNameAsString(),
3139        time, mss.getDataSize(), flushedOutputFileSize);
3140    }
3141
3142    return new FlushResultImpl(compactionRequested
3143      ? FlushResult.Result.FLUSHED_COMPACTION_NEEDED
3144      : FlushResult.Result.FLUSHED_NO_COMPACTION_NEEDED, flushOpSeqId);
3145  }

3147  /**
3148   * Method to safely get the next sequence number.
3149   * @return Next sequence number unassociated with any actual edit.
3150   */
3151  protected long getNextSequenceId(final WAL wal) throws IOException {
3152    WriteEntry we = mvcc.begin();
3153    mvcc.completeAndWait(we);
3154    return we.getWriteNumber();
3155  }

3166  @Override

3171
3172  private RegionScannerImpl getScanner(Scan scan, List<KeyValueScanner> additionalScanners,
3173    long nonceGroup, long nonce) throws IOException {
3174    return TraceUtil.trace(() -> {
3175      startRegionOperation(Operation.SCAN);
3176      try {
3177        // Verify families are all valid
3178        if (!scan.hasFamilies()) {
3179          // Adding all families to scanner
3180          for (byte[] family : this.htableDescriptor.getColumnFamilyNames()) {
3181            scan.addFamily(family);
3182          }
3183        } else {
3184          for (byte[] family : scan.getFamilyMap().keySet()) {
3185            checkFamily(family);
3186          }
3187        }
3188        return instantiateRegionScanner(scan, additionalScanners, nonceGroup, nonce);
3189      } finally {
3190        closeRegionOperation(Operation.SCAN);
3191      }
3192    }, () -> createRegionSpan("Region.getScanner"));
3193  }
3194
3195  protected RegionScannerImpl instantiateRegionScanner(Scan scan,
3196    List<KeyValueScanner> additionalScanners, long nonceGroup, long nonce) throws IOException {
3197    if (scan.isReversed()) {
3198      if (scan.getFilter() != null) {
3199        scan.getFilter().setReversed(true);
3200      }
3201      return new ReversedRegionScannerImpl(scan, additionalScanners, this, nonceGroup, nonce);
3202    }
3203    return new RegionScannerImpl(scan, additionalScanners, this, nonceGroup, nonce);
3204  }

3206  /**
3207   * Prepare a delete for a row mutation processor
3208   * @param delete The passed delete is modified by this method. WARNING!
3209   */
3210  private void prepareDelete(Delete delete) throws IOException {
3211    // Check to see if this is a deleteRow insert
3212    if (delete.getFamilyCellMap().isEmpty()) {
3213      for (byte[] family : this.htableDescriptor.getColumnFamilyNames()) {
3214        // Don't eat the timestamp
3215        delete.addFamily(family, delete.getTimestamp());
3216      }
3217    } else {
3218      for (byte[] family : delete.getFamilyCellMap().keySet()) {
3219        if (family == null) {
3220          throw new NoSuchColumnFamilyException("Empty family is invalid");
3221        }
3222        checkFamily(family, delete.getDurability());
3223      }
3224    }
3225  }
3226
3227  @Override
3228  public void delete(Delete delete) throws IOException {
3229    TraceUtil.trace(() -> {
3230      checkReadOnly();
3231      checkResources();
3232      startRegionOperation(Operation.DELETE);
3233      try {
3234        // All edits for the given row (across all column families) must happen atomically.
3235        return mutate(delete);
3236      } finally {
3237        closeRegionOperation(Operation.DELETE);
3238      }
3239    }, () -> createRegionSpan("Region.delete"));
3240  }

3242  /**
3243   * Set up correct timestamps in the KVs in Delete object.
3244   * <p/>
3245   * Caller should have the row and region locks.
3246   */
3247  private void prepareDeleteTimestamps(Mutation mutation, Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> familyMap,
3248    byte[] byteNow) throws IOException {
3249    for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> e : familyMap.entrySet()) {
3250
3251      byte[] family = e.getKey();
3252      List<ExtendedCell> cells = e.getValue();
3253      assert cells instanceof RandomAccess;
3254
3255      Map<byte[], Integer> kvCount = new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
3256      int listSize = cells.size();
3257      for (int i = 0; i < listSize; i++) {
3258        ExtendedCell cell = cells.get(i);
3259        // Check if time is LATEST, change to time of most recent addition if so
3260        // This is expensive.
3261        if (
3262          cell.getTimestamp() == HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP && PrivateCellUtil.isDeleteType(cell)
3263        ) {
3264          byte[] qual = CellUtil.cloneQualifier(cell);
3265
3266          Integer count = kvCount.get(qual);
3267          if (count == null) {
3268            kvCount.put(qual, 1);
3269          } else {
3270            kvCount.put(qual, count + 1);
3271          }
3272          count = kvCount.get(qual);
3273
3274          Get get = new Get(CellUtil.cloneRow(cell));
3275          get.readVersions(count);
3276          get.addColumn(family, qual);
3277          if (coprocessorHost != null) {
3278            if (
3279              !coprocessorHost.prePrepareTimeStampForDeleteVersion(mutation, cell, byteNow, get)
3280            ) {
3281              updateDeleteLatestVersionTimestamp(cell, get, count, byteNow);
3282            }
3283          } else {
3284            updateDeleteLatestVersionTimestamp(cell, get, count, byteNow);
3285          }
3286        } else {
3287          PrivateCellUtil.updateLatestStamp(cell, byteNow);
3288        }
3289      }
3290    }
3291  }
3292
3293  private void updateDeleteLatestVersionTimestamp(Cell cell, Get get, int count, byte[] byteNow)
3294    throws IOException {
3295    try (RegionScanner scanner = getScanner(new Scan(get))) {
3296      // NOTE: Please don't use HRegion.get() instead,
3297      // because it will copy cells to heap. See HBASE-26036
3298      List<Cell> result = new ArrayList<>();
3299      scanner.next(result);
3300
3301      if (result.size() < count) {
3302        // Nothing to delete
3303        PrivateCellUtil.updateLatestStamp(cell, byteNow);
3304        return;
3305      }
3306      if (result.size() > count) {
3307        throw new RuntimeException("Unexpected size: " + result.size());
3308      }
3309      Cell getCell = result.get(count - 1);
3310      PrivateCellUtil.setTimestamp(cell, getCell.getTimestamp());
3311    }
3312  }

3314  @Override
3315  public void put(Put put) throws IOException {
3316    TraceUtil.trace(() -> {
3317      checkReadOnly();
3318
3319      // Do a rough check that we have resources to accept a write. The check is
3320      // 'rough' in that between the resource check and the call to obtain a
3321      // read lock, resources may run out. For now, the thought is that this
3322      // will be extremely rare; we'll deal with it when it happens.
3323      checkResources();
3324      startRegionOperation(Operation.PUT);
3325      try {
3326        // All edits for the given row (across all column families) must happen atomically.
3327        return mutate(put);
3328      } finally {
3329        closeRegionOperation(Operation.PUT);
3330      }
3331    }, () -> createRegionSpan("Region.put"));
3332  }
3333
3334  /**
3335   * Class that tracks the progress of a batch operations, accumulating status codes and tracking
3336   * the index at which processing is proceeding. These batch operations may get split into
3337   * mini-batches for processing.
3338   */
3339  private abstract static class BatchOperation<T> {
3340    protected final T[] operations;
3341    protected final OperationStatus[] retCodeDetails;
3342    protected final WALEdit[] walEditsFromCoprocessors;
3343    // reference family cell maps directly so coprocessors can mutate them if desired
3344    protected final Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>>[] familyCellMaps;
3345    // For Increment/Append operations
3346    protected final Result[] results;
3347
3348    protected final HRegion region;
3349    protected int nextIndexToProcess = 0;
3350    protected final ObservedExceptionsInBatch observedExceptions;
3351    // Durability of the batch (highest durability of all operations)
3352    protected Durability durability;
3353    protected boolean atomic = false;
3354
3355    public BatchOperation(final HRegion region, T[] operations) {
3356      this.operations = operations;
3357      this.retCodeDetails = new OperationStatus[operations.length];
3358      Arrays.fill(this.retCodeDetails, OperationStatus.NOT_RUN);
3359      this.walEditsFromCoprocessors = new WALEdit[operations.length];
3360      familyCellMaps = new Map[operations.length];
3361      this.results = new Result[operations.length];
3362
3363      this.region = region;
3364      observedExceptions = new ObservedExceptionsInBatch();
3365      durability = Durability.USE_DEFAULT;
3366    }
3367
3368    /**
3369     * Visitor interface for batch operations
3370     */
3371    @FunctionalInterface
3372    interface Visitor {
3373      /**
3374       * @param index operation index
3375       * @return If true continue visiting remaining entries, break otherwise
3376       */
3377      boolean visit(int index) throws IOException;
3378    }
3379
3380    /**
3381     * Helper method for visiting pending/ all batch operations
3382     */
3383    public void visitBatchOperations(boolean pendingOnly, int lastIndexExclusive, Visitor visitor)
3384      throws IOException {
3385      assert lastIndexExclusive <= this.size();
3386      for (int i = nextIndexToProcess; i < lastIndexExclusive; i++) {
3387        if (!pendingOnly || isOperationPending(i)) {
3388          if (!visitor.visit(i)) {
3389            break;
3390          }
3391        }
3392      }
3393    }
3394
3395    public abstract Mutation getMutation(int index);
3396
3397    public abstract long getNonceGroup(int index);
3398
3399    public abstract long getNonce(int index);
3400
3401    /**
3402     * This method is potentially expensive and useful mostly for non-replay CP path.
3403     */
3404    public abstract Mutation[] getMutationsForCoprocs();
3405
3406    public abstract boolean isInReplay();
3407
3408    public abstract long getOrigLogSeqNum();
3409

3411
3412    public abstract void closeRegionOperation() throws IOException;

3414    /**
3415     * Validates each mutation and prepares a batch for write. If necessary (non-replay case), runs
3416     * CP prePut()/preDelete()/preIncrement()/preAppend() hooks for all mutations in a batch. This
3417     * is intended to operate on entire batch and will be called from outside of class to check and
3418     * prepare batch. This can be implemented by calling helper method
3419     * {@link #checkAndPrepareMutation(int, long)} in a 'for' loop over mutations.
3420     */
3421    public abstract void checkAndPrepare() throws IOException;
3422
3423    /**
3424     * Implement any Put request specific check and prepare logic here. Please refer to
3425     * {@link #checkAndPrepareMutation(Mutation, long)} for how its used.
3426     */
3427    protected abstract void checkAndPreparePut(final Put p) throws IOException;
3428
3429    /**
3430     * If necessary, calls preBatchMutate() CP hook for a mini-batch and updates metrics, cell
3431     * count, tags and timestamp for all cells of all operations in a mini-batch.
3432     */
3433    public abstract void prepareMiniBatchOperations(
3434      MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, long timestamp,
3435      final List<RowLock> acquiredRowLocks) throws IOException;
3436
3437    /**
3438     * Write mini-batch operations to MemStore
3439     */
3440    public abstract WriteEntry writeMiniBatchOperationsToMemStore(
3441      final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, final WriteEntry writeEntry,
3442      long now) throws IOException;
3443
3444    protected void writeMiniBatchOperationsToMemStore(
3445      final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, final long writeNumber)
3446      throws IOException {
3447      MemStoreSizing memStoreAccounting = new NonThreadSafeMemStoreSizing();
3448      visitBatchOperations(true, miniBatchOp.getLastIndexExclusive(), (int index) -> {
3449        // We need to update the sequence id for following reasons.
3450        // 1) If the op is in replay mode, FSWALEntry#stampRegionSequenceId won't stamp sequence id.
3451        // 2) If no WAL, FSWALEntry won't be used
3452        // we use durability of the original mutation for the mutation passed by CP.
3453        if (isInReplay() || getMutation(index).getDurability() == Durability.SKIP_WAL) {
3454          region.updateSequenceId(familyCellMaps[index].values(), writeNumber);
3455        }
3456        applyFamilyMapToMemStore(familyCellMaps[index], memStoreAccounting);
3457        return true;
3458      });
3459      // update memStore size
3460      region.incMemStoreSize(memStoreAccounting.getDataSize(), memStoreAccounting.getHeapSize(),
3461        memStoreAccounting.getOffHeapSize(), memStoreAccounting.getCellsCount());
3462    }
3463
3464    public boolean isDone() {
3465      return nextIndexToProcess == operations.length;
3466    }
3467
3468    public int size() {
3469      return operations.length;
3470    }
3471
3472    public boolean isOperationPending(int index) {
3473      return retCodeDetails[index].getOperationStatusCode() == OperationStatusCode.NOT_RUN;
3474    }
3475
3476    public List<UUID> getClusterIds() {
3477      assert size() != 0;
3478      return getMutation(0).getClusterIds();
3479    }
