3481    boolean isAtomic() {
3482      return atomic;
3483    }
3484
3485    /**
3486     * Helper method that checks and prepares only one mutation. This can be used to implement
3487     * {@link #checkAndPrepare()} for entire Batch. NOTE: As CP
3488     * prePut()/preDelete()/preIncrement()/preAppend() hooks may modify mutations, this method
3489     * should be called after prePut()/preDelete()/preIncrement()/preAppend() CP hooks are run for
3490     * the mutation
3491     */
3492    protected void checkAndPrepareMutation(Mutation mutation, final long timestamp)
3493      throws IOException {
3494      region.checkRow(mutation.getRow(), "batchMutate");
3495      if (mutation instanceof Put) {
3496        // Check the families in the put. If bad, skip this one.
3497        checkAndPreparePut((Put) mutation);
3498        region.checkTimestamps(mutation.getFamilyCellMap(), timestamp);
3499      } else if (mutation instanceof Delete) {
3500        region.prepareDelete((Delete) mutation);
3501      } else if (mutation instanceof Increment || mutation instanceof Append) {
3502        region.checkFamilies(mutation.getFamilyCellMap().keySet(), mutation.getDurability());
3503      }
3504    }
3505
3506    protected void checkAndPrepareMutation(int index, long timestamp) throws IOException {
3507      Mutation mutation = getMutation(index);
3508      try {
3509        this.checkAndPrepareMutation(mutation, timestamp);
3510
3511        if (mutation instanceof Put || mutation instanceof Delete) {
3512          // store the family map reference to allow for mutations
3513          // we know that in mutation, only ExtendedCells are allow so here we do a fake cast, to
3514          // simplify later logic
3515          familyCellMaps[index] = (Map) mutation.getFamilyCellMap();
3516        }
3517
3518        // store durability for the batch (highest durability of all operations in the batch)
3519        Durability tmpDur = region.getEffectiveDurability(mutation.getDurability());
3520        if (tmpDur.ordinal() > durability.ordinal()) {
3521          durability = tmpDur;
3522        }
3523      } catch (NoSuchColumnFamilyException nscfe) {
3524        final String msg = "No such column family in batch mutation in region " + this;
3525        if (observedExceptions.hasSeenNoSuchFamily()) {
3526          LOG.warn(msg + nscfe.getMessage());
3527        } else {
3528          LOG.warn(msg, nscfe);
3529          observedExceptions.sawNoSuchFamily();
3530        }
3531        retCodeDetails[index] =
3532          new OperationStatus(OperationStatusCode.BAD_FAMILY, nscfe.getMessage());
3533        if (isAtomic()) { // fail, atomic means all or none
3534          throw nscfe;
3535        }
3536      } catch (FailedSanityCheckException fsce) {
3537        final String msg = "Batch Mutation did not pass sanity check in region " + this;
3538        if (observedExceptions.hasSeenFailedSanityCheck()) {
3539          LOG.warn(msg + fsce.getMessage());
3540        } else {
3541          LOG.warn(msg, fsce);
3542          observedExceptions.sawFailedSanityCheck();
3543        }
3544        retCodeDetails[index] =
3545          new OperationStatus(OperationStatusCode.SANITY_CHECK_FAILURE, fsce.getMessage());
3546        if (isAtomic()) {
3547          throw fsce;
3548        }
3549      } catch (WrongRegionException we) {
3550        final String msg = "Batch mutation had a row that does not belong to this region " + this;
3551        if (observedExceptions.hasSeenWrongRegion()) {
3552          LOG.warn(msg + we.getMessage());
3553        } else {
3554          LOG.warn(msg, we);
3555          observedExceptions.sawWrongRegion();
3556        }
3557        retCodeDetails[index] =
3558          new OperationStatus(OperationStatusCode.SANITY_CHECK_FAILURE, we.getMessage());
3559        if (isAtomic()) {
3560          throw we;
3561        }
3562      }
3563    }
3564
3565    /**
3566     * Creates Mini-batch of all operations [nextIndexToProcess, lastIndexExclusive) for which a row
3567     * lock can be acquired. All mutations with locked rows are considered to be In-progress
3568     * operations and hence the name {@link MiniBatchOperationInProgress}. Mini batch is window over
3569     * {@link BatchOperation} and contains contiguous pending operations.
3570     * @param acquiredRowLocks keeps track of rowLocks acquired.
3571     */
3572    public MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation>
3573      lockRowsAndBuildMiniBatch(List<RowLock> acquiredRowLocks) throws IOException {
3574      int readyToWriteCount = 0;
3575      int lastIndexExclusive = 0;
3576      RowLock prevRowLock = null;
3577      for (; lastIndexExclusive < size(); lastIndexExclusive++) {
3578        // It reaches the miniBatchSize, stop here and process the miniBatch
3579        // This only applies to non-atomic batch operations.
3580        if (!isAtomic() && (readyToWriteCount == region.miniBatchSize)) {
3581          break;
3582        }
3583
3584        if (!isOperationPending(lastIndexExclusive)) {
3585          continue;
3586        }
3587
3588        // HBASE-19389 Limit concurrency of put with dense (hundreds) columns to avoid exhausting
3589        // RS handlers, covering both MutationBatchOperation and ReplayBatchOperation
3590        // The BAD_FAMILY/SANITY_CHECK_FAILURE cases are handled in checkAndPrepare phase and won't
3591        // pass the isOperationPending check
3592        Map<byte[], List<Cell>> curFamilyCellMap =
3593          getMutation(lastIndexExclusive).getFamilyCellMap();
3594        try {
3595          // start the protector before acquiring row lock considering performance, and will finish
3596          // it when encountering exception
3597          region.storeHotnessProtector.start(curFamilyCellMap);
3598        } catch (RegionTooBusyException rtbe) {
3599          region.storeHotnessProtector.finish(curFamilyCellMap);
3600          if (isAtomic()) {
3601            throw rtbe;
3602          }
3603          retCodeDetails[lastIndexExclusive] =
3604            new OperationStatus(OperationStatusCode.STORE_TOO_BUSY, rtbe.getMessage());
3605          continue;
3606        }
3607
3608        Mutation mutation = getMutation(lastIndexExclusive);
3609        // If we haven't got any rows in our batch, we should block to get the next one.
3610        RowLock rowLock = null;
3611        boolean throwException = false;
3612        try {
3613          // if atomic then get exclusive lock, else shared lock
3614          rowLock = region.getRowLock(mutation.getRow(), !isAtomic(), prevRowLock);
3615        } catch (TimeoutIOException | InterruptedIOException e) {
3616          // NOTE: We will retry when other exceptions, but we should stop if we receive
3617          // TimeoutIOException or InterruptedIOException as operation has timed out or
3618          // interrupted respectively.
3619          throwException = true;
3620          throw e;
3621        } catch (IOException ioe) {
3622          LOG.warn("Failed getting lock, row={}, in region {}",
3623            Bytes.toStringBinary(mutation.getRow()), this, ioe);
3624          if (isAtomic()) { // fail, atomic means all or none
3625            throwException = true;
3626            throw ioe;
3627          }
3628        } catch (Throwable throwable) {
3629          throwException = true;
3630          throw throwable;
3631        } finally {
3632          if (throwException) {
3633            region.storeHotnessProtector.finish(curFamilyCellMap);
3634          }
3635        }
3636        if (rowLock == null) {
3637          // We failed to grab another lock
3638          if (isAtomic()) {
3639            region.storeHotnessProtector.finish(curFamilyCellMap);
3640            throw new IOException("Can't apply all operations atomically!");
3641          }
3642          break; // Stop acquiring more rows for this batch
3643        } else {
3644          if (rowLock != prevRowLock) {
3645            // It is a different row now, add this to the acquiredRowLocks and
3646            // set prevRowLock to the new returned rowLock
3647            acquiredRowLocks.add(rowLock);
3648            prevRowLock = rowLock;
3649          }
3650        }
3651
3652        readyToWriteCount++;
3653      }
3654      return createMiniBatch(lastIndexExclusive, readyToWriteCount);
3655    }
3656
3657    protected MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> createMiniBatch(final int lastIndexExclusive,
3658      final int readyToWriteCount) {
3659      return new MiniBatchOperationInProgress<>(getMutationsForCoprocs(), retCodeDetails,
3660        walEditsFromCoprocessors, nextIndexToProcess, lastIndexExclusive, readyToWriteCount);
3661    }
3662
3663    protected WALEdit createWALEdit(final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp) {
3664      return new WALEdit(miniBatchOp.getCellCount(), isInReplay());
3665    }
3666
3667    /**
3668     * Builds separate WALEdit per nonce by applying input mutations. If WALEdits from CP are
3669     * present, they are merged to result WALEdit.
3670     */
3671    public List<Pair<NonceKey, WALEdit>>
3672      buildWALEdits(final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp) throws IOException {
3673      List<Pair<NonceKey, WALEdit>> walEdits = new ArrayList<>();
3674
3675      visitBatchOperations(true, nextIndexToProcess + miniBatchOp.size(), new Visitor() {
3676        private Pair<NonceKey, WALEdit> curWALEditForNonce;
3677
3678        @Override
3679        public boolean visit(int index) throws IOException {
3680          Mutation m = getMutation(index);
3681          // we use durability of the original mutation for the mutation passed by CP.
3682          if (region.getEffectiveDurability(m.getDurability()) == Durability.SKIP_WAL) {
3683            region.recordMutationWithoutWal(m.getFamilyCellMap());
3684            /**
3685             * Here is for HBASE-26993,in order to make the new framework for region replication
3686             * could work for SKIP_WAL, we save the {@link Mutation} which
3687             * {@link Mutation#getDurability} is {@link Durability#SKIP_WAL} in miniBatchOp.
3688             */
3689            cacheSkipWALMutationForRegionReplication(miniBatchOp, walEdits, familyCellMaps[index]);
3690            return true;
3691          }
3692
3693          // the batch may contain multiple nonce keys (replay case). If so, write WALEdit for each.
3694          // Given how nonce keys are originally written, these should be contiguous.
3695          // They don't have to be, it will still work, just write more WALEdits than needed.
3696          long nonceGroup = getNonceGroup(index);
3697          long nonce = getNonce(index);
3698          if (
3699            curWALEditForNonce == null
3700              || curWALEditForNonce.getFirst().getNonceGroup() != nonceGroup
3701              || curWALEditForNonce.getFirst().getNonce() != nonce
3702          ) {
3703            curWALEditForNonce =
3704              new Pair<>(new NonceKey(nonceGroup, nonce), createWALEdit(miniBatchOp));
3705            walEdits.add(curWALEditForNonce);
3706          }
3707          WALEdit walEdit = curWALEditForNonce.getSecond();
3708
3709          // Add WAL edits from CPs.
3710          WALEdit fromCP = walEditsFromCoprocessors[index];
3711          List<Cell> cellsFromCP = fromCP == null ? Collections.emptyList() : fromCP.getCells();
3712          addNonSkipWALMutationsToWALEdit(miniBatchOp, walEdit, cellsFromCP, familyCellMaps[index]);
3713          return true;
3714        }
3715      });
3716      return walEdits;
3717    }
3718
3719    protected void addNonSkipWALMutationsToWALEdit(
3720      final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, WALEdit walEdit,
3721      List<Cell> cellsFromCP, Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> familyCellMap) {
3722      doAddCellsToWALEdit(walEdit, cellsFromCP, familyCellMap);
3723    }
3724
3725    protected static void doAddCellsToWALEdit(WALEdit walEdit, List<Cell> cellsFromCP,
3726      Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> familyCellMap) {
3727      walEdit.add(cellsFromCP);
3728      walEdit.add((Map) familyCellMap);
3729    }
3730
3731    protected abstract void cacheSkipWALMutationForRegionReplication(
3732      final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp,
3733      List<Pair<NonceKey, WALEdit>> walEdits, Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> familyCellMap);
3734
3735    /**
3736     * This method completes mini-batch operations by calling postBatchMutate() CP hook (if
3737     * required) and completing mvcc.
3738     */
3739    public void completeMiniBatchOperations(
3740      final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, final WriteEntry writeEntry)
3741      throws IOException {
3742      if (writeEntry != null) {
3743        region.mvcc.completeAndWait(writeEntry);
3744      }
3745    }
3746
3747    public void doPostOpCleanupForMiniBatch(
3748      final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, final WALEdit walEdit,
3749      boolean success) throws IOException {
3750      doFinishHotnessProtector(miniBatchOp);
3751    }
3752
3753    private void
3754      doFinishHotnessProtector(final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp) {
3755      // check and return if the protector is not enabled
3756      if (!region.storeHotnessProtector.isEnable()) {
3757        return;
3758      }
3759      // miniBatchOp is null, if and only if lockRowsAndBuildMiniBatch throwing exception.
3760      // This case was handled.
3761      if (miniBatchOp == null) {
3762        return;
3763      }
3764
3765      final int finalLastIndexExclusive = miniBatchOp.getLastIndexExclusive();
3766
3767      for (int i = nextIndexToProcess; i < finalLastIndexExclusive; i++) {
3768        switch (retCodeDetails[i].getOperationStatusCode()) {
3769          case SUCCESS:
3770          case FAILURE:
3771            region.storeHotnessProtector.finish(getMutation(i).getFamilyCellMap());
3772            break;
3773          default:
3774            // do nothing
3775            // We won't start the protector for NOT_RUN/BAD_FAMILY/SANITY_CHECK_FAILURE and the
3776            // STORE_TOO_BUSY case is handled in StoreHotnessProtector#start
3777            break;
3778        }
3779      }
3780    }
3781
3782    /**
3783     * Atomically apply the given map of family->edits to the memstore. This handles the consistency
3784     * control on its own, but the caller should already have locked updatesLock.readLock(). This
3785     * also does <b>not</b> check the families for validity.
3786     * @param familyMap Map of Cells by family
3787     */
3788    protected void applyFamilyMapToMemStore(Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> familyMap,
3789      MemStoreSizing memstoreAccounting) {
3790      for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> e : familyMap.entrySet()) {
3791        byte[] family = e.getKey();
3792        List<ExtendedCell> cells = e.getValue();
3793        assert cells instanceof RandomAccess;
3794        region.applyToMemStore(region.getStore(family), cells, false, memstoreAccounting);
3795      }
3796    }
3797  }
3798
3799  /**
3800   * Batch of mutation operations. Base class is shared with {@link ReplayBatchOperation} as most of
3801   * the logic is same.
3802   */
3803  private static class MutationBatchOperation extends BatchOperation<Mutation> {
3804
3805    // For nonce operations
3806    private long nonceGroup;
3807    private long nonce;
3808    protected boolean canProceed;
3809    private boolean regionReplicateEnable;
3810
3811    public MutationBatchOperation(final HRegion region, Mutation[] operations, boolean atomic,
3812      long nonceGroup, long nonce) {
3813      super(region, operations);
3814      this.atomic = atomic;
3815      this.nonceGroup = nonceGroup;
3816      this.nonce = nonce;
3817      this.regionReplicateEnable = region.regionReplicationSink.isPresent();
3818    }
3819
3820    @Override
3821    public Mutation getMutation(int index) {
3822      return this.operations[index];
3823    }
3824
3825    @Override
3826    public long getNonceGroup(int index) {
3827      return nonceGroup;
3828    }
3829
3830    @Override
3831    public long getNonce(int index) {
3832      return nonce;
3833    }
3834
3835    @Override
3836    public Mutation[] getMutationsForCoprocs() {
3837      return this.operations;
3838    }
3839
3840    @Override
3841    public boolean isInReplay() {
3842      return false;
3843    }
3844
3845    @Override
3846    public long getOrigLogSeqNum() {
3847      return SequenceId.NO_SEQUENCE_ID;
3848    }
3849
3850    @Override
3851    public void startRegionOperation() throws IOException {
3852      region.startRegionOperation(Operation.BATCH_MUTATE);
3853    }
3854
3855    @Override
3856    public void closeRegionOperation() throws IOException {
3857      region.closeRegionOperation(Operation.BATCH_MUTATE);
3858    }
3859
3860    @Override
3861    public void checkAndPreparePut(Put p) throws IOException {
3862      region.checkFamilies(p.getFamilyCellMap().keySet(), p.getDurability());
3863    }
3864
3865    @Override
3866    public void checkAndPrepare() throws IOException {
3867      // index 0: puts, index 1: deletes, index 2: increments, index 3: append
3868      final int[] metrics = { 0, 0, 0, 0 };
3869
3870      visitBatchOperations(true, this.size(), new Visitor() {
3871        private long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
3872        private WALEdit walEdit;
3873
3874        @Override
3875        public boolean visit(int index) throws IOException {
3876          // Run coprocessor pre hook outside of locks to avoid deadlock
3877          if (region.coprocessorHost != null) {
3878            if (walEdit == null) {
3879              walEdit = new WALEdit();
3880            }
3881            callPreMutateCPHook(index, walEdit, metrics);
3882            if (!walEdit.isEmpty()) {
3883              walEditsFromCoprocessors[index] = walEdit;
3884              walEdit = null;
3885            }
3886          }
3887          if (isOperationPending(index)) {
3888            // TODO: Currently validation is done with current time before acquiring locks and
3889            // updates are done with different timestamps after acquiring locks. This behavior is
3890            // inherited from the code prior to this change. Can this be changed?
3891            checkAndPrepareMutation(index, now);
3892          }
3893          return true;
3894        }
3895      });
3896
3897      // FIXME: we may update metrics twice! here for all operations bypassed by CP and later in
3898      // normal processing.
3899      // Update metrics in same way as it is done when we go the normal processing route (we now
3900      // update general metrics though a Coprocessor did the work).
3901      if (region.metricsRegion != null) {
3902        if (metrics[0] > 0) {
3903          // There were some Puts in the batch.
3904          region.metricsRegion.updatePut();
3905        }
3906        if (metrics[1] > 0) {
3907          // There were some Deletes in the batch.
3908          region.metricsRegion.updateDelete();
3909        }
3910        if (metrics[2] > 0) {
3911          // There were some Increment in the batch.
3912          region.metricsRegion.updateIncrement();
3913        }
3914        if (metrics[3] > 0) {
3915          // There were some Append in the batch.
3916          region.metricsRegion.updateAppend();
3917        }
3918      }
3919    }
3920
3921    @Override
3922    public void prepareMiniBatchOperations(MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp,
3923      long timestamp, final List<RowLock> acquiredRowLocks) throws IOException {
3924      // For nonce operations
3925      canProceed = startNonceOperation();
3926
3927      visitBatchOperations(true, miniBatchOp.getLastIndexExclusive(), (int index) -> {
3928        Mutation mutation = getMutation(index);
3929        if (mutation instanceof Put) {
3930          HRegion.updateCellTimestamps(familyCellMaps[index].values(), Bytes.toBytes(timestamp));
3931          miniBatchOp.incrementNumOfPuts();
3932        } else if (mutation instanceof Delete) {
3933          region.prepareDeleteTimestamps(mutation, familyCellMaps[index], Bytes.toBytes(timestamp));
3934          miniBatchOp.incrementNumOfDeletes();
3935        } else if (mutation instanceof Increment || mutation instanceof Append) {
3936          boolean returnResults;
3937          if (mutation instanceof Increment) {
3938            returnResults = ((Increment) mutation).isReturnResults();
3939          } else {
3940            returnResults = ((Append) mutation).isReturnResults();
3941          }
3942
3943          // For nonce operations
3944          if (!canProceed) {
3945            Result result;
3946            if (returnResults) {
3947              // convert duplicate increment/append to get
3948              List<Cell> results = region.get(toGet(mutation), false, nonceGroup, nonce);
3949              result = Result.create(results);
3950            } else {
3951              result = Result.EMPTY_RESULT;
3952            }
3953            retCodeDetails[index] = new OperationStatus(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS, result);
3954            return true;
3955          }
3956
3957          Result result = null;
3958          if (region.coprocessorHost != null) {
3959            if (mutation instanceof Increment) {
3960              result = region.coprocessorHost.preIncrementAfterRowLock((Increment) mutation);
3961            } else {
3962              result = region.coprocessorHost.preAppendAfterRowLock((Append) mutation);
3963            }
3964          }
3965          if (result != null) {
3966            retCodeDetails[index] = new OperationStatus(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS,
3967              returnResults ? result : Result.EMPTY_RESULT);
3968            return true;
3969          }
3970
3971          List<ExtendedCell> results = returnResults ? new ArrayList<>(mutation.size()) : null;
3972          familyCellMaps[index] = reckonDeltas(mutation, results, timestamp);
3973          this.results[index] = results != null ? Result.create(results) : Result.EMPTY_RESULT;
3974
3975          if (mutation instanceof Increment) {
3976            miniBatchOp.incrementNumOfIncrements();
3977          } else {
3978            miniBatchOp.incrementNumOfAppends();
3979          }
3980        }
3981        region.rewriteCellTags(familyCellMaps[index], mutation);
3982
3983        // update cell count
3984        if (region.getEffectiveDurability(mutation.getDurability()) != Durability.SKIP_WAL) {
3985          for (List<Cell> cells : mutation.getFamilyCellMap().values()) {
3986            miniBatchOp.addCellCount(cells.size());
3987          }
3988        }
3989
3990        WALEdit fromCP = walEditsFromCoprocessors[index];
3991        if (fromCP != null) {
3992          miniBatchOp.addCellCount(fromCP.size());
3993        }
3994        return true;
3995      });
3996
3997      if (region.coprocessorHost != null) {
3998        // calling the pre CP hook for batch mutation
3999        region.coprocessorHost.preBatchMutate(miniBatchOp);
4000        checkAndMergeCPMutations(miniBatchOp, acquiredRowLocks, timestamp);
4001      }
4002    }
4003
4004    /**
4005     * Starts the nonce operation for a mutation, if needed.
4006     * @return whether to proceed this mutation.
4007     */
4008    private boolean startNonceOperation() throws IOException {
4009      if (
4010        region.rsServices == null || region.rsServices.getNonceManager() == null
4011          || nonce == HConstants.NO_NONCE
4012      ) {
4013        return true;
4014      }
4015      boolean canProceed;
4016      try {
4017        canProceed =
4018          region.rsServices.getNonceManager().startOperation(nonceGroup, nonce, region.rsServices);
4019      } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
4020        throw new InterruptedIOException("Nonce start operation interrupted");
4021      }
4022      return canProceed;
4023    }
4024
4025    /**
4026     * Ends nonce operation for a mutation, if needed.
4027     * @param success Whether the operation for this nonce has succeeded.
4028     */
4029    private void endNonceOperation(boolean success) {
4030      if (
4031        region.rsServices != null && region.rsServices.getNonceManager() != null
4032          && nonce != HConstants.NO_NONCE
4033      ) {
4034        region.rsServices.getNonceManager().endOperation(nonceGroup, nonce, success);
4035      }
4036    }
4037
4038    private static Get toGet(final Mutation mutation) throws IOException {
4039      assert mutation instanceof Increment || mutation instanceof Append;
4040      Get get = new Get(mutation.getRow());
4041      CellScanner cellScanner = mutation.cellScanner();
4042      while (cellScanner.advance()) {
4043        Cell cell = cellScanner.current();
4044        get.addColumn(CellUtil.cloneFamily(cell), CellUtil.cloneQualifier(cell));
4045      }
4046      if (mutation instanceof Increment) {
4047        // Increment
4048        Increment increment = (Increment) mutation;
4049        get.setTimeRange(increment.getTimeRange().getMin(), increment.getTimeRange().getMax());
4050      } else {
4051        // Append
4052        Append append = (Append) mutation;
4053        get.setTimeRange(append.getTimeRange().getMin(), append.getTimeRange().getMax());
4054      }
4055      for (Entry<String, byte[]> entry : mutation.getAttributesMap().entrySet()) {
4056        get.setAttribute(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
4057      }
4058      return get;
4059    }
4060
4061    private Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> reckonDeltas(Mutation mutation,
4062      List<ExtendedCell> results, long now) throws IOException {
4063      assert mutation instanceof Increment || mutation instanceof Append;
4064      Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> ret = new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
4065      // Process a Store/family at a time.
4066      for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<Cell>> entry : mutation.getFamilyCellMap().entrySet()) {
4067        final byte[] columnFamilyName = entry.getKey();
4068        List<ExtendedCell> deltas = (List) entry.getValue();
4069        // Reckon for the Store what to apply to WAL and MemStore.
4070        List<ExtendedCell> toApply =
4071          reckonDeltasByStore(region.stores.get(columnFamilyName), mutation, now, deltas, results);
4072        if (!toApply.isEmpty()) {
4073          for (ExtendedCell cell : toApply) {
4074            HStore store = region.getStore(cell);
4075            if (store == null) {
4076              region.checkFamily(CellUtil.cloneFamily(cell));
4077            } else {
4078              ret.computeIfAbsent(store.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName(),
4079                key -> new ArrayList<>()).add(cell);
4080            }
4081          }
4082        }
4083      }
4084      return ret;
4085    }
4086
4087    /**
4088     * Reckon the Cells to apply to WAL, memstore, and to return to the Client in passed column
4089     * family/Store. Does Get of current value and then adds passed in deltas for this Store
4090     * returning the result.
4091     * @param mutation The encompassing Mutation object
4092     * @param deltas   Changes to apply to this Store; either increment amount or data to append
4093     * @param results  In here we accumulate all the Cells we are to return to the client. If null,
4094     *                 client doesn't want results returned.
4095     * @return Resulting Cells after <code>deltas</code> have been applied to current values. Side
4096     *         effect is our filling out of the <code>results</code> List.
4097     */
4098    private List<ExtendedCell> reckonDeltasByStore(HStore store, Mutation mutation, long now,
4099      List<ExtendedCell> deltas, List<ExtendedCell> results) throws IOException {
4100      assert mutation instanceof Increment || mutation instanceof Append;
4101      byte[] columnFamily = store.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName();
4102      List<Pair<ExtendedCell, ExtendedCell>> cellPairs = new ArrayList<>(deltas.size());
4103
4104      // Sort the cells so that they match the order that they appear in the Get results.
4105      // Otherwise, we won't be able to find the existing values if the cells are not specified
4106      // in order by the client since cells are in an array list.
4107      deltas.sort(store.getComparator());
4108
4109      // Get previous values for all columns in this family.
4110      Get get = new Get(mutation.getRow());
4111      for (ExtendedCell cell : deltas) {
4112        get.addColumn(columnFamily, CellUtil.cloneQualifier(cell));
4113      }
4114      TimeRange tr;
4115      if (mutation instanceof Increment) {
4116        tr = ((Increment) mutation).getTimeRange();
4117      } else {
4118        tr = ((Append) mutation).getTimeRange();
4119      }
4120
4121      if (tr != null) {
4122        get.setTimeRange(tr.getMin(), tr.getMax());
4123      }
4124
4125      try (RegionScanner scanner = region.getScanner(new Scan(get))) {
4126        // NOTE: Please don't use HRegion.get() instead,
4127        // because it will copy cells to heap. See HBASE-26036
4128        List<ExtendedCell> currentValues = new ArrayList<>();
4129        scanner.next((List) currentValues);
4130        // Iterate the input columns and update existing values if they were found, otherwise
4131        // add new column initialized to the delta amount
4132        int currentValuesIndex = 0;
4133        for (int i = 0; i < deltas.size(); i++) {
4134          ExtendedCell delta = deltas.get(i);
4135          ExtendedCell currentValue = null;
4136          if (
4137            currentValuesIndex < currentValues.size()
4138              && CellUtil.matchingQualifier(currentValues.get(currentValuesIndex), delta)
4139          ) {
4140            currentValue = currentValues.get(currentValuesIndex);
4141            if (i < (deltas.size() - 1) && !CellUtil.matchingQualifier(delta, deltas.get(i + 1))) {
4142              currentValuesIndex++;
4143            }
4144          }
4145          // Switch on whether this an increment or an append building the new Cell to apply.
4146          ExtendedCell newCell;
4147          if (mutation instanceof Increment) {
4148            long deltaAmount = getLongValue(delta);
4149            final long newValue =
4150              currentValue == null ? deltaAmount : getLongValue(currentValue) + deltaAmount;
4151            newCell = reckonDelta(delta, currentValue, columnFamily, now, mutation,
4152              (oldCell) -> Bytes.toBytes(newValue));
4153          } else {
4154            newCell = reckonDelta(delta, currentValue, columnFamily, now, mutation,
4155              (oldCell) -> ByteBuffer
4156                .wrap(new byte[delta.getValueLength() + oldCell.getValueLength()])
4157                .put(oldCell.getValueArray(), oldCell.getValueOffset(), oldCell.getValueLength())
4158                .put(delta.getValueArray(), delta.getValueOffset(), delta.getValueLength())
4159                .array());
4160          }
4161          if (region.maxCellSize > 0) {
4162            int newCellSize = PrivateCellUtil.estimatedSerializedSizeOf(newCell);
4163            if (newCellSize > region.maxCellSize) {
4164              String msg = "Cell with size " + newCellSize + " exceeds limit of "
4165                + region.maxCellSize + " bytes in region " + this;
4166              LOG.debug(msg);
4167              throw new DoNotRetryIOException(msg);
4168            }
4169          }
4170          cellPairs.add(new Pair<>(currentValue, newCell));
4171          // Add to results to get returned to the Client. If null, cilent does not want results.
4172          if (results != null) {
4173            results.add(newCell);
4174          }
4175        }
4176        // Give coprocessors a chance to update the new cells before apply to WAL or memstore
4177        if (region.coprocessorHost != null) {
4178          // Here the operation must be increment or append.
4179          cellPairs = mutation instanceof Increment
4180            ? region.coprocessorHost.postIncrementBeforeWAL(mutation, (List) cellPairs)
4181            : region.coprocessorHost.postAppendBeforeWAL(mutation, (List) cellPairs);
4182        }
4183      }
4184      return cellPairs.stream().map(Pair::getSecond).collect(Collectors.toList());
4185    }
4186
4187    private static ExtendedCell reckonDelta(final Cell delta, final Cell currentCell,
4188      final byte[] columnFamily, final long now, Mutation mutation, Function<Cell, byte[]> supplier)
4189      throws IOException {
4190      // Forward any tags found on the delta.
4191      List<Tag> tags = TagUtil.carryForwardTags(delta);
4192      if (currentCell != null) {
4193        tags = TagUtil.carryForwardTags(tags, currentCell);
4194        tags = TagUtil.carryForwardTTLTag(tags, mutation.getTTL());
4195        byte[] newValue = supplier.apply(currentCell);
4196        return ExtendedCellBuilderFactory.create(CellBuilderType.SHALLOW_COPY)
4197          .setRow(mutation.getRow(), 0, mutation.getRow().length)
4198          .setFamily(columnFamily, 0, columnFamily.length)
4199          // copy the qualifier if the cell is located in shared memory.
4200          .setQualifier(CellUtil.cloneQualifier(delta))
4201          .setTimestamp(Math.max(currentCell.getTimestamp() + 1, now))
4202          .setType(KeyValue.Type.Put.getCode()).setValue(newValue, 0, newValue.length)
4203          .setTags(TagUtil.fromList(tags)).build();
4204      } else {
4205        tags = TagUtil.carryForwardTTLTag(tags, mutation.getTTL());
4206        PrivateCellUtil.updateLatestStamp(delta, now);
4207        assert delta instanceof ExtendedCell;
4208        ExtendedCell deltaCell = (ExtendedCell) delta;
4209        return CollectionUtils.isEmpty(tags)
4210          ? deltaCell
4211          : PrivateCellUtil.createCell(deltaCell, tags);
4212      }
4213    }
4214
4215    /** Returns Get the long out of the passed in Cell */
4216    private static long getLongValue(final Cell cell) throws DoNotRetryIOException {
4217      int len = cell.getValueLength();
4218      if (len != Bytes.SIZEOF_LONG) {
4219        // throw DoNotRetryIOException instead of IllegalArgumentException
4220        throw new DoNotRetryIOException("Field is not a long, it's " + len + " bytes wide");
4221      }
4222      return PrivateCellUtil.getValueAsLong(cell);
4223    }

4225    @Override
4226    public List<Pair<NonceKey, WALEdit>>
4227      buildWALEdits(final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp) throws IOException {
4228      List<Pair<NonceKey, WALEdit>> walEdits = super.buildWALEdits(miniBatchOp);
4229      // for MutationBatchOperation, more than one nonce is not allowed
4230      if (walEdits.size() > 1) {
4231        throw new IOException("Found multiple nonce keys per batch!");
4232      }
4233      return walEdits;
4234    }

4236    /**
4237     * Here is for HBASE-26993,in order to make the new framework for region replication could work
4238     * for SKIP_WAL, we save the {@link Mutation} which {@link Mutation#getDurability} is
4239     * {@link Durability#SKIP_WAL} in miniBatchOp.
4240     */
4241    @Override
4242    protected void cacheSkipWALMutationForRegionReplication(
4243      MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp,
4244      List<Pair<NonceKey, WALEdit>> nonceKeyAndWALEdits,
4245      Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> familyCellMap) {
4246      if (!this.regionReplicateEnable) {
4247        return;
4248      }
4249
4250      WALEdit walEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL =
4251        miniBatchOp.getWalEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL();
4252      /**
4253       * When there is a SKIP_WAL {@link Mutation},we create a new {@link WALEdit} for replicating
4254       * to region replica,first we fill the existing {@link WALEdit} to it and then add the
4255       * {@link Mutation} which is SKIP_WAL to it.
4256       */
4257      if (walEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL == null) {
4258        walEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL =
4259          this.createWALEditForReplicateSkipWAL(miniBatchOp, nonceKeyAndWALEdits);
4260        miniBatchOp.setWalEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL(walEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL);
4261      }
4262      walEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL.add((Map) familyCellMap);
4263
4264    }
4265
4266    private WALEdit createWALEditForReplicateSkipWAL(
4267      MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp,
4268      List<Pair<NonceKey, WALEdit>> nonceKeyAndWALEdits) {
4269      if (nonceKeyAndWALEdits.isEmpty()) {
4270        return this.createWALEdit(miniBatchOp);
4271      }
4272      // for MutationBatchOperation, more than one nonce is not allowed
4273      assert nonceKeyAndWALEdits.size() == 1;
4274      WALEdit currentWALEdit = nonceKeyAndWALEdits.get(0).getSecond();
4275      return new WALEdit(currentWALEdit);
4276    }
4277
4278    @Override
4279    protected void addNonSkipWALMutationsToWALEdit(
4280      final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, WALEdit walEdit,
4281      List<Cell> cellsFromCP, Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> familyCellMap) {
4282
4283      super.addNonSkipWALMutationsToWALEdit(miniBatchOp, walEdit, cellsFromCP, familyCellMap);
4284      WALEdit walEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL =
4285        miniBatchOp.getWalEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL();
4286      if (walEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL == null) {
4287        return;
4288      }
4289      /**
4290       * When walEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL is not null,it means there exists SKIP_WAL
4291       * {@link Mutation} and we create a new {@link WALEdit} in
4292       * {@link MutationBatchOperation#cacheSkipWALMutationForReplicateRegionReplica} for
4293       * replicating to region replica, so here we also add non SKIP_WAL{@link Mutation}s to
4294       * walEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL.
4295       */
4296      doAddCellsToWALEdit(walEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL, cellsFromCP, familyCellMap);
4297    }

4299    @Override
4300    public WriteEntry writeMiniBatchOperationsToMemStore(
4301      final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, @Nullable WriteEntry writeEntry,
4302      long now) throws IOException {
4303      boolean newWriteEntry = false;
4304      if (writeEntry == null) {
4305        writeEntry = region.mvcc.begin();
4306        newWriteEntry = true;
4307      }
4308      super.writeMiniBatchOperationsToMemStore(miniBatchOp, writeEntry.getWriteNumber());
4309      if (newWriteEntry) {
4310        /**
4311         * Here is for HBASE-26993 case 2,all {@link Mutation}s are {@link Durability#SKIP_WAL}. In
4312         * order to make the new framework for region replication could work for SKIP_WAL,because
4313         * there is no {@link RegionReplicationSink#add} attached in {@link HRegion#doWALAppend},so
4314         * here we get {@link WALEdit} from
4315         * {@link MiniBatchOperationInProgress#getWalEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL} and attach
4316         * {@link RegionReplicationSink#add} to the new mvcc writeEntry.
4317         */
4318        attachRegionReplicationToMVCCEntry(miniBatchOp, writeEntry, now);
4319      }
4320      return writeEntry;
4321    }
4322
4323    private WALKeyImpl createWALKey(long now) {
4324      // for MutationBatchOperation,isReplay is false.
4325      return this.region.createWALKeyForWALAppend(false, this, now, this.nonceGroup, this.nonce);
4326    }
4327
4328    /**
4329     * Create {@link WALKeyImpl} and get {@link WALEdit} from miniBatchOp and attach
4330     * {@link RegionReplicationSink#add} to the mvccWriteEntry.
4331     */
4332    private void attachRegionReplicationToMVCCEntry(
4333      final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, WriteEntry mvccWriteEntry, long now)
4334      throws IOException {
4335      if (!this.regionReplicateEnable) {
4336        return;
4337      }
4338      assert !mvccWriteEntry.getCompletionAction().isPresent();
4339
4340      final WALKeyImpl walKey = this.createWALKey(now);
4341      walKey.setWriteEntry(mvccWriteEntry);
4342      region.doAttachReplicateRegionReplicaAction(walKey,
4343        miniBatchOp.getWalEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL(), mvccWriteEntry);
4344    }

4346    @Override
4347    public void completeMiniBatchOperations(
4348      final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, final WriteEntry writeEntry)
4349      throws IOException {
4350      // TODO: can it be done after completing mvcc?
4351      // calling the post CP hook for batch mutation
4352      if (region.coprocessorHost != null) {
4353        region.coprocessorHost.postBatchMutate(miniBatchOp);
4354      }
4355      super.completeMiniBatchOperations(miniBatchOp, writeEntry);
4356
4357      if (nonce != HConstants.NO_NONCE) {
4358        if (region.rsServices != null && region.rsServices.getNonceManager() != null) {
4359          region.rsServices.getNonceManager().addMvccToOperationContext(nonceGroup, nonce,
4360            writeEntry.getWriteNumber());
4361        }
4362      }
4363    }
4364
4365    @Override
4366    public void doPostOpCleanupForMiniBatch(MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp,
4367      final WALEdit walEdit, boolean success) throws IOException {
4368
4369      super.doPostOpCleanupForMiniBatch(miniBatchOp, walEdit, success);
4370      if (miniBatchOp != null) {
4371        // synced so that the coprocessor contract is adhered to.
4372        if (region.coprocessorHost != null) {
4373          visitBatchOperations(false, miniBatchOp.getLastIndexExclusive(), (int i) -> {
4374            // only for successful puts/deletes/increments/appends
4375            if (retCodeDetails[i].getOperationStatusCode() == OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS) {
4376              Mutation m = getMutation(i);
4377              if (m instanceof Put) {
4378                region.coprocessorHost.postPut((Put) m, walEdit);
4379              } else if (m instanceof Delete) {
4380                region.coprocessorHost.postDelete((Delete) m, walEdit);
4381              } else if (m instanceof Increment) {
4382                Result result =
4383                  region.getCoprocessorHost().postIncrement((Increment) m, results[i], walEdit);
4384                if (result != results[i]) {
4385                  retCodeDetails[i] =
4386                    new OperationStatus(retCodeDetails[i].getOperationStatusCode(), result);
4387                }
4388              } else if (m instanceof Append) {
4389                Result result =
4390                  region.getCoprocessorHost().postAppend((Append) m, results[i], walEdit);
4391                if (result != results[i]) {
4392                  retCodeDetails[i] =
4393                    new OperationStatus(retCodeDetails[i].getOperationStatusCode(), result);
4394                }
4395              }
4396            }
4397            return true;
4398          });
4399        }
4400
4401        // For nonce operations
4402        if (canProceed && nonce != HConstants.NO_NONCE) {
4403          boolean[] areAllIncrementsAndAppendsSuccessful = new boolean[] { true };
4404          visitBatchOperations(false, miniBatchOp.getLastIndexExclusive(), (int i) -> {
4405            Mutation mutation = getMutation(i);
4406            if (mutation instanceof Increment || mutation instanceof Append) {
4407              if (retCodeDetails[i].getOperationStatusCode() != OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS) {
4408                areAllIncrementsAndAppendsSuccessful[0] = false;
4409                return false;
4410              }
4411            }
4412            return true;
4413          });
4414          endNonceOperation(areAllIncrementsAndAppendsSuccessful[0]);
4415        }
4416
4417        // See if the column families were consistent through the whole thing.
4418        // if they were then keep them. If they were not then pass a null.
4419        // null will be treated as unknown.
4420        // Total time taken might be involving Puts, Deletes, Increments and Appends.
4421        // Split the time for puts and deletes based on the total number of Puts, Deletes,
4422        // Increments and Appends.
4423        if (region.metricsRegion != null) {
4424          if (miniBatchOp.getNumOfPuts() > 0) {
4425            // There were some Puts in the batch.
4426            region.metricsRegion.updatePut();
4427          }
4428          if (miniBatchOp.getNumOfDeletes() > 0) {
4429            // There were some Deletes in the batch.
4430            region.metricsRegion.updateDelete();
4431          }
4432          if (miniBatchOp.getNumOfIncrements() > 0) {
4433            // There were some Increments in the batch.
4434            region.metricsRegion.updateIncrement();
4435          }
4436          if (miniBatchOp.getNumOfAppends() > 0) {
4437            // There were some Appends in the batch.
4438            region.metricsRegion.updateAppend();
4439          }
4440        }
4441      }
4442
4443      if (region.coprocessorHost != null) {
4444        // call the coprocessor hook to do any finalization steps after the put is done
4445        region.coprocessorHost.postBatchMutateIndispensably(
4446          miniBatchOp != null ? miniBatchOp : createMiniBatch(size(), 0), success);
4447      }
4448    }
4449
4450    /**
4451     * Runs prePut/preDelete/preIncrement/preAppend coprocessor hook for input mutation in a batch
4452     * @param metrics Array of 2 ints. index 0: count of puts, index 1: count of deletes, index 2:
4453     *                count of increments and 3: count of appends
4454     */
4455    private void callPreMutateCPHook(int index, final WALEdit walEdit, final int[] metrics)
4456      throws IOException {
4457      Mutation m = getMutation(index);
4458      if (m instanceof Put) {
4459        if (region.coprocessorHost.prePut((Put) m, walEdit)) {
4460          // pre hook says skip this Put
4461          // mark as success and skip in doMiniBatchMutation
4462          metrics[0]++;
4463          retCodeDetails[index] = OperationStatus.SUCCESS;
4464        }
4465      } else if (m instanceof Delete) {
4466        Delete curDel = (Delete) m;
4467        if (curDel.getFamilyCellMap().isEmpty()) {
4468          // handle deleting a row case
4469          // TODO: prepareDelete() has been called twice, before and after preDelete() CP hook.
4470          // Can this be avoided?
4471          region.prepareDelete(curDel);
4472        }
4473        if (region.coprocessorHost.preDelete(curDel, walEdit)) {
4474          // pre hook says skip this Delete
4475          // mark as success and skip in doMiniBatchMutation
4476          metrics[1]++;
4477          retCodeDetails[index] = OperationStatus.SUCCESS;
4478        }
4479      } else if (m instanceof Increment) {
4480        Increment increment = (Increment) m;
4481        Result result = region.coprocessorHost.preIncrement(increment, walEdit);
4482        if (result != null) {
4483          // pre hook says skip this Increment
4484          // mark as success and skip in doMiniBatchMutation
4485          metrics[2]++;
4486          retCodeDetails[index] = new OperationStatus(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS, result);
4487        }
4488      } else if (m instanceof Append) {
4489        Append append = (Append) m;
4490        Result result = region.coprocessorHost.preAppend(append, walEdit);
4491        if (result != null) {
4492          // pre hook says skip this Append
4493          // mark as success and skip in doMiniBatchMutation
4494          metrics[3]++;
4495          retCodeDetails[index] = new OperationStatus(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS, result);
4496        }
4497      } else {
4498        String msg = "Put/Delete/Increment/Append mutations only supported in a batch";
4499        retCodeDetails[index] = new OperationStatus(OperationStatusCode.FAILURE, msg);
4500        if (isAtomic()) { // fail, atomic means all or none
4501          throw new IOException(msg);
4502        }
4503      }
4504    }
4505
4506    // TODO Support Increment/Append operations
4507    private void checkAndMergeCPMutations(final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp,
4508      final List<RowLock> acquiredRowLocks, final long timestamp) throws IOException {
4509      visitBatchOperations(true, nextIndexToProcess + miniBatchOp.size(), (int i) -> {
4510        // we pass (i - firstIndex) below since the call expects a relative index
4511        Mutation[] cpMutations = miniBatchOp.getOperationsFromCoprocessors(i - nextIndexToProcess);
4512        if (cpMutations == null) {
4513          return true;
4514        }
4515        // Else Coprocessor added more Mutations corresponding to the Mutation at this index.
4516        Mutation mutation = getMutation(i);
4517        for (Mutation cpMutation : cpMutations) {
4518          this.checkAndPrepareMutation(cpMutation, timestamp);
4519
4520          // Acquire row locks. If not, the whole batch will fail.
4521          acquiredRowLocks.add(region.getRowLock(cpMutation.getRow(), true, null));
4522
4523          // Returned mutations from coprocessor correspond to the Mutation at index i. We can
4524          // directly add the cells from those mutations to the familyMaps of this mutation.
4525          Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> cpFamilyMap = (Map) cpMutation.getFamilyCellMap();
4526          region.rewriteCellTags(cpFamilyMap, mutation);
4527          // will get added to the memStore later
4528          mergeFamilyMaps(familyCellMaps[i], cpFamilyMap);
4529
4530          // The durability of returned mutation is replaced by the corresponding mutation.
4531          // If the corresponding mutation contains the SKIP_WAL, we shouldn't count the
4532          // cells of returned mutation.
4533          if (region.getEffectiveDurability(mutation.getDurability()) != Durability.SKIP_WAL) {
4534            for (List<ExtendedCell> cells : cpFamilyMap.values()) {
4535              miniBatchOp.addCellCount(cells.size());
4536            }
4537          }
4538        }
4539        return true;
4540      });
4541    }
4542
4543    private void mergeFamilyMaps(Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> familyMap,
4544      Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> toBeMerged) {
4545      for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> entry : toBeMerged.entrySet()) {
4546        List<ExtendedCell> cells = familyMap.get(entry.getKey());
4547        if (cells == null) {
4548          familyMap.put(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
4549        } else {
4550          cells.addAll(entry.getValue());
4551        }
4552      }
4553    }
4554  }

4613    /**
4614     * During replay, there could exist column families which are removed between region server
4615     * failure and replay
4616     */
4617    @Override
4618    protected void checkAndPreparePut(Put p) throws IOException {
4619      Map<byte[], List<Cell>> familyCellMap = p.getFamilyCellMap();
4620      List<byte[]> nonExistentList = null;
4621      for (byte[] family : familyCellMap.keySet()) {
4622        if (!region.htableDescriptor.hasColumnFamily(family)) {
4623          if (nonExistentList == null) {
4624            nonExistentList = new ArrayList<>();
4625          }
4626          nonExistentList.add(family);
4627        }
4628      }
4629      if (nonExistentList != null) {
4630        for (byte[] family : nonExistentList) {
4631          // Perhaps schema was changed between crash and replay
4632          LOG.info("No family for {} omit from reply in region {}.", Bytes.toString(family), this);
4633          familyCellMap.remove(family);
4634        }
4635      }
4636    }
4637
4638    @Override
4639    public void checkAndPrepare() throws IOException {
4640      long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
4641      visitBatchOperations(true, this.size(), (int index) -> {
4642        checkAndPrepareMutation(index, now);
4643        return true;
4644      });
4645    }
4646
4647    @Override
4648    public void prepareMiniBatchOperations(MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp,
4649      long timestamp, final List<RowLock> acquiredRowLocks) throws IOException {
4650      visitBatchOperations(true, miniBatchOp.getLastIndexExclusive(), (int index) -> {
4651        // update cell count
4652        for (List<Cell> cells : getMutation(index).getFamilyCellMap().values()) {
4653          miniBatchOp.addCellCount(cells.size());
4654        }
4655        return true;
4656      });
4657    }

4662      long now) throws IOException {

4665    }

4669      final MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, final WriteEntry writeEntry)
4670      throws IOException {
4671      super.completeMiniBatchOperations(miniBatchOp, writeEntry);
4672      region.mvcc.advanceTo(getOrigLogSeqNum());
4673    }

4684  public OperationStatus[] batchMutate(Mutation[] mutations, boolean atomic, long nonceGroup,
4685    long nonce) throws IOException {
4686    // As it stands, this is used for 3 things
4687    // * batchMutate with single mutation - put/delete/increment/append, separate or from
4688    // checkAndMutate.
4689    // * coprocessor calls (see ex. BulkDeleteEndpoint).
4690    // So nonces are not really ever used by HBase. They could be by coprocs, and checkAnd...
4691    return batchMutate(new MutationBatchOperation(this, mutations, atomic, nonceGroup, nonce));
4692  }

4694  @Override
4695  public OperationStatus[] batchMutate(Mutation[] mutations) throws IOException {
4696    // If the mutations has any Increment/Append operations, we need to do batchMutate atomically
4697    boolean atomic =
4698      Arrays.stream(mutations).anyMatch(m -> m instanceof Increment || m instanceof Append);
4699    return batchMutate(mutations, atomic);
4700  }

4704      () -> batchMutate(mutations, atomic, HConstants.NO_NONCE, HConstants.NO_NONCE),
4705      () -> createRegionSpan("Region.batchMutate"));

4708  /**
4709   * @deprecated Since 3.0.0, will be removed in 4.0.0. Now we use
4710   *             {@link #replayWALEntry(WALEntry, CellScanner)} for replaying edits at secondary
4711   *             replica side.
4712   */
4713  @Deprecated
4714  OperationStatus[] batchReplay(MutationReplay[] mutations, long replaySeqId) throws IOException {
4715    if (
4716      !RegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(getRegionInfo())
4717        && replaySeqId < lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId
4718    ) {
4719      // if it is a secondary replica we should ignore these entries silently
4720      // since they are coming out of order
4721      if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
4722        LOG.trace(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Skipping " + mutations.length
4723          + " mutations with replaySeqId=" + replaySeqId
4724          + " which is < than lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId=" + lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId);
4725        for (MutationReplay mut : mutations) {
4726          LOG.trace(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : Skipping : " + mut.mutation);
4727        }
4728      }
4729
4730      OperationStatus[] statuses = new OperationStatus[mutations.length];
4731      for (int i = 0; i < statuses.length; i++) {
4732        statuses[i] = OperationStatus.SUCCESS;
4733      }
4734      return statuses;
4735    }
4736    return batchMutate(new ReplayBatchOperation(this, mutations, replaySeqId));
4737  }
4738
4739  /**
4740   * Perform a batch of mutations.
4741   * <p/>
4742   * Operations in a batch are stored with highest durability specified of for all operations in a
4743   * batch, except for {@link Durability#SKIP_WAL}.
4744   * <p/>
4745   * This function is called from {@link #batchReplay(WALSplitUtil.MutationReplay[], long)} with
4746   * {@link ReplayBatchOperation} instance and {@link #batchMutate(Mutation[])} with
4747   * {@link MutationBatchOperation} instance as an argument. As the processing of replay batch and
4748   * mutation batch is very similar, lot of code is shared by providing generic methods in base
4749   * class {@link BatchOperation}. The logic for this method and
4750   * {@link #doMiniBatchMutate(BatchOperation)} is implemented using methods in base class which are
4751   * overridden by derived classes to implement special behavior.
4752   * @param batchOp contains the list of mutations
4753   * @return an array of OperationStatus which internally contains the OperationStatusCode and the
4754   *         exceptionMessage if any.
4755   * @throws IOException if an IO problem is encountered
4756   */
4757  private OperationStatus[] batchMutate(BatchOperation<?> batchOp) throws IOException {
4758    boolean initialized = false;
4759    batchOp.startRegionOperation();
4760    try {
4761      while (!batchOp.isDone()) {
4762        if (!batchOp.isInReplay()) {
4763          checkReadOnly();
4764        }
4765        checkResources();
4766
4767        if (!initialized) {
4768          this.writeRequestsCount.add(batchOp.size());
4769          // validate and prepare batch for write, for MutationBatchOperation it also calls CP
4770          // prePut()/preDelete()/preIncrement()/preAppend() hooks
4771          batchOp.checkAndPrepare();
4772          initialized = true;
4773        }
4774        doMiniBatchMutate(batchOp);
4775        requestFlushIfNeeded();
4776      }
4777    } finally {
4778      if (rsServices != null && rsServices.getMetrics() != null) {
4779        rsServices.getMetrics().updateWriteQueryMeter(this, batchOp.size());
4780      }
4781      batchOp.closeRegionOperation();
4782    }
4783    return batchOp.retCodeDetails;
4784  }
4785
4786  /**
4787   * Called to do a piece of the batch that came in to {@link #batchMutate(Mutation[])} In here we
4788   * also handle replay of edits on region recover. Also gets change in size brought about by
4789   * applying {@code batchOp}.
4790   */
4791  private void doMiniBatchMutate(BatchOperation<?> batchOp) throws IOException {
4792    boolean success = false;
4793    WALEdit walEdit = null;
4794    WriteEntry writeEntry = null;
4795    boolean locked = false;
4796    // We try to set up a batch in the range [batchOp.nextIndexToProcess,lastIndexExclusive)
4797    MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp = null;
4798    /** Keep track of the locks we hold so we can release them in finally clause */
4799    List<RowLock> acquiredRowLocks = Lists.newArrayListWithCapacity(batchOp.size());
4800
4801    // Check for thread interrupt status in case we have been signaled from
4802    // #interruptRegionOperation.
4803    checkInterrupt();
4804
4805    try {
4806      // STEP 1. Try to acquire as many locks as we can and build mini-batch of operations with
4807      // locked rows
4808      miniBatchOp = batchOp.lockRowsAndBuildMiniBatch(acquiredRowLocks);
4809
4810      // We've now grabbed as many mutations off the list as we can
4811      // Ensure we acquire at least one.
4812      if (miniBatchOp.getReadyToWriteCount() <= 0) {
4813        // Nothing to put/delete/increment/append -- an exception in the above such as
4814        // NoSuchColumnFamily?
4815        return;
4816      }
4817
4818      // Check for thread interrupt status in case we have been signaled from
4819      // #interruptRegionOperation. Do it before we take the lock and disable interrupts for
4820      // the WAL append.
4821      checkInterrupt();
4822
4823      lock(this.updatesLock.readLock(), miniBatchOp.getReadyToWriteCount());
4824      locked = true;
4825
4826      // From this point until memstore update this operation should not be interrupted.
4827      disableInterrupts();
4828
4829      // STEP 2. Update mini batch of all operations in progress with LATEST_TIMESTAMP timestamp
4830      // We should record the timestamp only after we have acquired the rowLock,
4831      // otherwise, newer puts/deletes/increment/append are not guaranteed to have a newer
4832      // timestamp
4833
4834      long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
4835      batchOp.prepareMiniBatchOperations(miniBatchOp, now, acquiredRowLocks);
4836
4837      // STEP 3. Build WAL edit
4838
4839      List<Pair<NonceKey, WALEdit>> walEdits = batchOp.buildWALEdits(miniBatchOp);
4840
4841      // STEP 4. Append the WALEdits to WAL and sync.
4842
4843      for (Iterator<Pair<NonceKey, WALEdit>> it = walEdits.iterator(); it.hasNext();) {
4844        Pair<NonceKey, WALEdit> nonceKeyWALEditPair = it.next();
4845        walEdit = nonceKeyWALEditPair.getSecond();
4846        NonceKey nonceKey = nonceKeyWALEditPair.getFirst();
4847
4848        if (walEdit != null && !walEdit.isEmpty()) {
4849          writeEntry = doWALAppend(walEdit, batchOp, miniBatchOp, now, nonceKey);
4850        }
4851
4852        // Complete mvcc for all but last writeEntry (for replay case)
4853        if (it.hasNext() && writeEntry != null) {
4854          mvcc.complete(writeEntry);
4855          writeEntry = null;
4856        }
4857      }
4858
4859      // STEP 5. Write back to memStore
4860      // NOTE: writeEntry can be null here
4861      writeEntry = batchOp.writeMiniBatchOperationsToMemStore(miniBatchOp, writeEntry, now);
4862
4863      // STEP 6. Complete MiniBatchOperations: If required calls postBatchMutate() CP hook and
4864      // complete mvcc for last writeEntry
4865      batchOp.completeMiniBatchOperations(miniBatchOp, writeEntry);
4866      writeEntry = null;
4867      success = true;
4868    } finally {
4869      // Call complete rather than completeAndWait because we probably had error if walKey != null
4870      if (writeEntry != null) mvcc.complete(writeEntry);
4871
4872      if (locked) {
4873        this.updatesLock.readLock().unlock();
4874      }
4875      releaseRowLocks(acquiredRowLocks);
4876
4877      enableInterrupts();
4878
4879      final int finalLastIndexExclusive =
4880        miniBatchOp != null ? miniBatchOp.getLastIndexExclusive() : batchOp.size();
4881      final boolean finalSuccess = success;
4882      batchOp.visitBatchOperations(true, finalLastIndexExclusive, (int i) -> {
4883        Mutation mutation = batchOp.getMutation(i);
4884        if (mutation instanceof Increment || mutation instanceof Append) {
4885          if (finalSuccess) {
4886            batchOp.retCodeDetails[i] =
4887              new OperationStatus(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS, batchOp.results[i]);
4888          } else {
4889            batchOp.retCodeDetails[i] = OperationStatus.FAILURE;
4890          }
4891        } else {
4892          batchOp.retCodeDetails[i] =
4893            finalSuccess ? OperationStatus.SUCCESS : OperationStatus.FAILURE;
4894        }
4895        return true;
4896      });
4897
4898      batchOp.doPostOpCleanupForMiniBatch(miniBatchOp, walEdit, finalSuccess);
4899
4900      batchOp.nextIndexToProcess = finalLastIndexExclusive;
4901    }
4902  }

4904  /**
4905   * Returns effective durability from the passed durability and the table descriptor.
4906   */
4907  private Durability getEffectiveDurability(Durability d) {
4908    return d == Durability.USE_DEFAULT ? this.regionDurability : d;
4909  }

4913  public boolean checkAndMutate(byte[] row, byte[] family, byte[] qualifier, CompareOperator op,
4914    ByteArrayComparable comparator, TimeRange timeRange, Mutation mutation) throws IOException {
4915    CheckAndMutate checkAndMutate;
4916    try {
4917      CheckAndMutate.Builder builder = CheckAndMutate.newBuilder(row)
4918        .ifMatches(family, qualifier, op, comparator.getValue()).timeRange(timeRange);
4919      if (mutation instanceof Put) {
4920        checkAndMutate = builder.build((Put) mutation);
4921      } else if (mutation instanceof Delete) {
4922        checkAndMutate = builder.build((Delete) mutation);
4923      } else {
4924        throw new DoNotRetryIOException(
4925          "Unsupported mutate type: " + mutation.getClass().getSimpleName().toUpperCase());
4926      }
4927    } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
4928      throw new DoNotRetryIOException(e.getMessage());
4929    }
4930    return checkAndMutate(checkAndMutate).isSuccess();
4931  }

4987
4988  public CheckAndMutateResult checkAndMutate(CheckAndMutate checkAndMutate, long nonceGroup,
4989    long nonce) throws IOException {
4990    return TraceUtil.trace(() -> checkAndMutateInternal(checkAndMutate, nonceGroup, nonce),
4991      () -> createRegionSpan("Region.checkAndMutate"));
4992  }
4993
4994  private CheckAndMutateResult checkAndMutateInternal(CheckAndMutate checkAndMutate,
4995    long nonceGroup, long nonce) throws IOException {
4996    byte[] row = checkAndMutate.getRow();
4997    Filter filter = null;
4998    byte[] family = null;
4999    byte[] qualifier = null;
5000    CompareOperator op = null;
5001    ByteArrayComparable comparator = null;
5002    if (checkAndMutate.hasFilter()) {
5003      filter = checkAndMutate.getFilter();
5004    } else {
5005      family = checkAndMutate.getFamily();
5006      qualifier = checkAndMutate.getQualifier();
5007      op = checkAndMutate.getCompareOp();
5008      comparator = new BinaryComparator(checkAndMutate.getValue());
5009    }
5010    TimeRange timeRange = checkAndMutate.getTimeRange();
5011
5012    Mutation mutation = null;
5013    RowMutations rowMutations = null;
5014    if (checkAndMutate.getAction() instanceof Mutation) {
5015      mutation = (Mutation) checkAndMutate.getAction();
5016    } else {
5017      rowMutations = (RowMutations) checkAndMutate.getAction();
5018    }
5019
5020    if (mutation != null) {
5021      checkMutationType(mutation);
5022      checkRow(mutation, row);
5023    } else {
5024      checkRow(rowMutations, row);
5025    }
5026    checkReadOnly();
5027    // TODO, add check for value length also move this check to the client
5028    checkResources();
5029    startRegionOperation();
5030    try {
5031      Get get = new Get(row);
5032      if (family != null) {
5033        checkFamily(family);
5034        get.addColumn(family, qualifier);
5035      }
5036      if (filter != null) {
5037        get.setFilter(filter);
5038      }
5039      if (timeRange != null) {
5040        get.setTimeRange(timeRange.getMin(), timeRange.getMax());
5041      }
5042      // Lock row - note that doBatchMutate will relock this row if called
5043      checkRow(row, "doCheckAndRowMutate");
5044      RowLock rowLock = getRowLock(get.getRow(), false, null);
5045      try {
5046        if (this.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
5047          CheckAndMutateResult result =
5048            getCoprocessorHost().preCheckAndMutateAfterRowLock(checkAndMutate);
5049          if (result != null) {
5050            return result;
5051          }
5052        }
5053
5054        // NOTE: We used to wait here until mvcc caught up: mvcc.await();
5055        // Supposition is that now all changes are done under row locks, then when we go to read,
5056        // we'll get the latest on this row.
5057        boolean matches = false;
5058        long cellTs = 0;
5059        try (RegionScanner scanner = getScanner(new Scan(get))) {
5060          // NOTE: Please don't use HRegion.get() instead,
5061          // because it will copy cells to heap. See HBASE-26036
5062          List<Cell> result = new ArrayList<>(1);
5063          scanner.next(result);
5064          if (filter != null) {
5065            if (!result.isEmpty()) {
5066              matches = true;
5067              cellTs = result.get(0).getTimestamp();
5068            }
5069          } else {
5070            boolean valueIsNull =
5071              comparator.getValue() == null || comparator.getValue().length == 0;
5072            if (result.isEmpty() && valueIsNull) {
5073              matches = op != CompareOperator.NOT_EQUAL;
5074            } else if (result.size() > 0 && valueIsNull) {
5075              matches = (result.get(0).getValueLength() == 0) == (op != CompareOperator.NOT_EQUAL);
5076              cellTs = result.get(0).getTimestamp();
5077            } else if (result.size() == 1) {
5078              Cell kv = result.get(0);
5079              cellTs = kv.getTimestamp();
5080              int compareResult = PrivateCellUtil.compareValue(kv, comparator);
5081              matches = matches(op, compareResult);
5082            }
5083          }
5084        }
5085
5086        // If matches, perform the mutation or the rowMutations
5087        if (matches) {
5088          // We have acquired the row lock already. If the system clock is NOT monotonically
5089          // non-decreasing (see HBASE-14070) we should make sure that the mutation has a
5090          // larger timestamp than what was observed via Get. doBatchMutate already does this, but
5091          // there is no way to pass the cellTs. See HBASE-14054.
5092          long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
5093          long ts = Math.max(now, cellTs); // ensure write is not eclipsed
5094          byte[] byteTs = Bytes.toBytes(ts);
5095          if (mutation != null) {
5096            if (mutation instanceof Put) {
5097              updateCellTimestamps((Iterable) mutation.getFamilyCellMap().values(), byteTs);
5098            }
5099            // And else 'delete' is not needed since it already does a second get, and sets the
5100            // timestamp from get (see prepareDeleteTimestamps).
5101          } else {
5102            for (Mutation m : rowMutations.getMutations()) {
5103              if (m instanceof Put) {
5104                updateCellTimestamps((Iterable) m.getFamilyCellMap().values(), byteTs);
5105              }
5106            }
5107            // And else 'delete' is not needed since it already does a second get, and sets the
5108            // timestamp from get (see prepareDeleteTimestamps).
5109          }
5110          // All edits for the given row (across all column families) must happen atomically.
5111          Result r;
5112          if (mutation != null) {
5113            r = mutate(mutation, true, nonceGroup, nonce).getResult();
5114          } else {
5115            r = mutateRow(rowMutations, nonceGroup, nonce);
5116          }
5117          this.checkAndMutateChecksPassed.increment();
5118          return new CheckAndMutateResult(true, r);
5119        }
5120        this.checkAndMutateChecksFailed.increment();
5121        return new CheckAndMutateResult(false, null);
5122      } finally {
5123        rowLock.release();
5124      }
5125    } finally {
5126      closeRegionOperation();
5127    }
5128  }
5129
5130  private void checkMutationType(final Mutation mutation) throws DoNotRetryIOException {
5131    if (
5132      !(mutation instanceof Put) && !(mutation instanceof Delete)
5133        && !(mutation instanceof Increment) && !(mutation instanceof Append)
5134    ) {
5135      throw new org.apache.hadoop.hbase.DoNotRetryIOException(
5136        "Action must be Put or Delete or Increment or Delete");
5137    }
5138  }
5139
5140  private void checkRow(final Row action, final byte[] row) throws DoNotRetryIOException {
5141    if (!Bytes.equals(row, action.getRow())) {
5142      throw new org.apache.hadoop.hbase.DoNotRetryIOException("Action's getRow must match");
5143    }
5144  }
5145
5146  private boolean matches(final CompareOperator op, final int compareResult) {
5147    boolean matches = false;
5148    switch (op) {
5149      case LESS:
5150        matches = compareResult < 0;
5151        break;
5152      case LESS_OR_EQUAL:
5153        matches = compareResult <= 0;
5154        break;
5155      case EQUAL:
5156        matches = compareResult == 0;
5157        break;
5158      case NOT_EQUAL:
5159        matches = compareResult != 0;
5160        break;
5161      case GREATER_OR_EQUAL:
5162        matches = compareResult >= 0;
5163        break;
5164      case GREATER:
5165        matches = compareResult > 0;
5166        break;
5167      default:
5168        throw new RuntimeException("Unknown Compare op " + op.name());
5169    }
5170    return matches;
5171  }
5172
5173  private OperationStatus mutate(Mutation mutation) throws IOException {
5174    return mutate(mutation, false);
5175  }
5176
5177  private OperationStatus mutate(Mutation mutation, boolean atomic) throws IOException {
5178    return mutate(mutation, atomic, HConstants.NO_NONCE, HConstants.NO_NONCE);
5179  }
5180
5181  private OperationStatus mutate(Mutation mutation, boolean atomic, long nonceGroup, long nonce)
5182    throws IOException {
5183    OperationStatus[] status =
5184      this.batchMutate(new Mutation[] { mutation }, atomic, nonceGroup, nonce);
5185    if (status[0].getOperationStatusCode().equals(OperationStatusCode.SANITY_CHECK_FAILURE)) {
5186      throw new FailedSanityCheckException(status[0].getExceptionMsg());
5187    } else if (status[0].getOperationStatusCode().equals(OperationStatusCode.BAD_FAMILY)) {
5188      throw new NoSuchColumnFamilyException(status[0].getExceptionMsg());
5189    } else if (status[0].getOperationStatusCode().equals(OperationStatusCode.STORE_TOO_BUSY)) {
5190      throw new RegionTooBusyException(status[0].getExceptionMsg());
5191    }
5192    return status[0];
5193  }

5195  /**
5196   * Complete taking the snapshot on the region. Writes the region info and adds references to the
5197   * working snapshot directory. TODO for api consistency, consider adding another version with no
5198   * {@link ForeignExceptionSnare} arg. (In the future other cancellable HRegion methods could
5199   * eventually add a {@link ForeignExceptionSnare}, or we could do something fancier).
5200   * @param desc     snapshot description object
5201   * @param exnSnare ForeignExceptionSnare that captures external exceptions in case we need to bail
5202   *                 out. This is allowed to be null and will just be ignored in that case.
5203   * @throws IOException if there is an external or internal error causing the snapshot to fail
5204   */
5205  public void addRegionToSnapshot(SnapshotDescription desc, ForeignExceptionSnare exnSnare)
5206    throws IOException {
5207    Path rootDir = CommonFSUtils.getRootDir(conf);
5208    Path snapshotDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getWorkingSnapshotDir(desc, rootDir, conf);
5209
5210    SnapshotManifest manifest =
5211      SnapshotManifest.create(conf, getFilesystem(), snapshotDir, desc, exnSnare);
5212    manifest.addRegion(this);
5213  }
5214
5215  private void updateSequenceId(final Iterable<List<ExtendedCell>> cellItr, final long sequenceId)
5216    throws IOException {
5217    for (List<ExtendedCell> cells : cellItr) {
5218      if (cells == null) {
5219        return;
5220      }
5221      for (ExtendedCell cell : cells) {
5222        cell.setSequenceId(sequenceId);
5223      }
5224    }
5225  }
5226
5227  /**
5228   * Replace any cell timestamps set to {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HConstants#LATEST_TIMESTAMP}
5229   * provided current timestamp.
5230   */
5231  private static void updateCellTimestamps(final Iterable<List<ExtendedCell>> cellItr,
5232    final byte[] now) throws IOException {
5233    for (List<ExtendedCell> cells : cellItr) {
5234      if (cells == null) {
5235        continue;
5236      }
5237      // Optimization: 'foreach' loop is not used. See:
5238      // HBASE-12023 HRegion.applyFamilyMapToMemstore creates too many iterator objects
5239      assert cells instanceof RandomAccess;
5240      int listSize = cells.size();
5241      for (int i = 0; i < listSize; i++) {
5242        PrivateCellUtil.updateLatestStamp(cells.get(i), now);
5243      }
5244    }
5245  }
5246
5247  /**
5248   * Possibly rewrite incoming cell tags.
5249   */
5250  private void rewriteCellTags(Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> familyMap, final Mutation m) {
5251    // Check if we have any work to do and early out otherwise
5252    // Update these checks as more logic is added here
5253    if (m.getTTL() == Long.MAX_VALUE) {
5254      return;
5255    }
5256
5257    // From this point we know we have some work to do
5258    for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> e : familyMap.entrySet()) {
5259      List<ExtendedCell> cells = e.getValue();
5260      assert cells instanceof RandomAccess;
5261      int listSize = cells.size();
5262      for (int i = 0; i < listSize; i++) {
5263        ExtendedCell cell = cells.get(i);
5264        List<Tag> newTags = TagUtil.carryForwardTags(null, cell);
5265        newTags = TagUtil.carryForwardTTLTag(newTags, m.getTTL());
5266        // Rewrite the cell with the updated set of tags
5267        cells.set(i, PrivateCellUtil.createCell(cell, newTags));
5268      }
5269    }
5270  }
5271
5272  /**
5273   * Check if resources to support an update.
5274   * <p/>
5275   * We throw RegionTooBusyException if above memstore limit and expect client to retry using some
5276   * kind of backoff
5277   */
5278  private void checkResources() throws RegionTooBusyException {
5279    // If catalog region, do not impose resource constraints or block updates.
5280    if (this.getRegionInfo().isMetaRegion()) {
5281      return;
5282    }
5283
5284    MemStoreSize mss = this.memStoreSizing.getMemStoreSize();
5285    if (mss.getHeapSize() + mss.getOffHeapSize() > this.blockingMemStoreSize) {
5286      blockedRequestsCount.increment();
5287      requestFlush();
5288      // Don't print current limit because it will vary too much. The message is used as a key
5289      // over in RetriesExhaustedWithDetailsException processing.
5290      final String regionName =
5291        this.getRegionInfo() == null ? "unknown" : this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName();
5292      final String serverName = this.getRegionServerServices() == null
5293        ? "unknown"
5294        : (this.getRegionServerServices().getServerName() == null
5295          ? "unknown"
5296          : this.getRegionServerServices().getServerName().toString());
5297      RegionTooBusyException rtbe = new RegionTooBusyException("Over memstore limit="
5298        + org.apache.hadoop.hbase.procedure2.util.StringUtils.humanSize(this.blockingMemStoreSize)
5299        + ", regionName=" + regionName + ", server=" + serverName);
5300      LOG.warn("Region is too busy due to exceeding memstore size limit.", rtbe);
5301      throw rtbe;
5302    }
5303  }
5304
5305  /**
5306   * @throws IOException Throws exception if region is in read-only mode.
5307   */
5308  private void checkReadOnly() throws IOException {
5309    if (isReadOnly()) {
5310      throw new DoNotRetryIOException("region is read only");
5311    }
5312  }
5313
5314  private void checkReadsEnabled() throws IOException {
5315    if (!this.writestate.readsEnabled) {
5316      throw new IOException(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName()
5317        + ": The region's reads are disabled. Cannot serve the request");
5318    }
5319  }
5320
5321  public void setReadsEnabled(boolean readsEnabled) {
5322    if (readsEnabled && !this.writestate.readsEnabled) {
5323      LOG.info("Enabling reads for {}", getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
5324    }
5325    this.writestate.setReadsEnabled(readsEnabled);
5326  }
5327
5328  /**
5329   * @param delta If we are doing delta changes -- e.g. increment/append -- then this flag will be
5330   *              set; when set we will run operations that make sense in the increment/append
5331   *              scenario but that do not make sense otherwise.
5332   */
5333  private void applyToMemStore(HStore store, List<ExtendedCell> cells, boolean delta,
5334    MemStoreSizing memstoreAccounting) {
5335    // Any change in how we update Store/MemStore needs to also be done in other applyToMemStore!!!!
5336    boolean upsert = delta && store.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getMaxVersions() == 1;
5337    if (upsert) {
5338      store.upsert(cells, getSmallestReadPoint(), memstoreAccounting);
5339    } else {
5340      store.add(cells, memstoreAccounting);
5341    }
5342  }
5343
5344  private void checkFamilies(Collection<byte[]> families, Durability durability)
5345    throws NoSuchColumnFamilyException, InvalidMutationDurabilityException {
5346    for (byte[] family : families) {
5347      checkFamily(family, durability);
5348    }
5349  }
5350
5351  private void checkFamily(final byte[] family, Durability durability)
