5352    throws NoSuchColumnFamilyException, InvalidMutationDurabilityException {
5353    checkFamily(family);
5354    if (
5355      durability.equals(Durability.SKIP_WAL)
5356        && htableDescriptor.getColumnFamily(family).getScope() != HConstants.REPLICATION_SCOPE_LOCAL
5357    ) {
5358      throw new InvalidMutationDurabilityException(
5359        "Mutation's durability is SKIP_WAL but table's column family " + Bytes.toString(family)
5360          + " need replication");
5361    }
5362  }
5363
5364  private void checkFamily(final byte[] family) throws NoSuchColumnFamilyException {
5365    if (!this.htableDescriptor.hasColumnFamily(family)) {
5366      throw new NoSuchColumnFamilyException("Column family " + Bytes.toString(family)
5367        + " does not exist in region " + this + " in table " + this.htableDescriptor);
5368    }
5369  }
5370
5371  /**
5372   * Check the collection of families for valid timestamps
5373   * @param now current timestamp
5374   */
5375  public void checkTimestamps(final Map<byte[], List<Cell>> familyMap, long now)
5376    throws FailedSanityCheckException {
5377    if (timestampSlop == HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP) {
5378      return;
5379    }
5380    long maxTs = now + timestampSlop;
5381    for (List<Cell> kvs : familyMap.values()) {
5382      // Optimization: 'foreach' loop is not used. See:
5383      // HBASE-12023 HRegion.applyFamilyMapToMemstore creates too many iterator objects
5384      assert kvs instanceof RandomAccess;
5385      int listSize = kvs.size();
5386      for (int i = 0; i < listSize; i++) {
5387        Cell cell = kvs.get(i);
5388        // see if the user-side TS is out of range. latest = server-side
5389        long ts = cell.getTimestamp();
5390        if (ts != HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP && ts > maxTs) {
5391          throw new FailedSanityCheckException(
5392            "Timestamp for KV out of range " + cell + " (too.new=" + timestampSlop + ")");
5393        }
5394      }
5395    }
5396  }
5397
5398  /*
5399   * @return True if size is over the flush threshold
5400   */
5401  private boolean isFlushSize(MemStoreSize size) {
5402    return size.getHeapSize() + size.getOffHeapSize() > getMemStoreFlushSize();
5403  }
5404
5405  private void deleteRecoveredEdits(FileSystem fs, Iterable<Path> files) throws IOException {
5406    for (Path file : files) {
5407      if (!fs.delete(file, false)) {
5408        LOG.error("Failed delete of {}", file);
5409      } else {
5410        LOG.debug("Deleted recovered.edits file={}", file);
5411      }
5412    }
5413  }
5414
5415  /**
5416   * Read the edits put under this region by wal splitting process. Put the recovered edits back up
5417   * into this region.
5418   * <p>
5419   * We can ignore any wal message that has a sequence ID that's equal to or lower than minSeqId.
5420   * (Because we know such messages are already reflected in the HFiles.)
5421   * <p>
5422   * While this is running we are putting pressure on memory yet we are outside of our usual
5423   * accounting because we are not yet an onlined region (this stuff is being run as part of Region
5424   * initialization). This means that if we're up against global memory limits, we'll not be flagged
5425   * to flush because we are not online. We can't be flushed by usual mechanisms anyways; we're not
5426   * yet online so our relative sequenceids are not yet aligned with WAL sequenceids -- not till we
5427   * come up online, post processing of split edits.
5428   * <p>
5429   * But to help relieve memory pressure, at least manage our own heap size flushing if are in
5430   * excess of per-region limits. Flushing, though, we have to be careful and avoid using the
5431   * regionserver/wal sequenceid. Its running on a different line to whats going on in here in this
5432   * region context so if we crashed replaying these edits, but in the midst had a flush that used
5433   * the regionserver wal with a sequenceid in excess of whats going on in here in this region and
5434   * with its split editlogs, then we could miss edits the next time we go to recover. So, we have
5435   * to flush inline, using seqids that make sense in a this single region context only -- until we
5436   * online.
5437   * @param maxSeqIdInStores Any edit found in split editlogs needs to be in excess of the maxSeqId
5438   *                         for the store to be applied, else its skipped.
5439   * @return the sequence id of the last edit added to this region out of the recovered edits log or
5440   *         <code>minSeqId</code> if nothing added from editlogs.
5441   */
5442  long replayRecoveredEditsIfAny(Map<byte[], Long> maxSeqIdInStores,
5443    final CancelableProgressable reporter, final MonitoredTask status) throws IOException {
5444    long minSeqIdForTheRegion = -1;
5445    for (Long maxSeqIdInStore : maxSeqIdInStores.values()) {
5446      if (maxSeqIdInStore < minSeqIdForTheRegion || minSeqIdForTheRegion == -1) {
5447        minSeqIdForTheRegion = maxSeqIdInStore;
5448      }
5449    }
5450    long seqId = minSeqIdForTheRegion;
5451    String specialRecoveredEditsDirStr = conf.get(SPECIAL_RECOVERED_EDITS_DIR);
5452    if (org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils.isBlank(specialRecoveredEditsDirStr)) {
5453      FileSystem walFS = getWalFileSystem();
5454      FileSystem rootFS = getFilesystem();
5455      Path wrongRegionWALDir = CommonFSUtils.getWrongWALRegionDir(conf, getRegionInfo().getTable(),
5456        getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
5457      Path regionWALDir = getWALRegionDir();
5458      Path regionDir =
5459        FSUtils.getRegionDirFromRootDir(CommonFSUtils.getRootDir(conf), getRegionInfo());
5460
5461      // We made a mistake in HBASE-20734 so we need to do this dirty hack...
5462      NavigableSet<Path> filesUnderWrongRegionWALDir =
5463        WALSplitUtil.getSplitEditFilesSorted(walFS, wrongRegionWALDir);
5464      seqId = Math.max(seqId, replayRecoveredEditsForPaths(minSeqIdForTheRegion, walFS,
5465        filesUnderWrongRegionWALDir, reporter, regionDir));
5466      // This is to ensure backwards compatability with HBASE-20723 where recovered edits can appear
5467      // under the root dir even if walDir is set.
5468      NavigableSet<Path> filesUnderRootDir = Collections.emptyNavigableSet();
5469      if (!regionWALDir.equals(regionDir)) {
5470        filesUnderRootDir = WALSplitUtil.getSplitEditFilesSorted(rootFS, regionDir);
5471        seqId = Math.max(seqId, replayRecoveredEditsForPaths(minSeqIdForTheRegion, rootFS,
5472          filesUnderRootDir, reporter, regionDir));
5473      }
5474
5475      NavigableSet<Path> files = WALSplitUtil.getSplitEditFilesSorted(walFS, regionWALDir);
5476      seqId = Math.max(seqId,
5477        replayRecoveredEditsForPaths(minSeqIdForTheRegion, walFS, files, reporter, regionWALDir));
5478      if (seqId > minSeqIdForTheRegion) {
5479        // Then we added some edits to memory. Flush and cleanup split edit files.
5480        internalFlushcache(null, seqId, stores.values(), status, false,
5481          FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
5482      }
5483      // Now delete the content of recovered edits. We're done w/ them.
5484      if (files.size() > 0 && this.conf.getBoolean("hbase.region.archive.recovered.edits", false)) {
5485        // For debugging data loss issues!
5486        // If this flag is set, make use of the hfile archiving by making recovered.edits a fake
5487        // column family. Have to fake out file type too by casting our recovered.edits as
5488        // storefiles
5489        String fakeFamilyName = WALSplitUtil.getRegionDirRecoveredEditsDir(regionWALDir).getName();
5490        Set<HStoreFile> fakeStoreFiles = new HashSet<>(files.size());
5491        for (Path file : files) {
5492          fakeStoreFiles.add(new HStoreFile(walFS, file, this.conf, null, null, true));
5493        }
5494        getRegionWALFileSystem().archiveRecoveredEdits(fakeFamilyName, fakeStoreFiles);
5495      } else {
5496        deleteRecoveredEdits(walFS, Iterables.concat(files, filesUnderWrongRegionWALDir));
5497        deleteRecoveredEdits(rootFS, filesUnderRootDir);
5498      }
5499    } else {
5500      Path recoveredEditsDir = new Path(specialRecoveredEditsDirStr);
5501      FileSystem fs = recoveredEditsDir.getFileSystem(conf);
5502      FileStatus[] files = fs.listStatus(recoveredEditsDir);
5503      LOG.debug("Found {} recovered edits file(s) under {}", files == null ? 0 : files.length,
5504        recoveredEditsDir);
5505      if (files != null) {
5506        for (FileStatus file : files) {
5507          // it is safe to trust the zero-length in this case because we've been through rename and
5508          // lease recovery in the above.
5509          if (isZeroLengthThenDelete(fs, file, file.getPath())) {
5510            continue;
5511          }
5512          seqId =
5513            Math.max(seqId, replayRecoveredEdits(file.getPath(), maxSeqIdInStores, reporter, fs));
5514        }
5515      }
5516      if (seqId > minSeqIdForTheRegion) {
5517        // Then we added some edits to memory. Flush and cleanup split edit files.
5518        internalFlushcache(null, seqId, stores.values(), status, false,
5519          FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
5520      }
5521      deleteRecoveredEdits(fs,
5522        Stream.of(files).map(FileStatus::getPath).collect(Collectors.toList()));
5523    }
5524
5525    return seqId;
5526  }
5527
5528  private long replayRecoveredEditsForPaths(long minSeqIdForTheRegion, FileSystem fs,
5529    final NavigableSet<Path> files, final CancelableProgressable reporter, final Path regionDir)
5530    throws IOException {
5531    long seqid = minSeqIdForTheRegion;
5532    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
5533      LOG.debug("Found " + (files == null ? 0 : files.size()) + " recovered edits file(s) under "
5534        + regionDir);
5535    }
5536
5537    if (files == null || files.isEmpty()) {
5538      return minSeqIdForTheRegion;
5539    }
5540
5541    for (Path edits : files) {
5542      if (edits == null || !fs.exists(edits)) {
5543        LOG.warn("Null or non-existent edits file: " + edits);
5544        continue;
5545      }
5546      if (isZeroLengthThenDelete(fs, fs.getFileStatus(edits), edits)) {
5547        continue;
5548      }
5549
5550      long maxSeqId;
5551      String fileName = edits.getName();
5552      maxSeqId = Math.abs(Long.parseLong(fileName));
5553      if (maxSeqId <= minSeqIdForTheRegion) {
5554        if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
5555          String msg = "Maximum sequenceid for this wal is " + maxSeqId
5556            + " and minimum sequenceid for the region " + this + "  is " + minSeqIdForTheRegion
5557            + ", skipped the whole file, path=" + edits;
5558          LOG.debug(msg);
5559        }
5560        continue;
5561      }
5562
5563      try {
5564        // replay the edits. Replay can return -1 if everything is skipped, only update
5565        // if seqId is greater
5566        seqid = Math.max(seqid, replayRecoveredEdits(edits, maxSeqIdInStores, reporter, fs));
5567      } catch (IOException e) {
5568        handleException(fs, edits, e);
5569      }
5570    }
5571    return seqid;
5572  }
5573
5574  private void handleException(FileSystem fs, Path edits, IOException e) throws IOException {
5575    boolean skipErrors = conf.getBoolean(HConstants.HREGION_EDITS_REPLAY_SKIP_ERRORS,
5576      conf.getBoolean("hbase.skip.errors", HConstants.DEFAULT_HREGION_EDITS_REPLAY_SKIP_ERRORS));
5577    if (conf.get("hbase.skip.errors") != null) {
5578      LOG.warn("The property 'hbase.skip.errors' has been deprecated. Please use "
5579        + HConstants.HREGION_EDITS_REPLAY_SKIP_ERRORS + " instead.");
5580    }
5581    if (skipErrors) {
5582      Path p = WALSplitUtil.moveAsideBadEditsFile(fs, edits);
5583      LOG.error(HConstants.HREGION_EDITS_REPLAY_SKIP_ERRORS + "=true so continuing. Renamed "
5584        + edits + " as " + p, e);
5585    } else {
5586      throw e;
5587    }
5588  }
5589
5590  /**
5591   * @param edits            File of recovered edits.
5592   * @param maxSeqIdInStores Maximum sequenceid found in each store. Edits in wal must be larger
5593   *                         than this to be replayed for each store.
5594   * @return the sequence id of the last edit added to this region out of the recovered edits log or
5595   *         <code>minSeqId</code> if nothing added from editlogs.
5596   */
5597  private long replayRecoveredEdits(final Path edits, Map<byte[], Long> maxSeqIdInStores,
5598    final CancelableProgressable reporter, FileSystem fs) throws IOException {
5599    String msg = "Replaying edits from " + edits;
5600    LOG.info(msg);
5601    MonitoredTask status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus(msg);
5602
5603    status.setStatus("Opening recovered edits");
5604    try (WALStreamReader reader = WALFactory.createStreamReader(fs, edits, conf)) {
5605      long currentEditSeqId = -1;
5606      long currentReplaySeqId = -1;
5607      long firstSeqIdInLog = -1;
5608      long skippedEdits = 0;
5609      long editsCount = 0;
5610      long intervalEdits = 0;
5611      WAL.Entry entry;
5612      HStore store = null;
5613      boolean reported_once = false;
5614      ServerNonceManager ng = this.rsServices == null ? null : this.rsServices.getNonceManager();
5615
5616      try {
5617        // How many edits seen before we check elapsed time
5618        int interval = this.conf.getInt("hbase.hstore.report.interval.edits", 2000);
5619        // How often to send a progress report (default 1/2 master timeout)
5620        int period = this.conf.getInt("hbase.hstore.report.period", 300000);
5621        long lastReport = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
5622
5623        if (coprocessorHost != null) {
5624          coprocessorHost.preReplayWALs(this.getRegionInfo(), edits);
5625        }
5626
5627        while ((entry = reader.next()) != null) {
5628          WALKey key = entry.getKey();
5629          WALEdit val = entry.getEdit();
5630
5631          if (ng != null) { // some test, or nonces disabled
5632            ng.reportOperationFromWal(key.getNonceGroup(), key.getNonce(), key.getWriteTime());
5633          }
5634
5635          if (reporter != null) {
5636            intervalEdits += val.size();
5637            if (intervalEdits >= interval) {
5638              // Number of edits interval reached
5639              intervalEdits = 0;
5640              long cur = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
5641              if (lastReport + period <= cur) {
5642                status.setStatus(
5643                  "Replaying edits..." + " skipped=" + skippedEdits + " edits=" + editsCount);
5644                // Timeout reached
5645                if (!reporter.progress()) {
5646                  msg = "Progressable reporter failed, stopping replay for region " + this;
5647                  LOG.warn(msg);
5648                  status.abort(msg);
5649                  throw new IOException(msg);
5650                }
5651                reported_once = true;
5652                lastReport = cur;
5653              }
5654            }
5655          }
5656
5657          if (firstSeqIdInLog == -1) {
5658            firstSeqIdInLog = key.getSequenceId();
5659          }
5660          if (currentEditSeqId > key.getSequenceId()) {
5661            // when this condition is true, it means we have a serious defect because we need to
5662            // maintain increasing SeqId for WAL edits per region
5663            LOG.error(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Found decreasing SeqId. PreId="
5664              + currentEditSeqId + " key=" + key + "; edit=" + val);
5665          } else {
5666            currentEditSeqId = key.getSequenceId();
5667          }
5668          currentReplaySeqId =
5669            (key.getOrigLogSeqNum() > 0) ? key.getOrigLogSeqNum() : currentEditSeqId;
5670
5671          boolean checkRowWithinBoundary = false;
5672          // Check this edit is for this region.
5673          if (
5674            !Bytes.equals(key.getEncodedRegionName(), this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes())
5675          ) {
5676            checkRowWithinBoundary = true;
5677          }
5678
5679          boolean flush = false;
5680          MemStoreSizing memStoreSizing = new NonThreadSafeMemStoreSizing();
5681          for (Cell c : val.getCells()) {
5682            assert c instanceof ExtendedCell;
5683            ExtendedCell cell = (ExtendedCell) c;
5684            // Check this edit is for me. Also, guard against writing the special
5685            // METACOLUMN info such as HBASE::CACHEFLUSH entries
5686            if (WALEdit.isMetaEditFamily(cell)) {
5687              // if region names don't match, skipp replaying compaction marker
5688              if (!checkRowWithinBoundary) {
5689                // this is a special edit, we should handle it
5690                CompactionDescriptor compaction = WALEdit.getCompaction(cell);
5691                if (compaction != null) {
5692                  // replay the compaction
5693                  replayWALCompactionMarker(compaction, false, true, Long.MAX_VALUE);
5694                }
5695              }
5696              skippedEdits++;
5697              continue;
5698            }
5699            // Figure which store the edit is meant for.
5700            if (
5701              store == null
5702                || !CellUtil.matchingFamily(cell, store.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName())
5703            ) {
5704              store = getStore(cell);
5705            }
5706            if (store == null) {
5707              // This should never happen. Perhaps schema was changed between
5708              // crash and redeploy?
5709              LOG.warn("No family for cell {} in region {}", cell, this);
5710              skippedEdits++;
5711              continue;
5712            }
5713            if (
5714              checkRowWithinBoundary && !rowIsInRange(this.getRegionInfo(), cell.getRowArray(),
5715                cell.getRowOffset(), cell.getRowLength())
5716            ) {
5717              LOG.warn("Row of {} is not within region boundary for region {}", cell, this);
5718              skippedEdits++;
5719              continue;
5720            }
5721            // Now, figure if we should skip this edit.
5722            if (
5723              key.getSequenceId()
5724                  <= maxSeqIdInStores.get(store.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName())
5725            ) {
5726              skippedEdits++;
5727              continue;
5728            }
5729            PrivateCellUtil.setSequenceId(cell, currentReplaySeqId);
5730
5731            restoreEdit(store, cell, memStoreSizing);
5732            editsCount++;
5733          }
5734          MemStoreSize mss = memStoreSizing.getMemStoreSize();
5735          incMemStoreSize(mss);
5736          flush = isFlushSize(this.memStoreSizing.getMemStoreSize());
5737          if (flush) {
5738            internalFlushcache(null, currentEditSeqId, stores.values(), status, false,
5739              FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
5740          }
5741        }
5742
5743        if (coprocessorHost != null) {
5744          coprocessorHost.postReplayWALs(this.getRegionInfo(), edits);
5745        }
5746      } catch (EOFException eof) {
5747        if (!conf.getBoolean(RECOVERED_EDITS_IGNORE_EOF, false)) {
5748          Path p = WALSplitUtil.moveAsideBadEditsFile(walFS, edits);
5749          msg = "EnLongAddered EOF. Most likely due to Master failure during "
5750            + "wal splitting, so we have this data in another edit. Continuing, but renaming "
5751            + edits + " as " + p + " for region " + this;
5752          LOG.warn(msg, eof);
5753          status.abort(msg);
5754        } else {
5755          LOG.warn("EOF while replaying recover edits and config '{}' is true so "
5756            + "we will ignore it and continue", RECOVERED_EDITS_IGNORE_EOF, eof);
5757        }
5758      } catch (IOException ioe) {
5759        // If the IOE resulted from bad file format,
5760        // then this problem is idempotent and retrying won't help
5761        if (ioe.getCause() instanceof ParseException) {
5762          Path p = WALSplitUtil.moveAsideBadEditsFile(walFS, edits);
5763          msg =
5764            "File corruption enLongAddered!  " + "Continuing, but renaming " + edits + " as " + p;
5765          LOG.warn(msg, ioe);
5766          status.setStatus(msg);
5767        } else {
5768          status.abort(StringUtils.stringifyException(ioe));
5769          // other IO errors may be transient (bad network connection,
5770          // checksum exception on one datanode, etc). throw & retry
5771          throw ioe;
5772        }
5773      }
5774      if (reporter != null && !reported_once) {
5775        reporter.progress();
5776      }
5777      msg = "Applied " + editsCount + ", skipped " + skippedEdits + ", firstSequenceIdInLog="
5778        + firstSeqIdInLog + ", maxSequenceIdInLog=" + currentEditSeqId + ", path=" + edits;
5779      status.markComplete(msg);
5780      LOG.debug(msg);
5781      return currentEditSeqId;
5782    } finally {
5783      status.cleanup();
5784    }
5785  }
5786
5787  /**
5788   * Call to complete a compaction. Its for the case where we find in the WAL a compaction that was
5789   * not finished. We could find one recovering a WAL after a regionserver crash. See HBASE-2331.
5790   */
5791  void replayWALCompactionMarker(CompactionDescriptor compaction, boolean pickCompactionFiles,
5792    boolean removeFiles, long replaySeqId) throws IOException {
5793    try {
5794      checkTargetRegion(compaction.getEncodedRegionName().toByteArray(),
5795        "Compaction marker from WAL ", compaction);
5796    } catch (WrongRegionException wre) {
5797      if (RegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(this.getRegionInfo())) {
5798        // skip the compaction marker since it is not for this region
5799        return;
5800      }
5801      throw wre;
5802    }
5803
5804    synchronized (writestate) {
5805      if (replaySeqId < lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId) {
5806        LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Skipping replaying compaction event :"
5807          + TextFormat.shortDebugString(compaction) + " because its sequence id " + replaySeqId
5808          + " is smaller than this regions " + "lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId of "
5809          + lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId);
5810        return;
5811      }
5812      if (replaySeqId < lastReplayedCompactionSeqId) {
5813        LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Skipping replaying compaction event :"
5814          + TextFormat.shortDebugString(compaction) + " because its sequence id " + replaySeqId
5815          + " is smaller than this regions " + "lastReplayedCompactionSeqId of "
5816          + lastReplayedCompactionSeqId);
5817        return;
5818      } else {
5819        lastReplayedCompactionSeqId = replaySeqId;
5820      }
5821
5822      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
5823        LOG.debug(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Replaying compaction marker "
5824          + TextFormat.shortDebugString(compaction) + " with seqId=" + replaySeqId
5825          + " and lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId=" + lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId);
5826      }
5827
5828      startRegionOperation(Operation.REPLAY_EVENT);
5829      try {
5830        HStore store = this.getStore(compaction.getFamilyName().toByteArray());
5831        if (store == null) {
5832          LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
5833            + "Found Compaction WAL edit for deleted family:"
5834            + Bytes.toString(compaction.getFamilyName().toByteArray()));
5835          return;
5836        }
5837        store.replayCompactionMarker(compaction, pickCompactionFiles, removeFiles);
5838        logRegionFiles();
5839      } catch (FileNotFoundException ex) {
5840        LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
5841          + "At least one of the store files in compaction: "
5842          + TextFormat.shortDebugString(compaction)
5843          + " doesn't exist any more. Skip loading the file(s)", ex);
5844      } finally {
5845        closeRegionOperation(Operation.REPLAY_EVENT);
5846      }
5847    }
5848  }
5849
5850  /**
5851   * @deprecated Since 3.0.0, will be removed in 4.0.0. Only for keep compatibility for old region
5852   *             replica implementation.
5853   */
5854  @Deprecated
5855  void replayWALFlushMarker(FlushDescriptor flush, long replaySeqId) throws IOException {
5856    checkTargetRegion(flush.getEncodedRegionName().toByteArray(), "Flush marker from WAL ", flush);
5857
5858    if (ServerRegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(this.getRegionInfo())) {
5859      return; // if primary nothing to do
5860    }
5861
5862    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
5863      LOG.debug(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Replaying flush marker "
5864        + TextFormat.shortDebugString(flush));
5865    }
5866
5867    startRegionOperation(Operation.REPLAY_EVENT); // use region close lock to guard against close
5868    try {
5869      FlushAction action = flush.getAction();
5870      switch (action) {
5871        case START_FLUSH:
5872          replayWALFlushStartMarker(flush);
5873          break;
5874        case COMMIT_FLUSH:
5875          replayWALFlushCommitMarker(flush);
5876          break;
5877        case ABORT_FLUSH:
5878          replayWALFlushAbortMarker(flush);
5879          break;
5880        case CANNOT_FLUSH:
5881          replayWALFlushCannotFlushMarker(flush, replaySeqId);
5882          break;
5883        default:
5884          LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
5885            + "Received a flush event with unknown action, ignoring. "
5886            + TextFormat.shortDebugString(flush));
5887          break;
5888      }
5889
5890      logRegionFiles();
5891    } finally {
5892      closeRegionOperation(Operation.REPLAY_EVENT);
5893    }
5894  }
5895
5896  private Collection<HStore> getStoresToFlush(FlushDescriptor flushDesc) {
5897    List<HStore> storesToFlush = new ArrayList<>();
5898    for (StoreFlushDescriptor storeFlush : flushDesc.getStoreFlushesList()) {
5899      byte[] family = storeFlush.getFamilyName().toByteArray();
5900      HStore store = getStore(family);
5901      if (store == null) {
5902        LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
5903          + "Received a flush start marker from primary, but the family is not found. Ignoring"
5904          + " StoreFlushDescriptor:" + TextFormat.shortDebugString(storeFlush));
5905        continue;
5906      }
5907      storesToFlush.add(store);
5908    }
5909    return storesToFlush;
5910  }
5911
5912  /**
5913   * Replay the flush marker from primary region by creating a corresponding snapshot of the store
5914   * memstores, only if the memstores do not have a higher seqId from an earlier wal edit (because
5915   * the events may be coming out of order).
5916   * @deprecated Since 3.0.0, will be removed in 4.0.0. Only for keep compatibility for old region
5917   *             replica implementation.
5918   */
5919  @Deprecated
5920  PrepareFlushResult replayWALFlushStartMarker(FlushDescriptor flush) throws IOException {
5921    long flushSeqId = flush.getFlushSequenceNumber();
5922
5923    Collection<HStore> storesToFlush = getStoresToFlush(flush);
5924
5925    MonitoredTask status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus("Preparing flush " + this);
5926
5927    // we will use writestate as a coarse-grain lock for all the replay events
5928    // (flush, compaction, region open etc)
5929    synchronized (writestate) {
5930      try {
5931        if (flush.getFlushSequenceNumber() < lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId) {
5932          LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Skipping replaying flush event :"
5933            + TextFormat.shortDebugString(flush)
5934            + " because its sequence id is smaller than this regions lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId "
5935            + " of " + lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId);
5936          return null;
5937        }
5938        if (numMutationsWithoutWAL.sum() > 0) {
5939          numMutationsWithoutWAL.reset();
5940          dataInMemoryWithoutWAL.reset();
5941        }
5942
5943        if (!writestate.flushing) {
5944          // we do not have an active snapshot and corresponding this.prepareResult. This means
5945          // we can just snapshot our memstores and continue as normal.
5946
5947          // invoke prepareFlushCache. Send null as wal since we do not want the flush events in wal
5948          PrepareFlushResult prepareResult = internalPrepareFlushCache(null, flushSeqId,
5949            storesToFlush, status, false, FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
5950          if (prepareResult.result == null) {
5951            // save the PrepareFlushResult so that we can use it later from commit flush
5952            this.writestate.flushing = true;
5953            this.prepareFlushResult = prepareResult;
5954            status.markComplete("Flush prepare successful");
5955            if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
5956              LOG.debug(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + " Prepared flush with seqId:"
5957                + flush.getFlushSequenceNumber());
5958            }
5959          } else {
5960            // special case empty memstore. We will still save the flush result in this case, since
5961            // our memstore ie empty, but the primary is still flushing
5962            if (
5963              prepareResult.getResult().getResult()
5964                  == FlushResult.Result.CANNOT_FLUSH_MEMSTORE_EMPTY
5965            ) {
5966              this.writestate.flushing = true;
5967              this.prepareFlushResult = prepareResult;
5968              if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
5969                LOG.debug(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
5970                  + " Prepared empty flush with seqId:" + flush.getFlushSequenceNumber());
5971              }
5972            }
5973            status.abort("Flush prepare failed with " + prepareResult.result);
5974            // nothing much to do. prepare flush failed because of some reason.
5975          }
5976          return prepareResult;
5977        } else {
5978          // we already have an active snapshot.
5979          if (flush.getFlushSequenceNumber() == this.prepareFlushResult.flushOpSeqId) {
5980            // They define the same flush. Log and continue.
5981            LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
5982              + "Received a flush prepare marker with the same seqId: "
5983              + +flush.getFlushSequenceNumber() + " before clearing the previous one with seqId: "
5984              + prepareFlushResult.flushOpSeqId + ". Ignoring");
5985            // ignore
5986          } else if (flush.getFlushSequenceNumber() < this.prepareFlushResult.flushOpSeqId) {
5987            // We received a flush with a smaller seqNum than what we have prepared. We can only
5988            // ignore this prepare flush request.
5989            LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
5990              + "Received a flush prepare marker with a smaller seqId: "
5991              + +flush.getFlushSequenceNumber() + " before clearing the previous one with seqId: "
5992              + prepareFlushResult.flushOpSeqId + ". Ignoring");
5993            // ignore
5994          } else {
5995            // We received a flush with a larger seqNum than what we have prepared
5996            LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
5997              + "Received a flush prepare marker with a larger seqId: "
5998              + +flush.getFlushSequenceNumber() + " before clearing the previous one with seqId: "
5999              + prepareFlushResult.flushOpSeqId + ". Ignoring");
6000            // We do not have multiple active snapshots in the memstore or a way to merge current
6001            // memstore snapshot with the contents and resnapshot for now. We cannot take
6002            // another snapshot and drop the previous one because that will cause temporary
6003            // data loss in the secondary. So we ignore this for now, deferring the resolution
6004            // to happen when we see the corresponding flush commit marker. If we have a memstore
6005            // snapshot with x, and later received another prepare snapshot with y (where x < y),
6006            // when we see flush commit for y, we will drop snapshot for x, and can also drop all
6007            // the memstore edits if everything in memstore is < y. This is the usual case for
6008            // RS crash + recovery where we might see consequtive prepare flush wal markers.
6009            // Otherwise, this will cause more memory to be used in secondary replica until a
6010            // further prapare + commit flush is seen and replayed.
6011          }
6012        }
6013      } finally {
6014        status.cleanup();
6015        writestate.notifyAll();
6016      }
6017    }
6018    return null;
6019  }
6020
6021  /**
6022   * @deprecated Since 3.0.0, will be removed in 4.0.0. Only for keep compatibility for old region
6023   *             replica implementation.
6024   */
6025  @Deprecated
6026  @edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressWarnings(value = "NN_NAKED_NOTIFY",
6027      justification = "Intentional; post memstore flush")
6028  void replayWALFlushCommitMarker(FlushDescriptor flush) throws IOException {
6029    MonitoredTask status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus("Committing flush " + this);
6030
6031    // check whether we have the memstore snapshot with the corresponding seqId. Replay to
6032    // secondary region replicas are in order, except for when the region moves or then the
6033    // region server crashes. In those cases, we may receive replay requests out of order from
6034    // the original seqIds.
6035    synchronized (writestate) {
6036      try {
6037        if (flush.getFlushSequenceNumber() < lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId) {
6038          LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Skipping replaying flush event :"
6039            + TextFormat.shortDebugString(flush)
6040            + " because its sequence id is smaller than this regions lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId "
6041            + " of " + lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId);
6042          return;
6043        }
6044
6045        if (writestate.flushing) {
6046          PrepareFlushResult prepareFlushResult = this.prepareFlushResult;
6047          if (flush.getFlushSequenceNumber() == prepareFlushResult.flushOpSeqId) {
6048            if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
6049              LOG.debug(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6050                + "Received a flush commit marker with seqId:" + flush.getFlushSequenceNumber()
6051                + " and a previous prepared snapshot was found");
6052            }
6053            // This is the regular case where we received commit flush after prepare flush
6054            // corresponding to the same seqId.
6055            replayFlushInStores(flush, prepareFlushResult, true);
6056
6057            // Set down the memstore size by amount of flush.
6058            this.decrMemStoreSize(prepareFlushResult.totalFlushableSize.getMemStoreSize());
6059            this.prepareFlushResult = null;
6060            writestate.flushing = false;
6061          } else if (flush.getFlushSequenceNumber() < prepareFlushResult.flushOpSeqId) {
6062            // This should not happen normally. However, lets be safe and guard against these cases
6063            // we received a flush commit with a smaller seqId than what we have prepared
6064            // we will pick the flush file up from this commit (if we have not seen it), but we
6065            // will not drop the memstore
6066            LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6067              + "Received a flush commit marker with smaller seqId: "
6068              + flush.getFlushSequenceNumber() + " than what we have prepared with seqId: "
6069              + prepareFlushResult.flushOpSeqId + ". Picking up new file, but not dropping"
6070              + "  prepared memstore snapshot");
6071            replayFlushInStores(flush, prepareFlushResult, false);
6072
6073            // snapshot is not dropped, so memstore sizes should not be decremented
6074            // we still have the prepared snapshot, flushing should still be true
6075          } else {
6076            // This should not happen normally. However, lets be safe and guard against these cases
6077            // we received a flush commit with a larger seqId than what we have prepared
6078            // we will pick the flush file for this. We will also obtain the updates lock and
6079            // look for contents of the memstore to see whether we have edits after this seqId.
6080            // If not, we will drop all the memstore edits and the snapshot as well.
6081            LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6082              + "Received a flush commit marker with larger seqId: "
6083              + flush.getFlushSequenceNumber() + " than what we have prepared with seqId: "
6084              + prepareFlushResult.flushOpSeqId + ". Picking up new file and dropping prepared"
6085              + " memstore snapshot");
6086
6087            replayFlushInStores(flush, prepareFlushResult, true);
6088
6089            // Set down the memstore size by amount of flush.
6090            this.decrMemStoreSize(prepareFlushResult.totalFlushableSize.getMemStoreSize());
6091
6092            // Inspect the memstore contents to see whether the memstore contains only edits
6093            // with seqId smaller than the flush seqId. If so, we can discard those edits.
6094            dropMemStoreContentsForSeqId(flush.getFlushSequenceNumber(), null);
6095
6096            this.prepareFlushResult = null;
6097            writestate.flushing = false;
6098          }
6099          // If we were waiting for observing a flush or region opening event for not showing
6100          // partial data after a secondary region crash, we can allow reads now. We can only make
6101          // sure that we are not showing partial data (for example skipping some previous edits)
6102          // until we observe a full flush start and flush commit. So if we were not able to find
6103          // a previous flush we will not enable reads now.
6104          this.setReadsEnabled(true);
6105        } else {
6106          LOG.warn(
6107            getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Received a flush commit marker with seqId:"
6108              + flush.getFlushSequenceNumber() + ", but no previous prepared snapshot was found");
6109          // There is no corresponding prepare snapshot from before.
6110          // We will pick up the new flushed file
6111          replayFlushInStores(flush, null, false);
6112
6113          // Inspect the memstore contents to see whether the memstore contains only edits
6114          // with seqId smaller than the flush seqId. If so, we can discard those edits.
6115          dropMemStoreContentsForSeqId(flush.getFlushSequenceNumber(), null);
6116        }
6117
6118        status.markComplete("Flush commit successful");
6119
6120        // Update the last flushed sequence id for region.
6121        this.maxFlushedSeqId = flush.getFlushSequenceNumber();
6122
6123        // advance the mvcc read point so that the new flushed file is visible.
6124        mvcc.advanceTo(flush.getFlushSequenceNumber());
6125
6126      } catch (FileNotFoundException ex) {
6127        LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6128          + "At least one of the store files in flush: " + TextFormat.shortDebugString(flush)
6129          + " doesn't exist any more. Skip loading the file(s)", ex);
6130      } finally {
6131        status.cleanup();
6132        writestate.notifyAll();
6133      }
6134    }
6135
6136    // C. Finally notify anyone waiting on memstore to clear:
6137    // e.g. checkResources().
6138    synchronized (this) {
6139      notifyAll(); // FindBugs NN_NAKED_NOTIFY
6140    }
6141  }
6142
6143  /**
6144   * Replays the given flush descriptor by opening the flush files in stores and dropping the
6145   * memstore snapshots if requested.
6146   * @deprecated Since 3.0.0, will be removed in 4.0.0. Only for keep compatibility for old region
6147   *             replica implementation.
6148   */
6149  @Deprecated
6150  private void replayFlushInStores(FlushDescriptor flush, PrepareFlushResult prepareFlushResult,
6151    boolean dropMemstoreSnapshot) throws IOException {
6152    for (StoreFlushDescriptor storeFlush : flush.getStoreFlushesList()) {
6153      byte[] family = storeFlush.getFamilyName().toByteArray();
6154      HStore store = getStore(family);
6155      if (store == null) {
6156        LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6157          + "Received a flush commit marker from primary, but the family is not found."
6158          + "Ignoring StoreFlushDescriptor:" + storeFlush);
6159        continue;
6160      }
6161      List<String> flushFiles = storeFlush.getFlushOutputList();
6162      StoreFlushContext ctx = null;
6163      long startTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
6164      if (prepareFlushResult == null || prepareFlushResult.storeFlushCtxs == null) {
6165        ctx = store.createFlushContext(flush.getFlushSequenceNumber(), FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
6166      } else {
6167        ctx = prepareFlushResult.storeFlushCtxs.get(family);
6168        startTime = prepareFlushResult.startTime;
6169      }
6170
6171      if (ctx == null) {
6172        LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6173          + "Unexpected: flush commit marker received from store " + Bytes.toString(family)
6174          + " but no associated flush context. Ignoring");
6175        continue;
6176      }
6177
6178      ctx.replayFlush(flushFiles, dropMemstoreSnapshot); // replay the flush
6179
6180      // Record latest flush time
6181      this.lastStoreFlushTimeMap.put(store, startTime);
6182    }
6183  }
6184
6185  private long loadRecoveredHFilesIfAny(Collection<HStore> stores) throws IOException {
6186    Path regionDir = fs.getRegionDir();
6187    long maxSeqId = -1;
6188    for (HStore store : stores) {
6189      String familyName = store.getColumnFamilyName();
6190      FileStatus[] files =
6191        WALSplitUtil.getRecoveredHFiles(fs.getFileSystem(), regionDir, familyName);
6192      if (files != null && files.length != 0) {
6193        for (FileStatus file : files) {
6194          Path filePath = file.getPath();
6195          // If file length is zero then delete it
6196          if (isZeroLengthThenDelete(fs.getFileSystem(), file, filePath)) {
6197            continue;
6198          }
6199          try {
6200            HStoreFile storefile = store.tryCommitRecoveredHFile(file.getPath());
6201            maxSeqId = Math.max(maxSeqId, storefile.getReader().getSequenceID());
6202          } catch (IOException e) {
6203            handleException(fs.getFileSystem(), filePath, e);
6204            continue;
6205          }
6206        }
6207        if (this.rsServices != null && store.needsCompaction()) {
6208          this.rsServices.getCompactionRequestor().requestCompaction(this, store,
6209            "load recovered hfiles request compaction", Store.PRIORITY_USER + 1,
6210            CompactionLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY, null);
6211        }
6212      }
6213    }
6214    return maxSeqId;
6215  }
6216
6217  /**
6218   * Be careful, this method will drop all data in the memstore of this region. Currently, this
6219   * method is used to drop memstore to prevent memory leak when replaying recovered.edits while
6220   * opening region.
6221   */
6222  private MemStoreSize dropMemStoreContents() throws IOException {
6223    MemStoreSizing totalFreedSize = new NonThreadSafeMemStoreSizing();
6224    this.updatesLock.writeLock().lock();
6225    try {
6226      for (HStore s : stores.values()) {
6227        MemStoreSize memStoreSize = doDropStoreMemStoreContentsForSeqId(s, HConstants.NO_SEQNUM);
6228        LOG.info("Drop memstore for Store " + s.getColumnFamilyName() + " in region "
6229          + this.getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString() + " , dropped memstoresize: ["
6230          + memStoreSize + " }");
6231        totalFreedSize.incMemStoreSize(memStoreSize);
6232      }
6233      return totalFreedSize.getMemStoreSize();
6234    } finally {
6235      this.updatesLock.writeLock().unlock();
6236    }
6237  }
6238
6239  /**
6240   * Drops the memstore contents after replaying a flush descriptor or region open event replay if
6241   * the memstore edits have seqNums smaller than the given seq id
6242   */
6243  private MemStoreSize dropMemStoreContentsForSeqId(long seqId, HStore store) throws IOException {
6244    MemStoreSizing totalFreedSize = new NonThreadSafeMemStoreSizing();
6245    this.updatesLock.writeLock().lock();
6246    try {
6247
6248      long currentSeqId = mvcc.getReadPoint();
6249      if (seqId >= currentSeqId) {
6250        // then we can drop the memstore contents since everything is below this seqId
6251        LOG.info(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6252          + "Dropping memstore contents as well since replayed flush seqId: " + seqId
6253          + " is greater than current seqId:" + currentSeqId);
6254
6255        // Prepare flush (take a snapshot) and then abort (drop the snapshot)
6256        if (store == null) {
6257          for (HStore s : stores.values()) {
6258            totalFreedSize.incMemStoreSize(doDropStoreMemStoreContentsForSeqId(s, currentSeqId));
6259          }
6260        } else {
6261          totalFreedSize.incMemStoreSize(doDropStoreMemStoreContentsForSeqId(store, currentSeqId));
6262        }
6263      } else {
6264        LOG.info(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6265          + "Not dropping memstore contents since replayed flush seqId: " + seqId
6266          + " is smaller than current seqId:" + currentSeqId);
6267      }
6268    } finally {
6269      this.updatesLock.writeLock().unlock();
6270    }
6271    return totalFreedSize.getMemStoreSize();
6272  }
6273
6274  private MemStoreSize doDropStoreMemStoreContentsForSeqId(HStore s, long currentSeqId)
6275    throws IOException {
6276    MemStoreSize flushableSize = s.getFlushableSize();
6277    this.decrMemStoreSize(flushableSize);
6278    StoreFlushContext ctx = s.createFlushContext(currentSeqId, FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
6279    ctx.prepare();
6280    ctx.abort();
6281    return flushableSize;
6282  }
6283
6284  private void replayWALFlushAbortMarker(FlushDescriptor flush) {
6285    // nothing to do for now. A flush abort will cause a RS abort which means that the region
6286    // will be opened somewhere else later. We will see the region open event soon, and replaying
6287    // that will drop the snapshot
6288  }
6289
6290  private void replayWALFlushCannotFlushMarker(FlushDescriptor flush, long replaySeqId) {
6291    synchronized (writestate) {
6292      if (this.lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId > replaySeqId) {
6293        LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Skipping replaying flush event :"
6294          + TextFormat.shortDebugString(flush) + " because its sequence id " + replaySeqId
6295          + " is smaller than this regions " + "lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId of "
6296          + lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId);
6297        return;
6298      }
6299
6300      // If we were waiting for observing a flush or region opening event for not showing partial
6301      // data after a secondary region crash, we can allow reads now. This event means that the
6302      // primary was not able to flush because memstore is empty when we requested flush. By the
6303      // time we observe this, we are guaranteed to have up to date seqId with our previous
6304      // assignment.
6305      this.setReadsEnabled(true);
6306    }
6307  }
6308
6309  PrepareFlushResult getPrepareFlushResult() {
6310    return prepareFlushResult;
6311  }
6312
6313  /**
6314   * @deprecated Since 3.0.0, will be removed in 4.0.0. Only for keep compatibility for old region
6315   *             replica implementation.
6316   */
6317  @Deprecated
6318  @edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressWarnings(value = "NN_NAKED_NOTIFY",
6319      justification = "Intentional; cleared the memstore")
6320  void replayWALRegionEventMarker(RegionEventDescriptor regionEvent) throws IOException {
6321    checkTargetRegion(regionEvent.getEncodedRegionName().toByteArray(),
6322      "RegionEvent marker from WAL ", regionEvent);
6323
6324    startRegionOperation(Operation.REPLAY_EVENT);
6325    try {
6326      if (ServerRegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(this.getRegionInfo())) {
6327        return; // if primary nothing to do
6328      }
6329
6330      if (regionEvent.getEventType() == EventType.REGION_CLOSE) {
6331        // nothing to do on REGION_CLOSE for now.
6332        return;
6333      }
6334      if (regionEvent.getEventType() != EventType.REGION_OPEN) {
6335        LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6336          + "Unknown region event received, ignoring :" + TextFormat.shortDebugString(regionEvent));
6337        return;
6338      }
6339
6340      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
6341        LOG.debug(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Replaying region open event marker "
6342          + TextFormat.shortDebugString(regionEvent));
6343      }
6344
6345      // we will use writestate as a coarse-grain lock for all the replay events
6346      synchronized (writestate) {
6347        // Replication can deliver events out of order when primary region moves or the region
6348        // server crashes, since there is no coordination between replication of different wal files
6349        // belonging to different region servers. We have to safe guard against this case by using
6350        // region open event's seqid. Since this is the first event that the region puts (after
6351        // possibly flushing recovered.edits), after seeing this event, we can ignore every edit
6352        // smaller than this seqId
6353        if (this.lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId <= regionEvent.getLogSequenceNumber()) {
6354          this.lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId = regionEvent.getLogSequenceNumber();
6355        } else {
6356          LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Skipping replaying region event :"
6357            + TextFormat.shortDebugString(regionEvent)
6358            + " because its sequence id is smaller than this regions lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId "
6359            + " of " + lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId);
6360          return;
6361        }
6362
6363        // region open lists all the files that the region has at the time of the opening. Just pick
6364        // all the files and drop prepared flushes and empty memstores
6365        for (StoreDescriptor storeDescriptor : regionEvent.getStoresList()) {
6366          // stores of primary may be different now
6367          byte[] family = storeDescriptor.getFamilyName().toByteArray();
6368          HStore store = getStore(family);
6369          if (store == null) {
6370            LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6371              + "Received a region open marker from primary, but the family is not found. "
6372              + "Ignoring. StoreDescriptor:" + storeDescriptor);
6373            continue;
6374          }
6375
6376          long storeSeqId = store.getMaxSequenceId().orElse(0L);
6377          List<String> storeFiles = storeDescriptor.getStoreFileList();
6378          try {
6379            store.refreshStoreFiles(storeFiles); // replace the files with the new ones
6380          } catch (FileNotFoundException ex) {
6381            LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "At least one of the store files: "
6382              + storeFiles + " doesn't exist any more. Skip loading the file(s)", ex);
6383            continue;
6384          }
6385          if (store.getMaxSequenceId().orElse(0L) != storeSeqId) {
6386            // Record latest flush time if we picked up new files
6387            lastStoreFlushTimeMap.put(store, EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime());
6388          }
6389
6390          if (writestate.flushing) {
6391            // only drop memstore snapshots if they are smaller than last flush for the store
6392            if (this.prepareFlushResult.flushOpSeqId <= regionEvent.getLogSequenceNumber()) {
6393              StoreFlushContext ctx = this.prepareFlushResult.storeFlushCtxs == null
6394                ? null
6395                : this.prepareFlushResult.storeFlushCtxs.get(family);
6396              if (ctx != null) {
6397                MemStoreSize mss = store.getFlushableSize();
6398                ctx.abort();
6399                this.decrMemStoreSize(mss);
6400                this.prepareFlushResult.storeFlushCtxs.remove(family);
6401              }
6402            }
6403          }
6404
6405          // Drop the memstore contents if they are now smaller than the latest seen flushed file
6406          dropMemStoreContentsForSeqId(regionEvent.getLogSequenceNumber(), store);
6407          if (storeSeqId > this.maxFlushedSeqId) {
6408            this.maxFlushedSeqId = storeSeqId;
6409          }
6410        }
6411
6412        // if all stores ended up dropping their snapshots, we can safely drop the
6413        // prepareFlushResult
6414        dropPrepareFlushIfPossible();
6415
6416        // advance the mvcc read point so that the new flushed file is visible.
6417        mvcc.await();
6418
6419        // If we were waiting for observing a flush or region opening event for not showing partial
6420        // data after a secondary region crash, we can allow reads now.
6421        this.setReadsEnabled(true);
6422
6423        // C. Finally notify anyone waiting on memstore to clear:
6424        // e.g. checkResources().
6425        synchronized (this) {
6426          notifyAll(); // FindBugs NN_NAKED_NOTIFY
6427        }
6428      }
6429      logRegionFiles();
6430    } finally {
6431      closeRegionOperation(Operation.REPLAY_EVENT);
6432    }
6433  }
6434
6435  /**
6436   * @deprecated Since 3.0.0, will be removed in 4.0.0. Only for keep compatibility for old region
6437   *             replica implementation.
6438   */
6439  @Deprecated
6440  void replayWALBulkLoadEventMarker(WALProtos.BulkLoadDescriptor bulkLoadEvent) throws IOException {
6441    checkTargetRegion(bulkLoadEvent.getEncodedRegionName().toByteArray(),
6442      "BulkLoad marker from WAL ", bulkLoadEvent);
6443
6444    if (ServerRegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(this.getRegionInfo())) {
6445      return; // if primary nothing to do
6446    }
6447
6448    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
6449      LOG.debug(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Replaying bulkload event marker "
6450        + TextFormat.shortDebugString(bulkLoadEvent));
6451    }
6452    // check if multiple families involved
6453    boolean multipleFamilies = false;
6454    byte[] family = null;
6455    for (StoreDescriptor storeDescriptor : bulkLoadEvent.getStoresList()) {
6456      byte[] fam = storeDescriptor.getFamilyName().toByteArray();
6457      if (family == null) {
6458        family = fam;
6459      } else if (!Bytes.equals(family, fam)) {
6460        multipleFamilies = true;
6461        break;
6462      }
6463    }
6464
6465    startBulkRegionOperation(multipleFamilies);
6466    try {
6467      // we will use writestate as a coarse-grain lock for all the replay events
6468      synchronized (writestate) {
6469        // Replication can deliver events out of order when primary region moves or the region
6470        // server crashes, since there is no coordination between replication of different wal files
6471        // belonging to different region servers. We have to safe guard against this case by using
6472        // region open event's seqid. Since this is the first event that the region puts (after
6473        // possibly flushing recovered.edits), after seeing this event, we can ignore every edit
6474        // smaller than this seqId
6475        if (
6476          bulkLoadEvent.getBulkloadSeqNum() >= 0
6477            && this.lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId >= bulkLoadEvent.getBulkloadSeqNum()
6478        ) {
6479          LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + "Skipping replaying bulkload event :"
6480            + TextFormat.shortDebugString(bulkLoadEvent)
6481            + " because its sequence id is smaller than this region's lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId"
6482            + " =" + lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId);
6483
6484          return;
6485        }
6486
6487        for (StoreDescriptor storeDescriptor : bulkLoadEvent.getStoresList()) {
6488          // stores of primary may be different now
6489          family = storeDescriptor.getFamilyName().toByteArray();
6490          HStore store = getStore(family);
6491          if (store == null) {
6492            LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6493              + "Received a bulk load marker from primary, but the family is not found. "
6494              + "Ignoring. StoreDescriptor:" + storeDescriptor);
6495            continue;
6496          }
6497
6498          List<String> storeFiles = storeDescriptor.getStoreFileList();
6499          for (String storeFile : storeFiles) {
6500            StoreFileInfo storeFileInfo = null;
6501            try {
6502              storeFileInfo = fs.getStoreFileInfo(Bytes.toString(family), storeFile);
6503              store.bulkLoadHFile(storeFileInfo);
6504            } catch (FileNotFoundException ex) {
6505              LOG.warn(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6506                + ((storeFileInfo != null)
6507                  ? storeFileInfo.toString()
6508                  : (new Path(Bytes.toString(family), storeFile)).toString())
6509                + " doesn't exist any more. Skip loading the file");
6510            }
6511          }
6512        }
6513      }
6514      if (bulkLoadEvent.getBulkloadSeqNum() > 0) {
6515        mvcc.advanceTo(bulkLoadEvent.getBulkloadSeqNum());
6516      }
6517    } finally {
6518      closeBulkRegionOperation();
6519    }
6520  }
6521
6522  /**
6523   * Replay the batch mutate for secondary replica.
6524   * <p/>
6525   * We will directly apply the cells to the memstore. This is because:
6526   * <ol>
6527   * <li>All the cells are gotten from {@link WALEdit}, so we only have {@link Put} and
6528   * {@link Delete} here</li>
6529   * <li>The replay is single threaded, we do not need to acquire row lock, as the region is read
6530   * only so no one else can write it.</li>
6531   * <li>We do not need to write WAL.</li>
6532   * <li>We will advance MVCC in the caller directly.</li>
6533   * </ol>
6534   */
6535  private void replayWALBatchMutate(Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> family2Cells)
6536    throws IOException {
6537    startRegionOperation(Operation.REPLAY_BATCH_MUTATE);
6538    try {
6539      for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> entry : family2Cells.entrySet()) {
6540        applyToMemStore(getStore(entry.getKey()), entry.getValue(), false, memStoreSizing);
6541      }
6542    } finally {
6543      closeRegionOperation(Operation.REPLAY_BATCH_MUTATE);
6544    }
6545  }
6546
6547  /**
6548   * Replay the meta edits, i.e, flush marker, compaction marker, bulk load marker, region event
6549   * marker, etc.
6550   * <p/>
6551   * For all events other than start flush, we will just call {@link #refreshStoreFiles()} as the
6552   * logic is straight-forward and robust. For start flush, we need to snapshot the memstore, so
6553   * later {@link #refreshStoreFiles()} call could drop the snapshot, otherwise we may run out of
6554   * memory.
6555   */
6556  private void replayWALMetaEdit(Cell cell) throws IOException {
6557    startRegionOperation(Operation.REPLAY_EVENT);
6558    try {
6559      FlushDescriptor flushDesc = WALEdit.getFlushDescriptor(cell);
6560      if (flushDesc != null) {
6561        switch (flushDesc.getAction()) {
6562          case START_FLUSH:
6563            // for start flush, we need to take a snapshot of the current memstore
6564            synchronized (writestate) {
6565              if (!writestate.flushing) {
6566                this.writestate.flushing = true;
6567              } else {
6568                // usually this should not happen but let's make the code more robust, it is not a
6569                // big deal to just ignore it, the refreshStoreFiles call should have the ability to
6570                // clean up the inconsistent state.
6571                LOG.debug("NOT flushing {} as already flushing", getRegionInfo());
6572                break;
6573              }
6574            }
6575            MonitoredTask status =
6576              TaskMonitor.get().createStatus("Preparing flush " + getRegionInfo());
6577            Collection<HStore> storesToFlush = getStoresToFlush(flushDesc);
6578            try {
6579              PrepareFlushResult prepareResult =
6580                internalPrepareFlushCache(null, flushDesc.getFlushSequenceNumber(), storesToFlush,
6581                  status, false, FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
6582              if (prepareResult.result == null) {
6583                // save the PrepareFlushResult so that we can use it later from commit flush
6584                this.prepareFlushResult = prepareResult;
6585                status.markComplete("Flush prepare successful");
6586                if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
6587                  LOG.debug("{} prepared flush with seqId: {}", getRegionInfo(),
6588                    flushDesc.getFlushSequenceNumber());
6589                }
6590              } else {
6591                // special case empty memstore. We will still save the flush result in this case,
6592                // since our memstore is empty, but the primary is still flushing
6593                if (
6594                  prepareResult.getResult().getResult()
6595                      == FlushResult.Result.CANNOT_FLUSH_MEMSTORE_EMPTY
6596                ) {
6597                  this.prepareFlushResult = prepareResult;
6598                  if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
6599                    LOG.debug("{} prepared empty flush with seqId: {}", getRegionInfo(),
6600                      flushDesc.getFlushSequenceNumber());
6601                  }
6602                }
6603                status.abort("Flush prepare failed with " + prepareResult.result);
6604                // nothing much to do. prepare flush failed because of some reason.
6605              }
6606            } finally {
6607              status.cleanup();
6608            }
6609            break;
6610          case ABORT_FLUSH:
6611            // do nothing, an abort flush means the source region server will crash itself, after
6612            // the primary region online, it will send us an open region marker, then we can clean
6613            // up the memstore.
6614            synchronized (writestate) {
6615              writestate.flushing = false;
6616            }
6617            break;
6618          case COMMIT_FLUSH:
6619          case CANNOT_FLUSH:
6620            // just call refreshStoreFiles
6621            refreshStoreFiles();
6622            logRegionFiles();
6623            synchronized (writestate) {
6624              writestate.flushing = false;
6625            }
6626            break;
6627          default:
6628            LOG.warn("{} received a flush event with unknown action: {}", getRegionInfo(),
6629              TextFormat.shortDebugString(flushDesc));
6630        }
6631      } else {
6632        // for all other region events, we will do a refreshStoreFiles
6633        refreshStoreFiles();
6634        logRegionFiles();
6635      }
6636    } finally {
6637      closeRegionOperation(Operation.REPLAY_EVENT);
6638    }
6639  }
6640
6641  /**
6642   * Replay remote wal entry sent by primary replica.
6643   * <p/>
6644   * Should only call this method on secondary replicas.
6645   */
6646  void replayWALEntry(WALEntry entry, CellScanner cells) throws IOException {
6647    long timeout = -1L;
6648    Optional<RpcCall> call = RpcServer.getCurrentCall();
6649    if (call.isPresent()) {
6650      long deadline = call.get().getDeadline();
6651      if (deadline < Long.MAX_VALUE) {
6652        timeout = deadline - EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
6653        if (timeout <= 0) {
6654          throw new TimeoutIOException("Timeout while replaying edits for " + getRegionInfo());
6655        }
6656      }
6657    }
6658    if (timeout > 0) {
6659      try {
6660        if (!replayLock.tryLock(timeout, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS)) {
6661          throw new TimeoutIOException(
6662            "Timeout while waiting for lock when replaying edits for " + getRegionInfo());
6663        }
6664      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
6665        throw throwOnInterrupt(e);
6666      }
6667    } else {
6668      replayLock.lock();
6669    }
6670    try {
6671      int count = entry.getAssociatedCellCount();
6672      long sequenceId = entry.getKey().getLogSequenceNumber();
6673      if (lastReplayedSequenceId >= sequenceId) {
6674        // we have already replayed this edit, skip
6675        // remember to advance the CellScanner, as we may have multiple WALEntries, we may still
6676        // need apply later WALEntries
6677        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
6678          // Throw index out of bounds if our cell count is off
6679          if (!cells.advance()) {
6680            throw new ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException("Expected=" + count + ", index=" + i);
6681          }
6682        }
6683        return;
6684      }
6685      Map<byte[], List<ExtendedCell>> family2Cells = new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
6686      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
6687        // Throw index out of bounds if our cell count is off
6688        if (!cells.advance()) {
6689          throw new ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException("Expected=" + count + ", index=" + i);
6690        }
6691        Cell c = cells.current();
6692        assert c instanceof ExtendedCell;
6693        ExtendedCell cell = (ExtendedCell) c;
6694        if (WALEdit.isMetaEditFamily(cell)) {
6695          // If there is meta edit, i.e, we have done flush/compaction/open, then we need to apply
6696          // the previous cells first, and then replay the special meta edit. The meta edit is like
6697          // a barrier, We need to keep the order. For example, the flush marker will contain a
6698          // flush sequence number, which makes us possible to drop memstore content, but if we
6699          // apply some edits which have greater sequence id first, then we can not drop the
6700          // memstore content when replaying the flush marker, which is not good as we could run out
6701          // of memory.
6702          // And usually, a meta edit will have a special WALEntry for it, so this is just a safe
6703          // guard logic to make sure we do not break things in the worst case.
6704          if (!family2Cells.isEmpty()) {
6705            replayWALBatchMutate(family2Cells);
6706            family2Cells.clear();
6707          }
6708          replayWALMetaEdit(cell);
6709        } else {
6710          family2Cells.computeIfAbsent(CellUtil.cloneFamily(cell), k -> new ArrayList<>())
6711            .add(cell);
6712        }
6713      }
6714      // do not forget to apply the remaining cells
6715      if (!family2Cells.isEmpty()) {
6716        replayWALBatchMutate(family2Cells);
6717      }
6718      mvcc.advanceTo(sequenceId);
6719      lastReplayedSequenceId = sequenceId;
6720    } finally {
6721      replayLock.unlock();
6722    }
6723  }
6724
6725  /**
6726   * If all stores ended up dropping their snapshots, we can safely drop the prepareFlushResult
6727   */
6728  private void dropPrepareFlushIfPossible() {
6729    if (writestate.flushing) {
6730      boolean canDrop = true;
6731      if (prepareFlushResult.storeFlushCtxs != null) {
6732        for (Entry<byte[], StoreFlushContext> entry : prepareFlushResult.storeFlushCtxs
6733          .entrySet()) {
6734          HStore store = getStore(entry.getKey());
6735          if (store == null) {
6736            continue;
6737          }
6738          if (store.getSnapshotSize().getDataSize() > 0) {
6739            canDrop = false;
6740            break;
6741          }
6742        }
6743      }
6744
6745      // this means that all the stores in the region has finished flushing, but the WAL marker
6746      // may not have been written or we did not receive it yet.
6747      if (canDrop) {
6748        writestate.flushing = false;
6749        this.prepareFlushResult = null;
6750      }
6751    }
6752  }
6753
6754  @Override
6755  public boolean refreshStoreFiles() throws IOException {
6756    return refreshStoreFiles(false);
6757  }
6758
6759  @edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressWarnings(value = "NN_NAKED_NOTIFY",
6760      justification = "Notify is about post replay. Intentional")
6761  protected boolean refreshStoreFiles(boolean force) throws IOException {
6762    if (!force && ServerRegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(this.getRegionInfo())) {
6763      return false; // if primary nothing to do
6764    }
6765
6766    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
6767      LOG.debug(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : "
6768        + "Refreshing store files to see whether we can free up memstore");
6769    }
6770
6771    long totalFreedDataSize = 0;
6772
6773    long smallestSeqIdInStores = Long.MAX_VALUE;
6774
6775    startRegionOperation(); // obtain region close lock
6776    try {
6777      Map<HStore, Long> map = new HashMap<>();
6778      synchronized (writestate) {
6779        for (HStore store : stores.values()) {
6780          // TODO: some stores might see new data from flush, while others do not which
6781          // MIGHT break atomic edits across column families.
6782          long maxSeqIdBefore = store.getMaxSequenceId().orElse(0L);
6783
6784          // refresh the store files. This is similar to observing a region open wal marker.
6785          store.refreshStoreFiles();
6786
6787          long storeSeqId = store.getMaxSequenceId().orElse(0L);
6788          if (storeSeqId < smallestSeqIdInStores) {
6789            smallestSeqIdInStores = storeSeqId;
6790          }
6791
6792          // see whether we can drop the memstore or the snapshot
6793          if (storeSeqId > maxSeqIdBefore) {
6794            if (writestate.flushing) {
6795              // only drop memstore snapshots if they are smaller than last flush for the store
6796              if (this.prepareFlushResult.flushOpSeqId <= storeSeqId) {
6797                StoreFlushContext ctx = this.prepareFlushResult.storeFlushCtxs == null
6798                  ? null
6799                  : this.prepareFlushResult.storeFlushCtxs
6800                    .get(store.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName());
6801                if (ctx != null) {
6802                  MemStoreSize mss = store.getFlushableSize();
6803                  ctx.abort();
6804                  this.decrMemStoreSize(mss);
6805                  this.prepareFlushResult.storeFlushCtxs
6806                    .remove(store.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getName());
6807                  totalFreedDataSize += mss.getDataSize();
6808                }
6809              }
6810            }
6811
6812            map.put(store, storeSeqId);
6813          }
6814        }
6815
6816        // if all stores ended up dropping their snapshots, we can safely drop the
6817        // prepareFlushResult
6818        dropPrepareFlushIfPossible();
6819
6820        // advance the mvcc read point so that the new flushed files are visible.
6821        // either greater than flush seq number or they were already picked up via flush.
6822        for (HStore s : stores.values()) {
6823          mvcc.advanceTo(s.getMaxMemStoreTS().orElse(0L));
6824        }
6825
6826        // smallestSeqIdInStores is the seqId that we have a corresponding hfile for. We can safely
6827        // skip all edits that are to be replayed in the future with that has a smaller seqId
6828        // than this. We are updating lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId so that we can skip all edits
6829        // that we have picked the flush files for
6830        if (this.lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId < smallestSeqIdInStores) {
6831          this.lastReplayedOpenRegionSeqId = smallestSeqIdInStores;
6832        }
6833      }
6834      if (!map.isEmpty()) {
6835        for (Map.Entry<HStore, Long> entry : map.entrySet()) {
6836          // Drop the memstore contents if they are now smaller than the latest seen flushed file
6837          totalFreedDataSize +=
6838            dropMemStoreContentsForSeqId(entry.getValue(), entry.getKey()).getDataSize();
6839        }
6840      }
6841      // C. Finally notify anyone waiting on memstore to clear:
6842      // e.g. checkResources().
6843      synchronized (this) {
6844        notifyAll(); // FindBugs NN_NAKED_NOTIFY
6845      }
6846      return totalFreedDataSize > 0;
6847    } finally {
6848      closeRegionOperation();
6849    }
6850  }
6851
6852  private void logRegionFiles() {
6853    if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
6854      LOG.trace(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : Store files for region: ");
6855      stores.values().stream().filter(s -> s.getStorefiles() != null)
6856        .flatMap(s -> s.getStorefiles().stream())
6857        .forEachOrdered(sf -> LOG.trace(getRegionInfo().getEncodedName() + " : " + sf));
6858    }
6859  }
6860
6861  /**
6862   * Checks whether the given regionName is either equal to our region, or that the regionName is
6863   * the primary region to our corresponding range for the secondary replica.
6864   */
6865  private void checkTargetRegion(byte[] encodedRegionName, String exceptionMsg, Object payload)
6866    throws WrongRegionException {
6867    if (Bytes.equals(this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes(), encodedRegionName)) {
6868      return;
6869    }
6870
6871    if (
6872      !RegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(this.getRegionInfo())
6873        && Bytes.equals(encodedRegionName, this.fs.getRegionInfoForFS().getEncodedNameAsBytes())
6874    ) {
6875      return;
6876    }
6877
6878    throw new WrongRegionException(
6879      exceptionMsg + payload + " targetted for region " + Bytes.toStringBinary(encodedRegionName)
6880        + " does not match this region: " + this.getRegionInfo());
6881  }

6892  /**
6893   * make sure have been through lease recovery before get file status, so the file length can be
6894   * trusted.
6895   * @param p File to check.
6896   * @return True if file was zero-length (and if so, we'll delete it in here).
6897   */
6898  private static boolean isZeroLengthThenDelete(final FileSystem fs, final FileStatus stat,
6899    final Path p) throws IOException {
6900    if (stat.getLen() > 0) {
6901      return false;
6902    }
6903    LOG.warn("File " + p + " is zero-length, deleting.");
6904    fs.delete(p, false);
6905    return true;
6906  }

6908  protected HStore instantiateHStore(final ColumnFamilyDescriptor family, boolean warmup)
6909    throws IOException {
6910    if (family.isMobEnabled()) {
6911      if (HFile.getFormatVersion(this.conf) < HFile.MIN_FORMAT_VERSION_WITH_TAGS) {
6912        throw new IOException("A minimum HFile version of " + HFile.MIN_FORMAT_VERSION_WITH_TAGS
6913          + " is required for MOB feature. Consider setting " + HFile.FORMAT_VERSION_KEY
6914          + " accordingly.");
6915      }
6916      return new HMobStore(this, family, this.conf, warmup);
6917    }
6918    return new HStore(this, family, this.conf, warmup);
6919  }

6928   * the list.

6932      .map(e -> e.getValue()).findFirst().orElse(null);
6933  }

6940  @Override
6941  public List<String> getStoreFileList(byte[][] columns) throws IllegalArgumentException {
6942    List<String> storeFileNames = new ArrayList<>();
6943    synchronized (closeLock) {
6944      for (byte[] column : columns) {
6945        HStore store = this.stores.get(column);
6946        if (store == null) {
6947          throw new IllegalArgumentException(
6948            "No column family : " + new String(column, StandardCharsets.UTF_8) + " available");
6949        }
6950        Collection<HStoreFile> storeFiles = store.getStorefiles();
6951        if (storeFiles == null) {
6952          continue;
6953        }
6954        for (HStoreFile storeFile : storeFiles) {
6955          storeFileNames.add(storeFile.getPath().toString());
6956        }
6957
6958        logRegionFiles();
6959      }
6960    }
6961    return storeFileNames;
6962  }

6972        + ", startKey='" + Bytes.toStringBinary(getRegionInfo().getStartKey()) + "', getEndKey()='"
6973        + Bytes.toStringBinary(getRegionInfo().getEndKey()) + "', row='" + Bytes.toStringBinary(row)
6974        + "'");
6975    }
6976  }
