6997
6998  // will be override in tests
6999  protected RowLock getRowLockInternal(byte[] row, boolean readLock, RowLock prevRowLock)
7000    throws IOException {
7001    // create an object to use a a key in the row lock map
7002    HashedBytes rowKey = new HashedBytes(row);
7003
7004    RowLockContext rowLockContext = null;
7005    RowLockImpl result = null;
7006
7007    boolean success = false;
7008    try {
7009      // Keep trying until we have a lock or error out.
7010      // TODO: do we need to add a time component here?
7011      while (result == null) {
7012        rowLockContext = computeIfAbsent(lockedRows, rowKey, () -> new RowLockContext(rowKey));
7013        // Now try an get the lock.
7014        // This can fail as
7015        if (readLock) {
7016          // For read lock, if the caller has locked the same row previously, it will not try
7017          // to acquire the same read lock. It simply returns the previous row lock.
7018          RowLockImpl prevRowLockImpl = (RowLockImpl) prevRowLock;
7019          if (
7020            (prevRowLockImpl != null)
7021              && (prevRowLockImpl.getLock() == rowLockContext.readWriteLock.readLock())
7022          ) {
7023            success = true;
7024            return prevRowLock;
7025          }
7026          result = rowLockContext.newReadLock();
7027        } else {
7028          result = rowLockContext.newWriteLock();
7029        }
7030      }
7031
7032      int timeout = rowLockWaitDuration;
7033      boolean reachDeadlineFirst = false;
7034      Optional<RpcCall> call = RpcServer.getCurrentCall();
7035      if (call.isPresent()) {
7036        long deadline = call.get().getDeadline();
7037        if (deadline < Long.MAX_VALUE) {
7038          int timeToDeadline = (int) (deadline - EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime());
7039          if (timeToDeadline <= this.rowLockWaitDuration) {
7040            reachDeadlineFirst = true;
7041            timeout = timeToDeadline;
7042          }
7043        }
7044      }
7045
7046      if (timeout <= 0 || !result.getLock().tryLock(timeout, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS)) {
7047        String message = "Timed out waiting for lock for row: " + rowKey + " in region "
7048          + getRegionInfo().getEncodedName();
7049        if (reachDeadlineFirst) {
7050          throw new TimeoutIOException(message);
7051        } else {
7052          // If timeToDeadline is larger than rowLockWaitDuration, we can not drop the request.
7053          throw new IOException(message);
7054        }
7055      }
7056      rowLockContext.setThreadName(Thread.currentThread().getName());
7057      success = true;
7058      return result;
7059    } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
7060      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
7061        LOG.debug("Thread interrupted waiting for lock on row: {}, in region {}", rowKey,
7062          getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString());
7063      }
7064      throw throwOnInterrupt(ie);
7065    } catch (Error error) {
7066      // The maximum lock count for read lock is 64K (hardcoded), when this maximum count
7067      // is reached, it will throw out an Error. This Error needs to be caught so it can
7068      // go ahead to process the minibatch with lock acquired.
7069      LOG.warn("Error to get row lock for {}, in region {}, cause: {}", Bytes.toStringBinary(row),
7070        getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString(), error);
7071      IOException ioe = new IOException(error);
7072      throw ioe;
7073    } finally {
7074      // Clean up the counts just in case this was the thing keeping the context alive.
7075      if (!success && rowLockContext != null) {
7076        rowLockContext.cleanUp();
7077      }
7078    }
7079  }
7080
7081  private RowLock getRowLock(byte[] row, boolean readLock, final RowLock prevRowLock)
7082    throws IOException {
7083    return TraceUtil.trace(() -> getRowLockInternal(row, readLock, prevRowLock),
7084      () -> createRegionSpan("Region.getRowLock").setAttribute(ROW_LOCK_READ_LOCK_KEY, readLock));
7085  }
7086
7087  private void releaseRowLocks(List<RowLock> rowLocks) {
7088    if (rowLocks != null) {
7089      for (RowLock rowLock : rowLocks) {
7090        rowLock.release();
7091      }
7092      rowLocks.clear();
7093    }
7094  }

7096  public int getReadLockCount() {
7097    return lock.getReadLockCount();
7098  }
7099
7100  public ConcurrentHashMap<HashedBytes, RowLockContext> getLockedRows() {
7101    return lockedRows;
7102  }
7103
7104  class RowLockContext {
7105    private final HashedBytes row;
7106    final ReadWriteLock readWriteLock = new ReentrantReadWriteLock(true);
7107    final AtomicBoolean usable = new AtomicBoolean(true);
7108    final AtomicInteger count = new AtomicInteger(0);
7109    final Object lock = new Object();
7110    private String threadName;
7111
7112    RowLockContext(HashedBytes row) {
7113      this.row = row;
7114    }
7115
7116    RowLockImpl newWriteLock() {
7117      Lock l = readWriteLock.writeLock();
7118      return getRowLock(l);
7119    }
7120
7121    RowLockImpl newReadLock() {
7122      Lock l = readWriteLock.readLock();
7123      return getRowLock(l);
7124    }
7125
7126    private RowLockImpl getRowLock(Lock l) {
7127      count.incrementAndGet();
7128      synchronized (lock) {
7129        if (usable.get()) {
7130          return new RowLockImpl(this, l);
7131        } else {
7132          return null;
7133        }
7134      }
7135    }
7136
7137    void cleanUp() {
7138      long c = count.decrementAndGet();
7139      if (c <= 0) {
7140        synchronized (lock) {
7141          if (count.get() <= 0 && usable.get()) { // Don't attempt to remove row if already removed
7142            usable.set(false);
7143            RowLockContext removed = lockedRows.remove(row);
7144            assert removed == this : "we should never remove a different context";
7145          }
7146        }
7147      }
7148    }
7149
7150    public void setThreadName(String threadName) {
7151      this.threadName = threadName;
7152    }
7153
7154    @Override
7155    public String toString() {
7156      return "RowLockContext{" + "row=" + row + ", readWriteLock=" + readWriteLock + ", count="
7157        + count + ", threadName=" + threadName + '}';
7158    }
7159  }
7160
7161  /**
7162   * Class used to represent a lock on a row.
7163   */
7164  public static class RowLockImpl implements RowLock {
7165    private final RowLockContext context;
7166    private final Lock lock;
7167
7168    public RowLockImpl(RowLockContext context, Lock lock) {
7169      this.context = context;
7170      this.lock = lock;
7171    }
7172
7173    public Lock getLock() {
7174      return lock;
7175    }
7176
7177    public RowLockContext getContext() {
7178      return context;
7179    }
7180
7181    @Override
7182    public void release() {
7183      lock.unlock();
7184      context.cleanUp();
7185    }
7186
7187    @Override
7188    public String toString() {
7189      return "RowLockImpl{" + "context=" + context + ", lock=" + lock + '}';
7190    }
7191  }

7193  /**
7194   * Determines whether multiple column families are present Precondition: familyPaths is not null
7195   * @param familyPaths List of (column family, hfilePath)
7196   */
7197  private static boolean hasMultipleColumnFamilies(Collection<Pair<byte[], String>> familyPaths) {
7198    boolean multipleFamilies = false;
7199    byte[] family = null;
7200    for (Pair<byte[], String> pair : familyPaths) {
7201      byte[] fam = pair.getFirst();
7202      if (family == null) {
7203        family = fam;
7204      } else if (!Bytes.equals(family, fam)) {
7205        multipleFamilies = true;
7206        break;
7207      }
7208    }
7209    return multipleFamilies;
7210  }

7214   * column families atomically.
7215   * @param familyPaths      List of Pair&lt;byte[] column family, String hfilePath&gt;
7216   * @param bulkLoadListener Internal hooks enabling massaging/preparation of a file about to be
7217   *                         bulk loaded
7218   * @return Map from family to List of store file paths if successful, null if failed recoverably
7219   * @throws IOException if failed unrecoverably.
7220   */
7221  public Map<byte[], List<Path>> bulkLoadHFiles(Collection<Pair<byte[], String>> familyPaths,
7222    boolean assignSeqId, BulkLoadListener bulkLoadListener) throws IOException {
7223    return bulkLoadHFiles(familyPaths, assignSeqId, bulkLoadListener, false, null, true);
7224  }

7226  /**
7227   * Listener class to enable callers of bulkLoadHFile() to perform any necessary pre/post
7228   * processing of a given bulkload call
7229   */
7230  public interface BulkLoadListener {
7231    /**
7232     * Called before an HFile is actually loaded
7233     * @param family  family being loaded to
7234     * @param srcPath path of HFile
7235     * @return final path to be used for actual loading
7236     */
7237    String prepareBulkLoad(byte[] family, String srcPath, boolean copyFile, String customStaging)
7238      throws IOException;
7239
7240    /**
7241     * Called after a successful HFile load
7242     * @param family  family being loaded to
7243     * @param srcPath path of HFile
7244     */
7245    void doneBulkLoad(byte[] family, String srcPath) throws IOException;
7246
7247    /**
7248     * Called after a failed HFile load
7249     * @param family  family being loaded to
7250     * @param srcPath path of HFile
7251     */
7252    void failedBulkLoad(byte[] family, String srcPath) throws IOException;
7253  }
7254
7255  /**
7256   * Attempts to atomically load a group of hfiles. This is critical for loading rows with multiple
7257   * column families atomically.
7258   * @param familyPaths      List of Pair&lt;byte[] column family, String hfilePath&gt;
7259   * @param bulkLoadListener Internal hooks enabling massaging/preparation of a file about to be
7260   *                         bulk loaded
7261   * @param copyFile         always copy hfiles if true
7262   * @param clusterIds       ids from clusters that had already handled the given bulkload event.
7263   * @return Map from family to List of store file paths if successful, null if failed recoverably
7264   * @throws IOException if failed unrecoverably.
7265   */
7266  public Map<byte[], List<Path>> bulkLoadHFiles(Collection<Pair<byte[], String>> familyPaths,
7267    boolean assignSeqId, BulkLoadListener bulkLoadListener, boolean copyFile,
7268    List<String> clusterIds, boolean replicate) throws IOException {
7269    long seqId = -1;
7270    Map<byte[], List<Path>> storeFiles = new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
7271    Map<String, Long> storeFilesSizes = new HashMap<>();
7272    Preconditions.checkNotNull(familyPaths);
7273    // we need writeLock for multi-family bulk load
7274    startBulkRegionOperation(hasMultipleColumnFamilies(familyPaths));
7275    boolean isSuccessful = false;
7276    try {
7277      this.writeRequestsCount.increment();
7278
7279      // There possibly was a split that happened between when the split keys
7280      // were gathered and before the HRegion's write lock was taken. We need
7281      // to validate the HFile region before attempting to bulk load all of them
7282      IOException ioException = null;
7283      List<Pair<byte[], String>> failures = new ArrayList<>();
7284      for (Pair<byte[], String> p : familyPaths) {
7285        byte[] familyName = p.getFirst();
7286        String path = p.getSecond();
7287
7288        HStore store = getStore(familyName);
7289        if (store == null) {
7290          ioException = new org.apache.hadoop.hbase.DoNotRetryIOException(
7291            "No such column family " + Bytes.toStringBinary(familyName));
7292        } else {
7293          try {
7294            store.assertBulkLoadHFileOk(new Path(path));
7295          } catch (WrongRegionException wre) {
7296            // recoverable (file doesn't fit in region)
7297            failures.add(p);
7298          } catch (IOException ioe) {
7299            // unrecoverable (hdfs problem)
7300            ioException = ioe;
7301          }
7302        }
7303
7304        // validation failed because of some sort of IO problem.
7305        if (ioException != null) {
7306          LOG.error("There was IO error when checking if the bulk load is ok in region {}.", this,
7307            ioException);
7308          throw ioException;
7309        }
7310      }
7311      // validation failed, bail out before doing anything permanent.
7312      if (failures.size() != 0) {
7313        StringBuilder list = new StringBuilder();
7314        for (Pair<byte[], String> p : failures) {
7315          list.append("\n").append(Bytes.toString(p.getFirst())).append(" : ")
7316            .append(p.getSecond());
7317        }
7318        // problem when validating
7319        LOG.warn("There was a recoverable bulk load failure likely due to a split. These (family,"
7320          + " HFile) pairs were not loaded: {}, in region {}", list.toString(), this);
7321        return null;
7322      }
7323
7324      // We need to assign a sequential ID that's in between two memstores in order to preserve
7325      // the guarantee that all the edits lower than the highest sequential ID from all the
7326      // HFiles are flushed on disk. See HBASE-10958. The sequence id returned when we flush is
7327      // guaranteed to be one beyond the file made when we flushed (or if nothing to flush, it is
7328      // a sequence id that we can be sure is beyond the last hfile written).
7329      if (assignSeqId) {
7330        FlushResult fs = flushcache(true, false, FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
7331        if (fs.isFlushSucceeded()) {
7332          seqId = ((FlushResultImpl) fs).flushSequenceId;
7333        } else if (fs.getResult() == FlushResult.Result.CANNOT_FLUSH_MEMSTORE_EMPTY) {
7334          seqId = ((FlushResultImpl) fs).flushSequenceId;
7335        } else if (fs.getResult() == FlushResult.Result.CANNOT_FLUSH) {
7336          // CANNOT_FLUSH may mean that a flush is already on-going
7337          // we need to wait for that flush to complete
7338          waitForFlushes();
7339        } else {
7340          throw new IOException("Could not bulk load with an assigned sequential ID because the "
7341            + "flush didn't run. Reason for not flushing: " + ((FlushResultImpl) fs).failureReason);
7342        }
7343      }
7344
7345      Map<byte[], List<Pair<Path, Path>>> familyWithFinalPath =
7346        new TreeMap<>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
7347      for (Pair<byte[], String> p : familyPaths) {
7348        byte[] familyName = p.getFirst();
7349        String path = p.getSecond();
7350        HStore store = getStore(familyName);
7351        if (!familyWithFinalPath.containsKey(familyName)) {
7352          familyWithFinalPath.put(familyName, new ArrayList<>());
7353        }
7354        List<Pair<Path, Path>> lst = familyWithFinalPath.get(familyName);
7355        String finalPath = path;
7356        try {
7357          boolean reqTmp = store.storeEngine.requireWritingToTmpDirFirst();
7358          if (bulkLoadListener != null) {
7359            finalPath = bulkLoadListener.prepareBulkLoad(familyName, path, copyFile,
7360              reqTmp ? null : fs.getRegionDir().toString());
7361          }
7362          Pair<Path, Path> pair = null;
7363          if (reqTmp || !StoreFileInfo.isHFile(finalPath)) {
7364            pair = store.preBulkLoadHFile(finalPath, seqId);
7365          } else {
7366            Path livePath = new Path(finalPath);
7367            pair = new Pair<>(livePath, livePath);
7368          }
7369          lst.add(pair);
7370        } catch (IOException ioe) {
7371          // A failure here can cause an atomicity violation that we currently
7372          // cannot recover from since it is likely a failed HDFS operation.
7373
7374          LOG.error("There was a partial failure due to IO when attempting to" + " load "
7375            + Bytes.toString(p.getFirst()) + " : " + p.getSecond(), ioe);
7376          if (bulkLoadListener != null) {
7377            try {
7378              bulkLoadListener.failedBulkLoad(familyName, finalPath);
7379            } catch (Exception ex) {
7380              LOG.error("Error while calling failedBulkLoad for family "
7381                + Bytes.toString(familyName) + " with path " + path, ex);
7382            }
7383          }
7384          throw ioe;
7385        }
7386      }
7387
7388      if (this.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
7389        for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<Pair<Path, Path>>> entry : familyWithFinalPath.entrySet()) {
7390          this.getCoprocessorHost().preCommitStoreFile(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
7391        }
7392      }
7393      for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<Pair<Path, Path>>> entry : familyWithFinalPath.entrySet()) {
7394        byte[] familyName = entry.getKey();
7395        for (Pair<Path, Path> p : entry.getValue()) {
7396          String path = p.getFirst().toString();
7397          Path commitedStoreFile = p.getSecond();
7398          HStore store = getStore(familyName);
7399          try {
7400            store.bulkLoadHFile(familyName, path, commitedStoreFile);
7401            // Note the size of the store file
7402            try {
7403              FileSystem fs = commitedStoreFile.getFileSystem(baseConf);
7404              storeFilesSizes.put(commitedStoreFile.getName(),
7405                fs.getFileStatus(commitedStoreFile).getLen());
7406            } catch (IOException e) {
7407              LOG.warn("Failed to find the size of hfile " + commitedStoreFile, e);
7408              storeFilesSizes.put(commitedStoreFile.getName(), 0L);
7409            }
7410
7411            if (storeFiles.containsKey(familyName)) {
7412              storeFiles.get(familyName).add(commitedStoreFile);
7413            } else {
7414              List<Path> storeFileNames = new ArrayList<>();
7415              storeFileNames.add(commitedStoreFile);
7416              storeFiles.put(familyName, storeFileNames);
7417            }
7418            if (bulkLoadListener != null) {
7419              bulkLoadListener.doneBulkLoad(familyName, path);
7420            }
7421          } catch (IOException ioe) {
7422            // A failure here can cause an atomicity violation that we currently
7423            // cannot recover from since it is likely a failed HDFS operation.
7424
7425            // TODO Need a better story for reverting partial failures due to HDFS.
7426            LOG.error("There was a partial failure due to IO when attempting to" + " load "
7427              + Bytes.toString(familyName) + " : " + p.getSecond(), ioe);
7428            if (bulkLoadListener != null) {
7429              try {
7430                bulkLoadListener.failedBulkLoad(familyName, path);
7431              } catch (Exception ex) {
7432                LOG.error("Error while calling failedBulkLoad for family "
7433                  + Bytes.toString(familyName) + " with path " + path, ex);
7434              }
7435            }
7436            throw ioe;
7437          }
7438        }
7439      }
7440
7441      isSuccessful = true;
7442      if (conf.getBoolean(COMPACTION_AFTER_BULKLOAD_ENABLE, false)) {
7443        // request compaction
7444        familyWithFinalPath.keySet().forEach(family -> {
7445          HStore store = getStore(family);
7446          try {
7447            if (this.rsServices != null && store.needsCompaction()) {
7448              this.rsServices.getCompactionRequestor().requestSystemCompaction(this, store,
7449                "bulkload hfiles request compaction", true);
7450              LOG.info("Request compaction for region {} family {} after bulk load",
7451                this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName(), store.getColumnFamilyName());
7452            }
7453          } catch (IOException e) {
7454            LOG.error("bulkload hfiles request compaction error ", e);
7455          }
7456        });
7457      }
7458    } finally {
7459      if (wal != null && !storeFiles.isEmpty()) {
7460        // Write a bulk load event for hfiles that are loaded
7461        try {
7462          WALProtos.BulkLoadDescriptor loadDescriptor =
7463            ProtobufUtil.toBulkLoadDescriptor(this.getRegionInfo().getTable(),
7464              UnsafeByteOperations.unsafeWrap(this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes()),
7465              storeFiles, storeFilesSizes, seqId, clusterIds, replicate);
7466          WALUtil.writeBulkLoadMarkerAndSync(this.wal, this.getReplicationScope(), getRegionInfo(),
7467            loadDescriptor, mvcc, regionReplicationSink.orElse(null));
7468        } catch (IOException ioe) {
7469          if (this.rsServices != null) {
7470            // Have to abort region server because some hfiles has been loaded but we can't write
7471            // the event into WAL
7472            isSuccessful = false;
7473            this.rsServices.abort("Failed to write bulk load event into WAL.", ioe);
7474          }
7475        }
7476      }
7477
7478      closeBulkRegionOperation();
7479    }
7480    return isSuccessful ? storeFiles : null;
7481  }
7482
7483  @Override
7484  public boolean equals(Object o) {
7485    return o instanceof HRegion && Bytes.equals(getRegionInfo().getRegionName(),
7486      ((HRegion) o).getRegionInfo().getRegionName());
7487  }

7490  public int hashCode() {
7491    return Bytes.hashCode(getRegionInfo().getRegionName());

7494  @Override
7495  public String toString() {
7496    return getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString();
7497  }

7499  // Utility methods
7500  /**
7501   * A utility method to create new instances of HRegion based on the {@link HConstants#REGION_IMPL}
7502   * configuration property.
7503   * @param tableDir   qualified path of directory where region should be located, usually the table
7504   *                   directory.
7505   * @param wal        The WAL is the outbound log for any updates to the HRegion The wal file is a
7506   *                   logfile from the previous execution that's custom-computed for this HRegion.
7507   *                   The HRegionServer computes and sorts the appropriate wal info for this
7508   *                   HRegion. If there is a previous file (implying that the HRegion has been
7509   *                   written-to before), then read it from the supplied path.
7510   * @param fs         is the filesystem.
7511   * @param conf       is global configuration settings.
7512   * @param regionInfo - RegionInfo that describes the region is new), then read them from the
7513   *                   supplied path.
7514   * @param htd        the table descriptor
7515   * @return the new instance
7516   */
7517  public static HRegion newHRegion(Path tableDir, WAL wal, FileSystem fs, Configuration conf,
7518    RegionInfo regionInfo, final TableDescriptor htd, RegionServerServices rsServices) {
7519    try {
7520      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
7521      Class<? extends HRegion> regionClass =
7522        (Class<? extends HRegion>) conf.getClass(HConstants.REGION_IMPL, HRegion.class);
7523
7524      Constructor<? extends HRegion> c =
7525        regionClass.getConstructor(Path.class, WAL.class, FileSystem.class, Configuration.class,
7526          RegionInfo.class, TableDescriptor.class, RegionServerServices.class);
7527
7528      return c.newInstance(tableDir, wal, fs, conf, regionInfo, htd, rsServices);
7529    } catch (Throwable e) {
7530      // todo: what should I throw here?
7531      throw new IllegalStateException("Could not instantiate a region instance.", e);
7532    }
7533  }

7535  /**
7536   * Convenience method creating new HRegions. Used by createTable.
7537   * @param info       Info for region to create.
7538   * @param rootDir    Root directory for HBase instance
7539   * @param wal        shared WAL
7540   * @param initialize - true to initialize the region
7541   * @return new HRegion
7542   */
7543  public static HRegion createHRegion(final RegionInfo info, final Path rootDir,
7544    final Configuration conf, final TableDescriptor hTableDescriptor, final WAL wal,
7545    final boolean initialize) throws IOException {
7546    return createHRegion(info, rootDir, conf, hTableDescriptor, wal, initialize, null);
7547  }
7548
7549  /**
7550   * Convenience method creating new HRegions. Used by createTable.
7551   * @param info          Info for region to create.
7552   * @param rootDir       Root directory for HBase instance
7553   * @param wal           shared WAL
7554   * @param initialize    - true to initialize the region
7555   * @param rsRpcServices An interface we can request flushes against.
7556   * @return new HRegion
7557   */
7558  public static HRegion createHRegion(final RegionInfo info, final Path rootDir,
7559    final Configuration conf, final TableDescriptor hTableDescriptor, final WAL wal,
7560    final boolean initialize, RegionServerServices rsRpcServices) throws IOException {
7561    LOG.info("creating " + info + ", tableDescriptor="
7562      + (hTableDescriptor == null ? "null" : hTableDescriptor) + ", regionDir=" + rootDir);
7563    createRegionDir(conf, info, rootDir);
7564    FileSystem fs = rootDir.getFileSystem(conf);
7565    Path tableDir = CommonFSUtils.getTableDir(rootDir, info.getTable());
7566    HRegion region =
7567      HRegion.newHRegion(tableDir, wal, fs, conf, info, hTableDescriptor, rsRpcServices);
7568    if (initialize) {
7569      region.initialize(null);
7570    }
7571    return region;
7572  }
7573
7574  /**
7575   * Create a region under the given table directory.
7576   */
7577  public static HRegion createHRegion(Configuration conf, RegionInfo regionInfo, FileSystem fs,
7578    Path tableDir, TableDescriptor tableDesc) throws IOException {
7579    LOG.info("Creating {}, tableDescriptor={}, under table dir {}", regionInfo, tableDesc,
7580      tableDir);
7581    HRegionFileSystem.createRegionOnFileSystem(conf, fs, tableDir, regionInfo);
7582    HRegion region = HRegion.newHRegion(tableDir, null, fs, conf, regionInfo, tableDesc, null);
7583    return region;
7584  }

7588   */
7589  public static HRegionFileSystem createRegionDir(Configuration configuration, RegionInfo ri,
7590    Path rootDir) throws IOException {
7591    FileSystem fs = rootDir.getFileSystem(configuration);
7592    Path tableDir = CommonFSUtils.getTableDir(rootDir, ri.getTable());
7593    // If directory already exists, will log warning and keep going. Will try to create
7594    // .regioninfo. If one exists, will overwrite.
7595    return HRegionFileSystem.createRegionOnFileSystem(configuration, fs, tableDir, ri);
7596  }

7655   * @param info       Info for region to be opened.

7657   * @param wal        WAL for region to use. This method will call WAL#setSequenceNumber(long)
7658   *                   passing the result of the call to HRegion#getMinSequenceId() to ensure the
7659   *                   wal id is properly kept up. HRegionStore does this every time it opens a new
7660   *                   region.

7702   * @param rootDir    Root directory for HBase instance
7703   * @param info       Info for region to be opened.
7704   * @param htd        the table descriptor
7705   * @param wal        WAL for region to use. This method will call WAL#setSequenceNumber(long)
7706   *                   passing the result of the call to HRegion#getMinSequenceId() to ensure the
7707   *                   wal id is properly kept up. HRegionStore does this every time it opens a new
7708   *                   region.
7709   * @param rsServices An interface we can request flushes against.

7711   * @return new HRegion

7713  public static HRegion openHRegion(final Configuration conf, final FileSystem fs,

7718    return openHRegionFromTableDir(conf, fs, tableDir, info, htd, wal, rsServices, reporter);

7724   * @param fs         Filesystem to use
7725   * @param info       Info for region to be opened.
7726   * @param htd        the table descriptor
7727   * @param wal        WAL for region to use. This method will call WAL#setSequenceNumber(long)
7728   *                   passing the result of the call to HRegion#getMinSequenceId() to ensure the
7729   *                   wal id is properly kept up. HRegionStore does this every time it opens a new
7730   *                   region.
7731   * @param rsServices An interface we can request flushes against.
7732   * @param reporter   An interface we can report progress against.
7733   * @return new HRegion
7734   * @throws NullPointerException if {@code info} is {@code null}
7735   */
7736  public static HRegion openHRegionFromTableDir(final Configuration conf, final FileSystem fs,
7737    final Path tableDir, final RegionInfo info, final TableDescriptor htd, final WAL wal,
7738    final RegionServerServices rsServices, final CancelableProgressable reporter)
7739    throws IOException {
7740    Objects.requireNonNull(info, "RegionInfo cannot be null");
7741    LOG.debug("Opening region: {}", info);
7742    HRegion r = HRegion.newHRegion(tableDir, wal, fs, conf, info, htd, rsServices);
7743    return r.openHRegion(reporter);
7744  }

7751   * Useful when reopening a closed region (normally for unit tests)
7752   * @param other    original object
7753   * @param reporter An interface we can report progress against.
7754   * @return new HRegion
7755   */
7756  public static HRegion openHRegion(final HRegion other, final CancelableProgressable reporter)
7757    throws IOException {
7758    HRegionFileSystem regionFs = other.getRegionFileSystem();
7759    HRegion r = newHRegion(regionFs.getTableDir(), other.getWAL(), regionFs.getFileSystem(),
7760      other.baseConf, other.getRegionInfo(), other.getTableDescriptor(), null);
7761    return r.openHRegion(reporter);
7762  }

7764  public static Region openHRegion(final Region other, final CancelableProgressable reporter)
7765    throws IOException {
7766    return openHRegion((HRegion) other, reporter);
7767  }
7768
7769  /**
7770   * Open HRegion.
7771   * <p/>
7772   * Calls initialize and sets sequenceId.
7773   * @return Returns <code>this</code>
7774   */
7775  private HRegion openHRegion(final CancelableProgressable reporter) throws IOException {
7776    try {
7777      CompoundConfiguration cConfig =
7778        new CompoundConfiguration().add(conf).addBytesMap(htableDescriptor.getValues());
7779      // Refuse to open the region if we are missing local compression support
7780      TableDescriptorChecker.checkCompression(cConfig, htableDescriptor);
7781      // Refuse to open the region if encryption configuration is incorrect or
7782      // codec support is missing
7783      LOG.debug("checking encryption for " + this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
7784      TableDescriptorChecker.checkEncryption(cConfig, htableDescriptor);
7785      // Refuse to open the region if a required class cannot be loaded
7786      LOG.debug("checking classloading for " + this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
7787      TableDescriptorChecker.checkClassLoading(cConfig, htableDescriptor);
7788      this.openSeqNum = initialize(reporter);
7789      this.mvcc.advanceTo(openSeqNum);
7790      // The openSeqNum must be increased every time when a region is assigned, as we rely on it to
7791      // determine whether a region has been successfully reopened. So here we always write open
7792      // marker, even if the table is read only.
7793      if (
7794        wal != null && getRegionServerServices() != null
7795          && RegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(getRegionInfo())
7796      ) {
7797        writeRegionOpenMarker(wal, openSeqNum);
7798      }
7799    } catch (Throwable t) {
7800      // By coprocessor path wrong region will open failed,
7801      // MetricsRegionWrapperImpl is already init and not close,
7802      // add region close when open failed
7803      try {
7804        // It is not required to write sequence id file when region open is failed.
7805        // Passing true to skip the sequence id file write.
7806        this.close(true);
7807      } catch (Throwable e) {
7808        LOG.warn("Open region: {} failed. Try close region but got exception ",
7809          this.getRegionInfo(), e);
7810      }
7811      throw t;
7812    }
7813    return this;
7814  }
7815
7816  /**
7817   * Open a Region on a read-only file-system (like hdfs snapshots)
7818   * @param conf The Configuration object to use.
7819   * @param fs   Filesystem to use
7820   * @param info Info for region to be opened.
7821   * @param htd  the table descriptor
7822   * @return new HRegion
7823   * @throws NullPointerException if {@code info} is {@code null}
7824   */
7825  public static HRegion openReadOnlyFileSystemHRegion(final Configuration conf, final FileSystem fs,
7826    final Path tableDir, RegionInfo info, final TableDescriptor htd) throws IOException {
7827    Objects.requireNonNull(info, "RegionInfo cannot be null");
7828    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
7829      LOG.debug("Opening region (readOnly filesystem): " + info);
7830    }
7831    if (info.getReplicaId() <= 0) {
7832      info = RegionReplicaUtil.getRegionInfoForReplica(info, 1);
7833    }
7834    HRegion r = HRegion.newHRegion(tableDir, null, fs, conf, info, htd, null);
7835    r.writestate.setReadOnly(true);
7836    return r.openHRegion(null);
7837  }
7838
7839  public static HRegion warmupHRegion(final RegionInfo info, final TableDescriptor htd,
7840    final WAL wal, final Configuration conf, final RegionServerServices rsServices,
7841    final CancelableProgressable reporter) throws IOException {
7842
7843    Objects.requireNonNull(info, "RegionInfo cannot be null");
7844    LOG.debug("Warmup {}", info);
7845    Path rootDir = CommonFSUtils.getRootDir(conf);
7846    Path tableDir = CommonFSUtils.getTableDir(rootDir, info.getTable());
7847    FileSystem fs = null;
7848    if (rsServices != null) {
7849      fs = rsServices.getFileSystem();
7850    }
7851    if (fs == null) {
7852      fs = rootDir.getFileSystem(conf);
7853    }
7854    HRegion r = HRegion.newHRegion(tableDir, wal, fs, conf, info, htd, null);
7855    r.initializeWarmup(reporter);
7856    r.close();
7857    return r;
7858  }

7872  /**
7873   * Determines if the specified row is within the row range specified by the specified RegionInfo
7874   * @param info RegionInfo that specifies the row range
7875   * @param row  row to be checked
7876   * @return true if the row is within the range specified by the RegionInfo
7877   */
7878  public static boolean rowIsInRange(RegionInfo info, final byte[] row) {
7879    return ((info.getStartKey().length == 0) || (Bytes.compareTo(info.getStartKey(), row) <= 0))
7880      && ((info.getEndKey().length == 0) || (Bytes.compareTo(info.getEndKey(), row) > 0));
7881  }
7882
7883  public static boolean rowIsInRange(RegionInfo info, final byte[] row, final int offset,
7884    final short length) {
7885    return ((info.getStartKey().length == 0)
7886      || (Bytes.compareTo(info.getStartKey(), 0, info.getStartKey().length, row, offset, length)
7887          <= 0))
7888      && ((info.getEndKey().length == 0)
7889        || (Bytes.compareTo(info.getEndKey(), 0, info.getEndKey().length, row, offset, length)
7890            > 0));
7891  }
7892
7893  @Override
7894  public Result get(final Get get) throws IOException {
7895    prepareGet(get);
7896    List<Cell> results = get(get, true);
7897    boolean stale = this.getRegionInfo().getReplicaId() != 0;
7898    return Result.create(results, get.isCheckExistenceOnly() ? !results.isEmpty() : null, stale);
7899  }
7900
7901  void prepareGet(final Get get) throws IOException {
7902    checkRow(get.getRow(), "Get");
7903    // Verify families are all valid
7904    if (get.hasFamilies()) {
7905      for (byte[] family : get.familySet()) {
7906        checkFamily(family);
7907      }
7908    } else { // Adding all families to scanner
7909      for (byte[] family : this.htableDescriptor.getColumnFamilyNames()) {
7910        get.addFamily(family);
7911      }
7912    }
7913  }
7914
7915  @Override
7916  public List<Cell> get(Get get, boolean withCoprocessor) throws IOException {
7917    return get(get, withCoprocessor, HConstants.NO_NONCE, HConstants.NO_NONCE);
7918  }
7919
7920  private List<Cell> get(Get get, boolean withCoprocessor, long nonceGroup, long nonce)
7921    throws IOException {
7922    return TraceUtil.trace(() -> getInternal(get, withCoprocessor, nonceGroup, nonce),
7923      () -> createRegionSpan("Region.get"));
7924  }
7925
7926  private List<Cell> getInternal(Get get, boolean withCoprocessor, long nonceGroup, long nonce)
7927    throws IOException {
7928    List<Cell> results = new ArrayList<>();
7929
7930    // pre-get CP hook
7931    if (withCoprocessor && (coprocessorHost != null)) {
7932      if (coprocessorHost.preGet(get, results)) {
7933        metricsUpdateForGet();
7934        return results;
7935      }
7936    }
7937    Scan scan = new Scan(get);
7938    if (scan.getLoadColumnFamiliesOnDemandValue() == null) {
7939      scan.setLoadColumnFamiliesOnDemand(isLoadingCfsOnDemandDefault());
7940    }
7941    try (RegionScanner scanner = getScanner(scan, null, nonceGroup, nonce)) {
7942      List<Cell> tmp = new ArrayList<>();
7943      scanner.next(tmp);
7944      // Copy EC to heap, then close the scanner.
7945      // This can be an EXPENSIVE call. It may make an extra copy from offheap to onheap buffers.
7946      // See more details in HBASE-26036.
7947      for (Cell cell : tmp) {
7948        results.add(CellUtil.cloneIfNecessary(cell));
7949      }
7950    }
7951
7952    // post-get CP hook
7953    if (withCoprocessor && (coprocessorHost != null)) {
7954      coprocessorHost.postGet(get, results);
7955    }
7956
7957    metricsUpdateForGet();
7958
7959    return results;
7960  }
7961
7962  void metricsUpdateForGet() {
7963    if (this.metricsRegion != null) {
7964      this.metricsRegion.updateGet();
7965    }
7966    if (this.rsServices != null && this.rsServices.getMetrics() != null) {
7967      rsServices.getMetrics().updateReadQueryMeter(this, 1);
7968    }
7969
7970  }
7971
7972  @Override
7973  public Result mutateRow(RowMutations rm) throws IOException {
7974    return mutateRow(rm, HConstants.NO_NONCE, HConstants.NO_NONCE);
7975  }
7976
7977  public Result mutateRow(RowMutations rm, long nonceGroup, long nonce) throws IOException {
7978    final List<Mutation> m = rm.getMutations();
7979    OperationStatus[] statuses = batchMutate(m.toArray(new Mutation[0]), true, nonceGroup, nonce);
7980
7981    List<Result> results = new ArrayList<>();
7982    for (OperationStatus status : statuses) {
7983      if (status.getResult() != null) {
7984        results.add(status.getResult());
7985      }
7986    }
7987
7988    if (results.isEmpty()) {
7989      return null;
7990    }
7991
7992    // Merge the results of the Increment/Append operations
7993    List<Cell> cells = new ArrayList<>();
7994    for (Result result : results) {
7995      if (result.rawCells() != null) {
7996        cells.addAll(Arrays.asList(result.rawCells()));
7997      }
7998    }
7999    return Result.create(cells);
8000  }
8001
8002  /**
8003   * Perform atomic (all or none) mutations within the region.
8004   * @param mutations  The list of mutations to perform. <code>mutations</code> can contain
8005   *                   operations for multiple rows. Caller has to ensure that all rows are
8006   *                   contained in this region.
8007   * @param rowsToLock Rows to lock
8008   * @param nonceGroup Optional nonce group of the operation (client Id)
8009   * @param nonce      Optional nonce of the operation (unique random id to ensure "more
8010   *                   idempotence") If multiple rows are locked care should be taken that
8011   *                   <code>rowsToLock</code> is sorted in order to avoid deadlocks.
8012   */
8013  @Override
8014  public void mutateRowsWithLocks(Collection<Mutation> mutations, Collection<byte[]> rowsToLock,
8015    long nonceGroup, long nonce) throws IOException {
8016    batchMutate(new MutationBatchOperation(this, mutations.toArray(new Mutation[mutations.size()]),
8017      true, nonceGroup, nonce) {
8018      @Override
8019      public MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation>
8020        lockRowsAndBuildMiniBatch(List<RowLock> acquiredRowLocks) throws IOException {
8021        RowLock prevRowLock = null;
8022        for (byte[] row : rowsToLock) {
8023          try {
8024            RowLock rowLock = region.getRowLock(row, false, prevRowLock); // write lock
8025            if (rowLock != prevRowLock) {
8026              acquiredRowLocks.add(rowLock);
8027              prevRowLock = rowLock;
8028            }
8029          } catch (IOException ioe) {
8030            LOG.warn("Failed getting lock, row={}, in region {}", Bytes.toStringBinary(row), this,
8031              ioe);
8032            throw ioe;
8033          }
8034        }
8035        return createMiniBatch(size(), size());
8036      }
8037    });
8038  }
8039
8040  /** Returns statistics about the current load of the region */
8041  public ClientProtos.RegionLoadStats getLoadStatistics() {
8042    if (!regionStatsEnabled) {
8043      return null;
8044    }
8045    ClientProtos.RegionLoadStats.Builder stats = ClientProtos.RegionLoadStats.newBuilder();
8046    stats.setMemStoreLoad((int) (Math.min(100,
8047      (this.memStoreSizing.getMemStoreSize().getHeapSize() * 100) / this.memstoreFlushSize)));
8048    if (rsServices.getHeapMemoryManager() != null) {
8049      // the HeapMemoryManager uses -0.0 to signal a problem asking the JVM,
8050      // so we could just do the calculation below and we'll get a 0.
8051      // treating it as a special case analogous to no HMM instead so that it can be
8052      // programatically treated different from using <1% of heap.
8053      final float occupancy = rsServices.getHeapMemoryManager().getHeapOccupancyPercent();
8054      if (occupancy != HeapMemoryManager.HEAP_OCCUPANCY_ERROR_VALUE) {
8055        stats.setHeapOccupancy((int) (occupancy * 100));
8056      }
8057    }
8058    stats.setCompactionPressure((int) (rsServices.getCompactionPressure() * 100 > 100
8059      ? 100
8060      : rsServices.getCompactionPressure() * 100));
8061    return stats.build();
8062  }

8066    return append(append, HConstants.NO_NONCE, HConstants.NO_NONCE);
8067  }
8068
8069  public Result append(Append append, long nonceGroup, long nonce) throws IOException {
8070    return TraceUtil.trace(() -> {
8071      checkReadOnly();
8072      checkResources();
8073      startRegionOperation(Operation.APPEND);
8074      try {
8075        // All edits for the given row (across all column families) must happen atomically.
8076        return mutate(append, true, nonceGroup, nonce).getResult();
8077      } finally {
8078        closeRegionOperation(Operation.APPEND);
8079      }
8080    }, () -> createRegionSpan("Region.append"));
8081  }

8093      try {
8094        // All edits for the given row (across all column families) must happen atomically.
8095        return mutate(increment, true, nonceGroup, nonce).getResult();

8098      }

8102  private WALKeyImpl createWALKeyForWALAppend(boolean isReplay, BatchOperation<?> batchOp, long now,
8103    long nonceGroup, long nonce) {
8104    WALKeyImpl walKey = isReplay
8105      ? new WALKeyImpl(this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes(),
8106        this.htableDescriptor.getTableName(), SequenceId.NO_SEQUENCE_ID, now,
8107        batchOp.getClusterIds(), nonceGroup, nonce, mvcc)
8108      : new WALKeyImpl(this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes(),
8109        this.htableDescriptor.getTableName(), SequenceId.NO_SEQUENCE_ID, now,
8110        batchOp.getClusterIds(), nonceGroup, nonce, mvcc, this.getReplicationScope());
8111    if (isReplay) {
8112      walKey.setOrigLogSeqNum(batchOp.getOrigLogSeqNum());
8113    }
8114    return walKey;
8115  }
8116
8117  /** Returns writeEntry associated with this append */
8118  private WriteEntry doWALAppend(WALEdit walEdit, BatchOperation<?> batchOp,
8119    MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, long now, NonceKey nonceKey)
8120    throws IOException {
8121    Preconditions.checkArgument(walEdit != null && !walEdit.isEmpty(), "WALEdit is null or empty!");
8122    Preconditions.checkArgument(
8123      !walEdit.isReplay() || batchOp.getOrigLogSeqNum() != SequenceId.NO_SEQUENCE_ID,
8124      "Invalid replay sequence Id for replay WALEdit!");
8125
8126    WALKeyImpl walKey = createWALKeyForWALAppend(walEdit.isReplay(), batchOp, now,
8127      nonceKey.getNonceGroup(), nonceKey.getNonce());
8128    // don't call the coproc hook for writes to the WAL caused by
8129    // system lifecycle events like flushes or compactions
8130    if (this.coprocessorHost != null && !walEdit.isMetaEdit()) {
8131      this.coprocessorHost.preWALAppend(walKey, walEdit);
8132    }
8133    try {
8134      long txid = this.wal.appendData(this.getRegionInfo(), walKey, walEdit);
8135      WriteEntry writeEntry = walKey.getWriteEntry();
8136      // Call sync on our edit.
8137      if (txid != 0) {
8138        sync(txid, batchOp.durability);
8139      }
8140      /**
8141       * If above {@link HRegion#sync} throws Exception, the RegionServer should be aborted and
8142       * following {@link BatchOperation#writeMiniBatchOperationsToMemStore} will not be executed,
8143       * so there is no need to replicate to secondary replica, for this reason here we attach the
8144       * region replication action after the {@link HRegion#sync} is successful.
8145       */
8146      this.attachRegionReplicationInWALAppend(batchOp, miniBatchOp, walKey, walEdit, writeEntry);
8147      return writeEntry;
8148    } catch (IOException ioe) {
8149      if (walKey.getWriteEntry() != null) {
8150        mvcc.complete(walKey.getWriteEntry());
8151      }
8152
8153      /**
8154       * If {@link WAL#sync} get a timeout exception, the only correct way is to abort the region
8155       * server, as the design of {@link WAL#sync}, is to succeed or die, there is no 'failure'. It
8156       * is usually not a big deal is because we set a very large default value(5 minutes) for
8157       * {@link AbstractFSWAL#WAL_SYNC_TIMEOUT_MS}, usually the WAL system will abort the region
8158       * server if it can not finish the sync within 5 minutes.
8159       */
8160      if (ioe instanceof WALSyncTimeoutIOException) {
8161        if (rsServices != null) {
8162          rsServices.abort("WAL sync timeout,forcing server shutdown", ioe);
8163        }
8164      }
8165      throw ioe;
8166    }
8167  }
8168
8169  /**
8170   * Attach {@link RegionReplicationSink#add} to the mvcc writeEntry for replicating to region
8171   * replica.
8172   */
8173  private void attachRegionReplicationInWALAppend(BatchOperation<?> batchOp,
8174    MiniBatchOperationInProgress<Mutation> miniBatchOp, WALKeyImpl walKey, WALEdit walEdit,
8175    WriteEntry writeEntry) {
8176    if (!regionReplicationSink.isPresent()) {
8177      return;
8178    }
8179    /**
8180     * If {@link HRegion#regionReplicationSink} is present,only {@link MutationBatchOperation} is
8181     * used and {@link NonceKey} is all the same for {@link Mutation}s in
8182     * {@link MutationBatchOperation},so for HBASE-26993 case 1,if
8183     * {@link MiniBatchOperationInProgress#getWalEditForReplicateSkipWAL} is not null and we could
8184     * enter {@link HRegion#doWALAppend},that means partial {@link Mutation}s are
8185     * {@link Durability#SKIP_WAL}, we use
8186     * {@link MiniBatchOperationInProgress#getWalEditForReplicateSkipWAL} to replicate to region
8187     * replica,but if {@link MiniBatchOperationInProgress#getWalEditForReplicateSkipWAL} is
8188     * null,that means there is no {@link Mutation} is {@link Durability#SKIP_WAL},so we just use
8189     * walEdit to replicate.
8190     */
8191    assert batchOp instanceof MutationBatchOperation;
8192    WALEdit walEditToUse = miniBatchOp.getWalEditForReplicateIfExistsSkipWAL();
8193    if (walEditToUse == null) {
8194      walEditToUse = walEdit;
8195    }
8196    doAttachReplicateRegionReplicaAction(walKey, walEditToUse, writeEntry);
8197  }
8198
8199  /**
8200   * Attach {@link RegionReplicationSink#add} to the mvcc writeEntry for replicating to region
8201   * replica.
8202   */
8203  private void doAttachReplicateRegionReplicaAction(WALKeyImpl walKey, WALEdit walEdit,
8204    WriteEntry writeEntry) {
8205    if (walEdit == null || walEdit.isEmpty()) {
8206      return;
8207    }
8208    final ServerCall<?> rpcCall = RpcServer.getCurrentServerCallWithCellScanner().orElse(null);
8209    regionReplicationSink.ifPresent(sink -> writeEntry.attachCompletionAction(() -> {
8210      sink.add(walKey, walEdit, rpcCall);
8211    }));
8212  }
8213
8214  public static final long FIXED_OVERHEAD = ClassSize.estimateBase(HRegion.class, false);
8215
8216  // woefully out of date - currently missing:
8217  // 1 x HashMap - coprocessorServiceHandlers
8218  // 6 x LongAdder - numMutationsWithoutWAL, dataInMemoryWithoutWAL,
8219  // checkAndMutateChecksPassed, checkAndMutateChecksFailed, readRequestsCount,
8220  // writeRequestsCount, cpRequestsCount
8221  // 1 x HRegion$WriteState - writestate
8222  // 1 x RegionCoprocessorHost - coprocessorHost
8223  // 1 x RegionSplitPolicy - splitPolicy
8224  // 1 x MetricsRegion - metricsRegion
8225  // 1 x MetricsRegionWrapperImpl - metricsRegionWrapper
8226  // 1 x ReadPointCalculationLock - smallestReadPointCalcLock
8227  public static final long DEEP_OVERHEAD = FIXED_OVERHEAD + ClassSize.OBJECT + // closeLock
8228    (2 * ClassSize.ATOMIC_BOOLEAN) + // closed, closing
8229    (3 * ClassSize.ATOMIC_LONG) + // numPutsWithoutWAL, dataInMemoryWithoutWAL,
8230                                  // compactionsFailed
8231    (3 * ClassSize.CONCURRENT_HASHMAP) + // lockedRows, scannerReadPoints, regionLockHolders
8232    WriteState.HEAP_SIZE + // writestate
8233    ClassSize.CONCURRENT_SKIPLISTMAP + ClassSize.CONCURRENT_SKIPLISTMAP_ENTRY + // stores
8234    (2 * ClassSize.REENTRANT_LOCK) + // lock, updatesLock
8235    MultiVersionConcurrencyControl.FIXED_SIZE // mvcc
8236    + 2 * ClassSize.TREEMAP // maxSeqIdInStores, replicationScopes
8237    + 2 * ClassSize.ATOMIC_INTEGER // majorInProgress, minorInProgress
8238    + ClassSize.STORE_SERVICES // store services
8239    + StoreHotnessProtector.FIXED_SIZE;
8240
8241  @Override
8242  public long heapSize() {
8243    // this does not take into account row locks, recent flushes, mvcc entries, and more
8244    return DEEP_OVERHEAD + stores.values().stream().mapToLong(HStore::heapSize).sum();
8245  }
8246
8247  /**
8248   * Registers a new protocol buffer {@link Service} subclass as a coprocessor endpoint to be
8249   * available for handling {@link #execService(RpcController, CoprocessorServiceCall)} calls.
8250   * <p/>
8251   * Only a single instance may be registered per region for a given {@link Service} subclass (the
8252   * instances are keyed on {@link ServiceDescriptor#getFullName()}.. After the first registration,
8253   * subsequent calls with the same service name will fail with a return value of {@code false}.
8254   * @param instance the {@code Service} subclass instance to expose as a coprocessor endpoint
8255   * @return {@code true} if the registration was successful, {@code false} otherwise
8256   */
8257  public boolean registerService(Service instance) {
8258    // No stacking of instances is allowed for a single service name
8259    ServiceDescriptor serviceDesc = instance.getDescriptorForType();
8260    String serviceName = CoprocessorRpcUtils.getServiceName(serviceDesc);
8261    if (coprocessorServiceHandlers.containsKey(serviceName)) {
8262      LOG.error("Coprocessor service {} already registered, rejecting request from {} in region {}",
8263        serviceName, instance, this);
8264      return false;
8265    }
8266
8267    coprocessorServiceHandlers.put(serviceName, instance);
8268    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
8269      LOG.debug("Registered coprocessor service: region="
8270        + Bytes.toStringBinary(getRegionInfo().getRegionName()) + " service=" + serviceName);
8271    }
8272    return true;
8273  }
8274
8275  /**
8276   * Executes a single protocol buffer coprocessor endpoint {@link Service} method using the
8277   * registered protocol handlers. {@link Service} implementations must be registered via the
8278   * {@link #registerService(Service)} method before they are available.
8279   * @param controller an {@code RpcContoller} implementation to pass to the invoked service
8280   * @param call       a {@code CoprocessorServiceCall} instance identifying the service, method,
8281   *                   and parameters for the method invocation
8282   * @return a protocol buffer {@code Message} instance containing the method's result
8283   * @throws IOException if no registered service handler is found or an error occurs during the
8284   *                     invocation
8285   * @see #registerService(Service)
8286   */
8287  public Message execService(RpcController controller, CoprocessorServiceCall call)
8288    throws IOException {
8289    String serviceName = call.getServiceName();
8290    Service service = coprocessorServiceHandlers.get(serviceName);
8291    if (service == null) {
8292      throw new UnknownProtocolException(null, "No registered coprocessor service found for "
8293        + serviceName + " in region " + Bytes.toStringBinary(getRegionInfo().getRegionName()));
8294    }
8295    ServiceDescriptor serviceDesc = service.getDescriptorForType();
8296
8297    cpRequestsCount.increment();
8298    String methodName = call.getMethodName();
8299    MethodDescriptor methodDesc = CoprocessorRpcUtils.getMethodDescriptor(methodName, serviceDesc);
8300
8301    Message.Builder builder = service.getRequestPrototype(methodDesc).newBuilderForType();
8302
8303    ProtobufUtil.mergeFrom(builder, call.getRequest().toByteArray());
8304    Message request = CoprocessorRpcUtils.getRequest(service, methodDesc, call.getRequest());
8305
8306    if (coprocessorHost != null) {
8307      request = coprocessorHost.preEndpointInvocation(service, methodName, request);
8308    }
8309
8310    final Message.Builder responseBuilder =
8311      service.getResponsePrototype(methodDesc).newBuilderForType();
8312    service.callMethod(methodDesc, controller, request, new RpcCallback<Message>() {
8313      @Override
8314      public void run(Message message) {
8315        if (message != null) {
8316          responseBuilder.mergeFrom(message);
8317        }
8318      }
8319    });
8320
8321    if (coprocessorHost != null) {
8322      coprocessorHost.postEndpointInvocation(service, methodName, request, responseBuilder);
8323    }
8324    IOException exception =
8325      org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.CoprocessorRpcUtils.getControllerException(controller);
8326    if (exception != null) {
8327      throw exception;
8328    }
8329
8330    return responseBuilder.build();
8331  }
8332
8333  public Optional<byte[]> checkSplit() {
8334    return checkSplit(false);
8335  }
8336
8337  /**
8338   * Return the split point. An empty result indicates the region isn't splittable.
8339   */
8340  public Optional<byte[]> checkSplit(boolean force) {
8341    // Can't split META
8342    if (this.getRegionInfo().isMetaRegion()) {
8343      return Optional.empty();
8344    }
8345
8346    // Can't split a region that is closing.
8347    if (this.isClosing()) {
8348      return Optional.empty();
8349    }
8350
8351    if (!force && !splitPolicy.shouldSplit()) {
8352      return Optional.empty();
8353    }
8354
8355    byte[] ret = splitPolicy.getSplitPoint();
8356    if (ret != null && ret.length > 0) {
8357      ret = splitRestriction.getRestrictedSplitPoint(ret);
8358    }
8359
8360    if (ret != null) {
8361      try {
8362        checkRow(ret, "calculated split");
8363      } catch (IOException e) {
8364        LOG.error("Ignoring invalid split for region {}", this, e);
8365        return Optional.empty();
8366      }
8367      return Optional.of(ret);
8368    } else {
8369      return Optional.empty();
8370    }
8371  }
8372
8373  /** Returns The priority that this region should have in the compaction queue */
8374  public int getCompactPriority() {
8375    if (checkSplit().isPresent() && conf.getBoolean(SPLIT_IGNORE_BLOCKING_ENABLED_KEY, false)) {
8376      // if a region should split, split it before compact
8377      return Store.PRIORITY_USER;
8378    }
8379    return stores.values().stream().mapToInt(HStore::getCompactPriority).min()
8380      .orElse(Store.NO_PRIORITY);
8381  }

8384  public RegionCoprocessorHost getCoprocessorHost() {
8385    return coprocessorHost;
8386  }

8388  /** @param coprocessorHost the new coprocessor host */
8389  public void setCoprocessorHost(final RegionCoprocessorHost coprocessorHost) {
8390    this.coprocessorHost = coprocessorHost;
8391  }
8392
8393  @Override
8394  public void startRegionOperation() throws IOException {
8395    startRegionOperation(Operation.ANY);
8396  }
8397
8398  @Override
8399  public void startRegionOperation(Operation op) throws IOException {
8400    boolean isInterruptableOp = false;
8401    switch (op) {
8402      case GET: // interruptible read operations
8403      case SCAN:
8404        isInterruptableOp = true;
8405        checkReadsEnabled();
8406        break;
8407      case INCREMENT: // interruptible write operations
8408      case APPEND:
8409      case PUT:
8410      case DELETE:
8411      case BATCH_MUTATE:
8412      case CHECK_AND_MUTATE:
8413        isInterruptableOp = true;
8414        break;
8415      default: // all others
8416        break;
8417    }
8418    if (
8419      op == Operation.MERGE_REGION || op == Operation.SPLIT_REGION || op == Operation.COMPACT_REGION
8420        || op == Operation.COMPACT_SWITCH
8421    ) {
8422      // split, merge or compact region doesn't need to check the closing/closed state or lock the
8423      // region
8424      return;
8425    }
8426    if (this.closing.get()) {
8427      throw new NotServingRegionException(getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString() + " is closing");
8428    }
8429    lock(lock.readLock());
8430    // Update regionLockHolders ONLY for any startRegionOperation call that is invoked from
8431    // an RPC handler
8432    Thread thisThread = Thread.currentThread();
8433    if (isInterruptableOp) {
8434      regionLockHolders.put(thisThread, true);
8435    }
8436    if (this.closed.get()) {
8437      lock.readLock().unlock();
8438      throw new NotServingRegionException(getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString() + " is closed");
8439    }
8440    // The unit for snapshot is a region. So, all stores for this region must be
8441    // prepared for snapshot operation before proceeding.
8442    if (op == Operation.SNAPSHOT) {
8443      stores.values().forEach(HStore::preSnapshotOperation);
8444    }
8445    try {
8446      if (coprocessorHost != null) {
8447        coprocessorHost.postStartRegionOperation(op);
8448      }
8449    } catch (Exception e) {
8450      if (isInterruptableOp) {
8451        // would be harmless to remove what we didn't add but we know by 'isInterruptableOp'
8452        // if we added this thread to regionLockHolders
8453        regionLockHolders.remove(thisThread);
8454      }
8455      lock.readLock().unlock();
8456      throw new IOException(e);
8457    }
8458  }
8459
8460  @Override
8461  public void closeRegionOperation() throws IOException {
8462    closeRegionOperation(Operation.ANY);
8463  }
8464
8465  @Override
8466  public void closeRegionOperation(Operation operation) throws IOException {
8467    if (operation == Operation.SNAPSHOT) {
8468      stores.values().forEach(HStore::postSnapshotOperation);
8469    }
8470    Thread thisThread = Thread.currentThread();
8471    regionLockHolders.remove(thisThread);
8472    lock.readLock().unlock();
8473    if (coprocessorHost != null) {
8474      coprocessorHost.postCloseRegionOperation(operation);
8475    }
8476  }
8477
8478  /**
8479   * This method needs to be called before any public call that reads or modifies stores in bulk. It
8480   * has to be called just before a try. #closeBulkRegionOperation needs to be called in the try's
8481   * finally block Acquires a writelock and checks if the region is closing or closed.
8482   * @throws NotServingRegionException when the region is closing or closed
8483   * @throws RegionTooBusyException    if failed to get the lock in time
8484   * @throws InterruptedIOException    if interrupted while waiting for a lock
8485   */
8486  private void startBulkRegionOperation(boolean writeLockNeeded) throws IOException {
8487    if (this.closing.get()) {
8488      throw new NotServingRegionException(getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString() + " is closing");
8489    }
8490    if (writeLockNeeded) lock(lock.writeLock());
8491    else lock(lock.readLock());
8492    if (this.closed.get()) {
8493      if (writeLockNeeded) lock.writeLock().unlock();
8494      else lock.readLock().unlock();
8495      throw new NotServingRegionException(getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString() + " is closed");
8496    }
8497    regionLockHolders.put(Thread.currentThread(), true);
8498  }
8499
8500  /**
8501   * Closes the lock. This needs to be called in the finally block corresponding to the try block of
8502   * #startRegionOperation
8503   */
8504  private void closeBulkRegionOperation() {
8505    regionLockHolders.remove(Thread.currentThread());
8506    if (lock.writeLock().isHeldByCurrentThread()) lock.writeLock().unlock();
8507    else lock.readLock().unlock();
8508  }
8509
8510  /**
8511   * Update LongAdders for number of puts without wal and the size of possible data loss. These
8512   * information are exposed by the region server metrics.
8513   */
8514  private void recordMutationWithoutWal(final Map<byte[], List<Cell>> familyMap) {
8515    numMutationsWithoutWAL.increment();
8516    if (numMutationsWithoutWAL.sum() <= 1) {
8517      LOG.info("writing data to region " + this
8518        + " with WAL disabled. Data may be lost in the event of a crash.");
8519    }
8520
8521    long mutationSize = 0;
8522    for (List<Cell> cells : familyMap.values()) {
8523      // Optimization: 'foreach' loop is not used. See:
8524      // HBASE-12023 HRegion.applyFamilyMapToMemstore creates too many iterator objects
8525      assert cells instanceof RandomAccess;
8526      int listSize = cells.size();
8527      for (int i = 0; i < listSize; i++) {
8528        Cell cell = cells.get(i);
8529        mutationSize += cell.getSerializedSize();
8530      }
8531    }
8532
8533    dataInMemoryWithoutWAL.add(mutationSize);
8534  }
8535
8536  private void lock(final Lock lock) throws IOException {
8537    lock(lock, 1);
8538  }
8539
8540  /**
8541   * Try to acquire a lock. Throw RegionTooBusyException if failed to get the lock in time. Throw
8542   * InterruptedIOException if interrupted while waiting for the lock.
8543   */
8544  private void lock(final Lock lock, final int multiplier) throws IOException {
8545    try {
8546      final long waitTime = Math.min(maxBusyWaitDuration,
8547        busyWaitDuration * Math.min(multiplier, maxBusyWaitMultiplier));
8548      if (!lock.tryLock(waitTime, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS)) {
8549        // Don't print millis. Message is used as a key over in
8550        // RetriesExhaustedWithDetailsException processing.
8551        final String regionName =
8552          this.getRegionInfo() == null ? "unknown" : this.getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString();
8553        final String serverName = this.getRegionServerServices() == null
8554          ? "unknown"
8555          : (this.getRegionServerServices().getServerName() == null
8556            ? "unknown"
8557            : this.getRegionServerServices().getServerName().toString());
8558        RegionTooBusyException rtbe = new RegionTooBusyException(
8559          "Failed to obtain lock; regionName=" + regionName + ", server=" + serverName);
8560        LOG.warn("Region is too busy to allow lock acquisition.", rtbe);
8561        throw rtbe;
8562      }
8563    } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
8564      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
8565        LOG.debug("Interrupted while waiting for a lock in region {}", this);
8566      }
8567      throw throwOnInterrupt(ie);
8568    }
8569  }
8570
8571  /**
8572   * Calls sync with the given transaction ID
8573   * @param txid should sync up to which transaction
8574   * @throws IOException If anything goes wrong with DFS
8575   */
8576  private void sync(long txid, Durability durability) throws IOException {
8577    if (this.getRegionInfo().isMetaRegion()) {
8578      this.wal.sync(txid);
8579    } else {
8580      switch (durability) {
8581        case USE_DEFAULT:
8582          // do what table defaults to
8583          if (shouldSyncWAL()) {
8584            this.wal.sync(txid);
8585          }
8586          break;
8587        case SKIP_WAL:
8588          // nothing do to
8589          break;
8590        case ASYNC_WAL:
8591          // nothing do to
8592          break;
8593        case SYNC_WAL:
8594          this.wal.sync(txid, false);
8595          break;
8596        case FSYNC_WAL:
8597          this.wal.sync(txid, true);
8598          break;
8599        default:
8600          throw new RuntimeException("Unknown durability " + durability);
8601      }
8602    }
8603  }
8604
8605  /**
8606   * Check whether we should sync the wal from the table's durability settings
8607   */
8608  private boolean shouldSyncWAL() {
8609    return regionDurability.ordinal() > Durability.ASYNC_WAL.ordinal();
8610  }

8626  @Override
8627  public CompactionState getCompactionState() {
8628    boolean hasMajor = majorInProgress.get() > 0, hasMinor = minorInProgress.get() > 0;
8629    return (hasMajor
8630      ? (hasMinor ? CompactionState.MAJOR_AND_MINOR : CompactionState.MAJOR)
8631      : (hasMinor ? CompactionState.MINOR : CompactionState.NONE));
8632  }

8634  public void reportCompactionRequestStart(boolean isMajor) {
8635    (isMajor ? majorInProgress : minorInProgress).incrementAndGet();
8636  }
8637
8638  public void reportCompactionRequestEnd(boolean isMajor, int numFiles, long filesSizeCompacted) {
8639    int newValue = (isMajor ? majorInProgress : minorInProgress).decrementAndGet();
8640
8641    // metrics
8642    compactionsFinished.increment();
8643    compactionNumFilesCompacted.add(numFiles);
8644    compactionNumBytesCompacted.add(filesSizeCompacted);
8645
8646    assert newValue >= 0;
8647  }

8669  /**
8670   * If a handler thread is eligible for interrupt, make it ineligible. Should be paired with
8671   * {{@link #enableInterrupts()}.
8672   */
8673  void disableInterrupts() {
8674    regionLockHolders.computeIfPresent(Thread.currentThread(), (t, b) -> false);
8675  }
8676
8677  /**
8678   * If a handler thread was made ineligible for interrupt via {{@link #disableInterrupts()}, make
8679   * it eligible again. No-op if interrupts are already enabled.
8680   */
8681  void enableInterrupts() {
8682    regionLockHolders.computeIfPresent(Thread.currentThread(), (t, b) -> true);
8683  }
8684
8685  /**
8686   * Interrupt any region options that have acquired the region lock via
8687   * {@link #startRegionOperation(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.Region.Operation)}, or
8688   * {@link #startBulkRegionOperation(boolean)}.
8689   */
8690  private void interruptRegionOperations() {
8691    for (Map.Entry<Thread, Boolean> entry : regionLockHolders.entrySet()) {
8692      // An entry in this map will have a boolean value indicating if it is currently
8693      // eligible for interrupt; if so, we should interrupt it.
8694      if (entry.getValue().booleanValue()) {
8695        entry.getKey().interrupt();
8696      }
8697    }
8698  }
8699
8700  /**
8701   * Check thread interrupt status and throw an exception if interrupted.
8702   * @throws NotServingRegionException if region is closing
8703   * @throws InterruptedIOException    if interrupted but region is not closing
8704   */
8705  // Package scope for tests
8706  void checkInterrupt() throws NotServingRegionException, InterruptedIOException {
8707    if (Thread.interrupted()) {
8708      if (this.closing.get()) {
8709        throw new NotServingRegionException(
8710          getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString() + " is closing");
8711      }
8712      throw new InterruptedIOException();
8713    }
8714  }
8715
8716  /**
8717   * Throw the correct exception upon interrupt
8718   * @param t cause
8719   */
8720  // Package scope for tests
8721  IOException throwOnInterrupt(Throwable t) {
8722    if (this.closing.get()) {
8723      return (NotServingRegionException) new NotServingRegionException(
8724        getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString() + " is closing").initCause(t);
8725    }
8726    return (InterruptedIOException) new InterruptedIOException().initCause(t);
8727  }

8729  /**
8730   * {@inheritDoc}
8731   */
8732  @Override
8733  public void onConfigurationChange(Configuration conf) {
8734    this.storeHotnessProtector.update(conf);
8735    // update coprocessorHost if the configuration has changed.
8736    if (
8737      CoprocessorConfigurationUtil.checkConfigurationChange(getReadOnlyConfiguration(), conf,
8738        CoprocessorHost.REGION_COPROCESSOR_CONF_KEY,
8739        CoprocessorHost.USER_REGION_COPROCESSOR_CONF_KEY)
8740    ) {
8741      LOG.info("Update the system coprocessors because the configuration has changed");
8742      decorateRegionConfiguration(conf);
8743      this.coprocessorHost = new RegionCoprocessorHost(this, rsServices, conf);
8744    }
8745  }

8773  //// method for debugging tests
8774  void throwException(String title, String regionName) {
8775    StringBuilder buf = new StringBuilder();
8776    buf.append(title + ", ");
8777    buf.append(getRegionInfo().toString());
8778    buf.append(getRegionInfo().isMetaRegion() ? " meta region " : " ");
8779    buf.append("stores: ");
8780    for (HStore s : stores.values()) {
8781      buf.append(s.getColumnFamilyDescriptor().getNameAsString());
8782      buf.append(" size: ");
8783      buf.append(s.getMemStoreSize().getDataSize());
8784      buf.append(" ");
8785    }
8786    buf.append("end-of-stores");
8787    buf.append(", memstore size ");
8788    buf.append(getMemStoreDataSize());
8789    if (getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString().startsWith(regionName)) {
8790      throw new RuntimeException(buf.toString());
8791    }
8792  }

8794  @Override
8795  public void requestCompaction(String why, int priority, boolean major,
8796    CompactionLifeCycleTracker tracker) throws IOException {
8797    if (major) {
8798      stores.values().forEach(HStore::triggerMajorCompaction);
8799    }
8800    rsServices.getCompactionRequestor().requestCompaction(this, why, priority, tracker,
8801      RpcServer.getRequestUser().orElse(null));
8802  }
8803
8804  @Override
8805  public void requestCompaction(byte[] family, String why, int priority, boolean major,
8806    CompactionLifeCycleTracker tracker) throws IOException {
8807    HStore store = stores.get(family);
8808    if (store == null) {
8809      throw new NoSuchColumnFamilyException("column family " + Bytes.toString(family)
8810        + " does not exist in region " + getRegionInfo().getRegionNameAsString());
8811    }
8812    if (major) {
8813      store.triggerMajorCompaction();
8814    }
8815    rsServices.getCompactionRequestor().requestCompaction(this, store, why, priority, tracker,
8816      RpcServer.getRequestUser().orElse(null));
8817  }
8818
8819  private void requestFlushIfNeeded() throws RegionTooBusyException {
8820    if (isFlushSize(this.memStoreSizing.getMemStoreSize())) {
8821      requestFlush();
8822    }
8823  }
8824
8825  private void requestFlush() {
8826    if (this.rsServices == null) {
8827      return;
8828    }
8829    requestFlush0(FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
8830  }
8831
8832  private void requestFlush0(FlushLifeCycleTracker tracker) {
8833    boolean shouldFlush = false;
8834    synchronized (writestate) {
8835      if (!this.writestate.isFlushRequested()) {
8836        shouldFlush = true;
8837        writestate.flushRequested = true;
8838      }
8839    }
8840    if (shouldFlush) {
8841      // Make request outside of synchronize block; HBASE-818.
8842      this.rsServices.getFlushRequester().requestFlush(this, tracker);
8843      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
8844        LOG.debug("Flush requested on " + this.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
8845      }
8846    } else {
8847      tracker.notExecuted("Flush already requested on " + this);
8848    }
8849  }
8850
8851  @Override
8852  public void requestFlush(FlushLifeCycleTracker tracker) throws IOException {
8853    requestFlush0(tracker);
8854  }
8855
8856  /**
8857   * This method modifies the region's configuration in order to inject replication-related features
8858   * @param conf region configurations
8859   */
8860  private static void decorateRegionConfiguration(Configuration conf) {
8861    if (ReplicationUtils.isReplicationForBulkLoadDataEnabled(conf)) {
8862      String plugins = conf.get(CoprocessorHost.REGION_COPROCESSOR_CONF_KEY, "");
8863      String replicationCoprocessorClass = ReplicationObserver.class.getCanonicalName();
8864      if (!plugins.contains(replicationCoprocessorClass)) {
8865        conf.set(CoprocessorHost.REGION_COPROCESSOR_CONF_KEY,
8866          (plugins.equals("") ? "" : (plugins + ",")) + replicationCoprocessorClass);
8867      }
8868    }
8869  }
